text: Pakistan is working on a draft bill to permanently ban 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed-led Jamaat-ud-Dawah as well as other terror groups and individuals, according to reports. This comes after Paris-based money-laundering watchdog, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), placed Pakistan on its global terrorist-financing watchlist over its alleged support and inaction against terrorism.
summary: पाकिस्तान ने आतंकवादी संगठनों पर स्थायी प्रतिबंध लगाया: रिपोर्ट

text: A 21-year-old drunk tourist in Zimbabwe had his arm ripped off after he jumped into a pool that had three crocodiles, an official said. He was saved by two men who jumped into the pool and pulled him to safety. Although the tourist sustained several fractures, he is said to be in a stable condition.
summary: नशे में पर्यटक, मगरमच्छों से भरे पूल में कूद जाता है, बच जाता है

text: A special CBI court on Sunday issued non-bailable warrants against jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi in connection with cases related to the $2.1-billion PNB fraud. A Mumbai court had first issued non-bailable warrants against the duo on Enforcement Directorate's request in March. While Choksi refused to come back to India citing health reasons, Nirav Modi cited business engagements abroad.
summary: नीरव मोदी, मेहुल चोकसी के खिलाफ दूसरा गैर-जमानती वारंट

text: Dubai-based cryptocurrency firm Alibabacoin Foundation has denied allegations of trademark infringement by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group. Alibabacoin said its name is an "inherently generic word" that originates from the very region where it is being asked to stop its use. Notably, Ali Baba is the protagonist's name in the Middle Eastern folk tale 'Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves'.
summary: दुबई क्रिप्टोक्यूरेंसी फर्म अलीबाबा ट्रेडमार्क उल्लंघन से इनकार करती है

text: A teaser of the upcoming film 'Raazi', featuring its lead actress Alia Bhatt, has been released. "Sehmat ho gayi hai #Raazi," wrote the film's official Twitter handle while sharing the clip. Based on the book 'Calling Sehmat: A Novel' by Harinder S Sikka, the film revolves around a Kashmiri girl who marries a Pakistani army officer, portrayed by Vicky Kaushal.
summary: आलिया भट्ट के किरदार में 'रज़ी' का टीज़र

text: Discussing his appearance, actor Sidharth Malhotra said, "I don't consider myself as more than an average-looking guy." He added, "I don't believe there is something exceptional in the way I look." Sidharth had earlier talked about his struggling days in Mumbai and said that for a year, he only did photo shoots as it provided him the money to survive.
summary: मुझे नहीं लगता कि मैं एक औसत दिखने वाले लड़के से अधिक हूं: सिद्धार्थ

text: Virat Kohli, while talking about online trolls that he and his wife actress Anushka Sharma face, said, "We don't pay attention to it." Virat added, "People getting nasty towards other people and actually enjoying negativity on social media is something very alarming." After their marriage, Anushka was trolled for Virat's poor performance in the first Test match against South Africa.
summary: अनुष्का और मैं ऑनलाइन ट्रोल्स पर ध्यान नहीं देते: विराट

text: As per reports, Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja's wedding will take place in Montreux, Switzerland from May 9 to May 12. It has been speculated that Switzerland was chosen as the venue after the Swiss government reportedly showed interest in the wedding. It was earlier reported that the wedding would take place in either Jodhpur or Udaipur.
summary: 9-12 मई तक स्विट्जरलैंड में सोनम, आनंद की शादी: रिपोर्ट

text: England men's basketball team player Jamell Anderson proposed to his girlfriend Georgia Jones on court after their victory against Cameroon at the Commonwealth Games on Sunday. England men's team gathered in a post-game huddle as England women's basketball team player Jones watched on. As the huddle broke, Anderson was waiting down on one knee holding an engagement ring.
summary: बास्केटबॉल खिलाड़ी खेल के बाद अदालत में प्रेमिका को प्रपोज करता है

text: Lokesh Rahul smashed the fastest-ever Indian Premier League fifty off 14 balls as Ravichandran Ashwin-led Kings XI Punjab defeated Delhi Daredevils on Sunday. Rahul, who scored 51 off 16 balls, became the first player to score a fifty inside three overs of an innings in T20 cricket. Notably, the match was Ravichandran Ashwin's first as captain of a T20 side.
summary: राहुल का Ã Â € ™ का रिकॉर्ड 50 अश्विन को आईपीएल कप्तान के रूप में 1 मैच जीतने में मदद करता है

text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg has said the company is doing audits but also warned it could find more data breaches like the recent data leak. Sandberg further stressed that the social media platform "cared about privacy" but "I think we got the balance wrong." Facebook didn't inform users about the leak because "we thought" it was deleted, she added.
summary: फेसबुक हालिया डेटा लीक जैसे अधिक उल्लंघनों का पता लगा सकता है: सीओओ

text: The #DeleteFacebook campaign, which emerged in mid-March after the revelation of Facebook's data controversy, still has over 300 participants, as compared to 1,700 two weeks ago, according to Bloomberg. Some of the notable figures who deleted their Facebook accounts include WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, Jim Carrey, and Elon Musk who deleted SpaceX and Tesla's Facebook pages.
summary: # डीटेलफेसबुक में अभी भी 2 सप्ताह के बाद 300 प्रतिभागी हैं

text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday took a ride in the Namma Metro in Bengaluru during his Karnataka Assembly elections campaign. Gandhi boarded the metro at Vidhana Soudha station and got off at MG Road station where he also visited a bookstore. The Karnataka elections are scheduled for May 12 and counting of votes will be held on May 15.
summary: कर्नाटक चुनाव प्रचार के दौरान राहुल ने बेंगलुरु मेट्रो की सवारी की

text: The Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha on Saturday wrote a letter in blood to PM Narendra Modi, demanding the withdrawal of the Centre's review petition against the Supreme Court's order which allegedly dilutes the SC/ST act. The petition was filed following the violent Bharat Bandh protests, which reportedly claimed ten lives.
summary: SC / ST एक्ट की समीक्षा के खिलाफ हिंदू संगठन खून से पीएम को लिखता है

text: A 45-year-old man was tied to a tree and stoned to death for allegedly raping a seven-year-old girl in Telangana's Donkeshwar village. Beaten with stones and sticks, the man fell unconscious and was taken to a hospital but died on the way, police said. The man was drunk when he allegedly lured his neighbour's daughter with chocolates and raped her.

text: Qari Hekmat, a top Islamic State commander in Afghanistan was killed in an air strike carried out by Afghan forces on Thursday, the Afghan Defence Ministry said. Hekmat was the founder of Islamic State in northern Afghanistan and had recruited several fighters. Mawlawi Habib-ul-Rahman was appointed as his successor.

text: An Israel Defence Forces (IDF) spokesperson tweeted an image of a group of Palestinian children seen through a sniper's lens, along with a warning that read, "We see you very well." Adding that Israel will not allow anyone to threaten its security and citizens, the spokesperson wrote, "Whoever thinks he can evade the lens of our forces is wrong."

text: Former Brazilian President Lula da Silva on Saturday surrendered to police to begin a 12-year prison sentence for taking bribes, ending a two-day stand-off after missing a court deadline to hand himself in. text: Punjab National Bank's Managing Director Sunil Mehta has said the state-run lender will be able to come out of the "entire problem and pain" created by the Nirav Modi scam in the next six months. text: A businessman allegedly posed as a slum dweller to get his son admitted to Delhi's Sanskriti School through its quota for economically weaker sections in 2013. text: A case of criminal intimidation has been filed against comedian Kapil Sharma by the entertainment news portal SpotboyE and its editor Vickey Lalwani after the comedian abused and threatened Lalwani. text: In a unique coincidence, former England captain Alec Stewart, who was born on 8-4-63 (April 8, 1963), smashed 8,463 runs in his Test career. Stewart is the most capped Test wicketkeeper for England, playing 133 matches from 1990 to 2003. Stewart also played 170 ODIs for England, scoring 4,677 runs including four hundreds and 28 fifties.

text: Shooter Manu Bhaker, who won 10m Air Pistol gold at the Commonwealth Games 2018 on Sunday, was born on February 18, 2002 in Goria village near Jhajjar, Haryana. The 11th standard student, who took up the sport in 2016, is the youngest Indian to win a gold medal at the ISSF shooting World Cup, achieving the feat in March 2018.

text: Whistleblower Christopher Wylie who exposed Facebook's data-privacy scandal has said that some of the information improperly harvested from users might be stored in Russia. Earlier, Facebook revealed information of up to 87 million users may have been exploited.

text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Sunday claimed the success of the Bharat Bandh protest against the alleged dilution of the SC/ST Act by the Supreme Court has left the BJP scared of Dalits. text: Researchers studying data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory have estimated that up to 10,000 black holes are present within 3 light-years of Sagittarius A*, a supermassive black hole at the centre of Milky Way galaxy. text: During his three-day visit to India, Nepal Prime Minister KP Oli said that his country will never let its land to be used against sovereign India. text: Archaeologists excavating a site in a UP village have found artifacts which reportedly bear a strong cultural resemblance to those found in places mentioned in the epic Mahabharata. text: A video showing a policeman dancing to Bollywood songs and throwing money at dancers in Uttar Pradesh recently went viral on social media. text: Discussing Kapil Sharma's abusive tweets and telephonic conversation with SpotboyE editor Vickey Lalwani, director Hansal Mehta tweeted, "Kapil's language with the journalist was despicable but also a sad reflection of his possible state of mind." text: Besides Salman Khan's recent arrest, Sanjay Dutt was in prison for almost four years after being convicted for illegal possession of weapons in the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts case. text: Kerala has become the first state in the country to issue guidelines for declaring a patient as brain dead. text: A 57-year-old Chinese woman survived after a pair of scissors pierced through her skull while she was working on a farm. text: Anushka Sharma will reportedly be honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award for her contribution to films as a producer. text: Revealing the reason behind Chris Gayle's snub for IPL 2018, RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "He did a great job...but the team dynamic for next three years was taken into consideration." text: Several countries, including India, were hacked to display an image of the US flag on screens, the Iranian IT ministry said on Saturday. text: Delhi Police and CRPF on Sunday detained Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MPs while they were on their way to protest near PM Modi's residence to demand special status for Andhra Pradesh. text: Online travel portal MakeMyTrip is reportedly planning to acquire an equity stake in hotel aggregator Oyo following the announcement of a partnership in February. text: Around 60 prisoners committed suicide in various jails across Karnataka in the last ten years, reports said. Officials said that counselling is also insufficient as there is only one psychiatrist for 4,000-plus inmates as against a recommendation of one counsellor per 500 inmates.

text: BJP MP Udit Raj has alleged that the Dalits who had taken part in the Bharat Bandh protests are being targeted and false cases are being filed against them. text: A Jodhpur-Delhi Air India flight with 142 passengers onboard was diverted to Jaipur on Saturday evening as the landing gear failed to retract after takeoff, officials said. text: The Ludhiana Assistant Police Commissioner has been accused of molesting and attacking a woman. The accused then took her to another room, molested her, and thrashed and abused her when she protested.

text: Palaeontologists have discovered part of the skeleton of a 180 million-year-old pregnant ichthyosaur with the remains of 6-8 tiny embryos between its ribs. Ichthyosaurs were marine carnivore reptiles that fed on other reptiles, fish, and marine invertebrates.

Warren Buffett became a billionaire at the age of 56, about 26 years after he became a millionaire.

Mehsud was appointed deputy leader by Fazlullah in February this year. Pakistani Taliban spokesman Muhammed Khorasani said it was a matter of pride that all the previous leaders had been martyred.
summary: पाकिस्तानी तालिबान प्रमुख की मौत की पुष्टि करता है, उत्तराधिकारी नियुक्त करता है

text: Argentina captain and five-time Ballon d'Or-winner Lionel Messi signed his first informal contract for Barcelona on a table napkin as a 13-year-old in 2000. Messi, who was suffering from growth hormone deficiency at the time, was signed by Barcelona's Technical Secretary Carles Rexach despite opposition from some officials. Messi, who is the highest goalscorer in Barcelona history, turns 31 today.
summary: मेस्सी ने 13 साल की उम्र में नैपकिन पर 1 बारसो अनुबंध पर हस्ताक्षर किए

text: DMK workers in Tamil Nadu have been holding black flag protests against Governor Banwarilal Purohit for "holding review meetings in every district like a Chief Minister". Accusing Purohit of interfering in state administration, DMK working President MK Stalin said he was "eyeing the chief minister's chair". Purohit said "review" was a media-coined term and his meetings are general in nature.
summary: DMK ने CM की तरह बैठकें करने के लिए TN Guv का विरोध किया

text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that Congress should let other parties be in the "driving seat" in states where it is not the largest opposition party, such as Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. "[T]he talk about a prime ministerial candidate should be secondary because there is danger facing the country. The Constitution, democracy, and reservation are in danger," he added.
summary: अन्य दलों को ड्राइविंग सीट पर होना चाहिए: तेजस्वी

text: BJP leader Biswajit Pal was shot dead by unknown men around midnight on Saturday, 200 metres from his home in Tripura's Agartala. The 35-year-old had been returning home from work when the accused shot him in his chest. His family claimed he had complained of stalkers a few days ago and police suspect a land dispute led to the murder.
summary: त्रिपुरा में अज्ञात हमलावरों द्वारा भाजपा नेता की गोली मारकर हत्या

text: The Jawaharlal Nehru University has dropped its plan to start a course on 'Islamic terrorism' following objections raised by some professors and the Delhi Minorities Commission. The Commission had issued a notice to JNU, stating the course would "create wrong notions about Muslims" and "deteriorate" the communal atmosphere. Instead, it suggested a course on how religions are being misused.
summary: JNU ने terrorism इस्लामिक आतंकवाद ’पाठ्यक्रम पेश करने की योजना को गिरा दिया

text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated an 11-km-long elevated section of Delhi Metro's Green Line that will link the capital to Bahadurgarh, which is also known as 'Gateway to Haryana'. This is the third place in Haryana to be brought under Delhi Metro's network, after Gurugram and Faridabad. With 20 trains in service, the section will have seven stations.
summary: पीएम मोदी ने दिल्ली को 'गेटवे टू हरियाणा' से जोड़ने वाली मेट्रो खोली

text: A daily worker who recently built his thatched house with his savings in an Odisha village found it infested with over 100 baby cobras on Friday. The Snake Helpline NGO was called, which said, "We are still looking for the mother cobra." Notably, snakebite deaths account for about 37% of the total number of disaster deaths in Odisha.
summary: ओडिशा कार्यकर्ता 100 से अधिक शिशु कोबरा से भरा घर पाता है

text: An IndiGo flight headed towards Bengaluru made an emergency landing at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport in Kolkata on Sunday after the pilot discovered cracks in the windshield. The flight had departed at 10:15 am, and landed by 10:34 am. All the passengers were safe and the aircraft is being repaired.
summary: विंडशील्ड में दरार के कारण इंडिगो की फ्लाइट उतरने को मजबूर

text: A 12-year-old boy had to ferry his grandmother to a community health centre in a cart in UP's Basti district as no ambulance was available. He said, "Daadi was crying in pain and her condition was deteriorating with every passing minute." While his 85-year-old grandmother is undergoing treatment in a hospital, officials said they have taken note of the incident.
summary: 12 साल की वृद्ध दादी को बिना किसी एम्बुलेंस के गाड़ी में अस्पताल ले जाती है

text: A 17-year-old Muslim girl named Ravanna sought the help of the police as her parents were forcing her to get married even though she wanted to pursue her studies. A police team managed to convince her family to call off the wedding. However, Ravanna refused to stay with her family and has now been sent to a women's hostel.
summary: 17 साल की मुस्लिम लड़की ने किया शादी से इंकार, पुलिस से मांगी मदद

text: A 50-year-old farmer allegedly hanged himself inside his house in a Jharkhand village after forest officials blocked water supply to his field. "Water not reaching the fields might be one of the reasons behind the suicide," authorities said. However, the police said there may be another reason as the economic condition of the family didn't seem to be "very bad."
summary: झारखंड के किसान जीवन को समाप्त कर देते हैं क्योंकि पानी की आपूर्ति अवरुद्ध क्षेत्र में होती है

text: Talking about the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said, "Violence and cruelty can never solve any problem." He added, "It is peace and non-violence, renunciation and martyrdom that are triumphant in the end." He also said Guru Nanak Dev Ji and Kabir Das worked towards social harmony and fought against casteism.
summary: हिंसा, क्रूरता किसी भी समस्या को हल नहीं कर सकती है: पीएम मोदी

text: A woman in Odisha's Mayurbhanj allegedly killed and buried her newborn son in a cow dung pit last week. While the woman claimed the child was stillborn, locals allege she was trying to hide him because he was born out of wedlock. They claimed she killed the child, hid him in a container, and later buried him in the pit.
summary: ओडिशा में गाय के गोबर के गड्ढे में नवजात को मारती महिला

text: During the 45th edition of his programme 'Mann ki Baat', PM Narendra Modi called GST a "celebration of honesty". Adding that "inspector raj has been taken over by information technology" under GST, the PM said, "One nation, one tax reform is now a reality...GST has set a fine example of cooperative federalism and states unitedly contributed towards it."
summary: जीएसटी ईमानदारी का उत्सव है: मन की बात में पीएम मोदी

text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday announced the state's fourth international airport in Kannur will begin operations in September this year. Following a meeting with Union Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu, the CM added that development plans for Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode airports were also discussed. He also said that a feasibility study for an airport at Aranmula is underway.
summary: सितंबर में खुलने वाला केरल का चौथा अंतर्राष्ट्रीय हवाई अड्डा

text: During the sixth mango festival in Lucknow, a cultivator displayed the 'Yogi mango', named after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. "The mango is small and round shaped. The speciality of this mango is the colour. It is saffron in colour," an official said. He added that the mango will come in the market in the next three to four years.
summary: केसरिया रंग का 'योगी आम' यूपी में त्योहार पर प्रदर्शित

text: Uttar Pradesh minister OP Rajbhar has repaired a 500-metre long road outside his residence ahead of his son's wedding reception after the authorities ignored his pleas. Rajbhar said he requested the government to mend the road two months ago but to no avail. He added he had no option but to repair it himself ahead of the function on Sunday.
summary: सरकार की ओर से बेटे की शादी के लिए सड़क मरम्मत मंत्री ने की अनदेखी की गुहार

text: Italy's Deputy Prime Minister Luigi Di Maio on Saturday said "arrogant" France risked becoming its no. 1 enemy on migration issues. "Italy indeed faces a migration emergency and it's partly because France keeps pushing back people at the border," he added. He further said that French President Emmanuel Macron should open the country's ports to let migrants in.
summary: 'अभिमानी' फ्रांस नहीं बन सकता है। प्रवास पर 1 दुश्मन: इटली

text: A video of an airborne car crashing into a gas station in the US state of Mississippi has surfaced online. Following the crash, the female driver can be seen stepping out of the car unharmed and walking away. She was later arrested by the police and charged with driving under the influence.
summary: अमेरिकी गैस स्टेशन में एयरबोर्न कार दुर्घटनाग्रस्त, चालक की मौत

text: Saudi Arabia became the last country in the world to allow women to drive after it lifted the ban on female motorists on Sunday. "Now every woman has the right to drive a car anywhere in the kingdom," the country's traffic authorities spokesman said. The Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman had announced the lifting of the ban last year.
summary: सऊदी अरब महिलाओं को वाहन चलाने की अनुमति देने वाला आखिरी देश बन गया

text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal responded to a woman who tweeted to him saying, "as a single woman by choice - you and ma'am Sushma Swaraj are marriage goals". Kaushal replied saying, "Pls don't mention goals. I am missing them like Messi." He earlier replied to a user who asked about Sushma Swaraj's salary.
summary: स्वराज के पति ने उन्हें शादी के लक्ष्य के लिए उपयोगकर्ता को जवाब दिया

text: Talking about meeting Priyanka Chopra's rumoured boyfriend Nick Jonas, her mother Madhu Chopra said, "I've met him for the first time, it's too early to form an opinion." "We...went out for dinner...But it was a large group...So I didn't get the time to know him that well," she added. Nick, an American singer, arrived in India with Priyanka on Thursday.
summary: राय बनाने के लिए बहुत जल्दी: निक से मिलने पर प्रियंका की माँ

text: Chennai's R Praggnanandhaa has become the second youngest Grandmaster in chess history at the age of 12 years, 10 months, 13 days. The youngest Grandmaster ever is Russia's Sergey Karjakin, who achieved the feat aged 12 years, 7 months and has held the record since 2002. Apart from World Champion, Grandmaster is the highest title a chess player can attain.
summary: शतरंज के इतिहास में 12 वर्षीय भारतीय दूसरा सबसे छोटा ग्रैंडमास्टर

text: Team India player KL Rahul has revealed he "third-wheeled" with Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma on some of their dates while he was going through a low phase in 2014. "Anushka was there in Melbourne...She told me she isn't going to let me sit alone and said she and Virat would take me out for dinner," said Rahul.
summary: मैं अपनी तारीखों पर विराट, अनुष्का के साथ तीसरे पहर: राहुल

text: The Class 10 boy arrested for the murder of his junior in Vadodara had stabbed him with a knife 31 times in 90 seconds, the investigation has revealed. The accused committed the murder because he wanted to shut down the school after being scolded for not doing his homework, police said. "The victim could have been any student," police added.
summary: वडोदरा में 90 सेकेंड में कक्षा 10 के लड़के ने 31 बार जूनियर पर वार किया

text: A group of 15 tribal women from Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur, popularly called 'Handpump wali chachis', have been repairing handpumps for free for the last 8-9 years. The group, which has also worked in Bhopal, Delhi and Rajasthan, travel around villages on foot to offer their services. They said that they have not received any help from the authorities.
summary: मप्र में मुफ्त में 'हैंडपंप वली चेचिस' मरम्मत पंप

text: Nineteen of the 25 dirtiest cities in India are in West Bengal, according to a survey by the union housing and urban affairs ministry. The 19 cities include Darjeeling, Siliguri, North Barrackpore and Bankura. Notably, West Bengal had not participated in the cleanliness surveys conducted by the ministry in 2016 and 2017.
summary: भारत के 25 गंदे शहरों में से 19 पश्चिम बंगाल में हैं

text: Farmers in Maharashtra on Saturday staged a protest outside Central Bank of India's Datala branch after a bank manager was booked for asking sexual favours from a farmer's wife in exchange for a crop loan. As the branch was closed, the protestors vandalised the bank's board and painted its wall black. The police later arrested a few agitating farmers.
summary: बैंकर के रूप में किसानों का विरोध ऋण देने के लिए लैंगिक पक्ष की मांग करता है

text: A 40-year-old man from Noida has been arrested for sharing a morphed picture of Baba Ramdev on a WhatsApp group. In the image, Ramdev was seen lifting his leg while a group of men stands around him. Patanjali Ayurved's CEO Acharya Balkrishna later tweeted, "Thank you... for taking action against the man who defamed Baba Ramdev through the objectionable photo".
summary: बाबा रामदेव की मोर्फेड तस्वीर साझा करने पर गिरफ्तार

text: The family of a 60-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh has filed a complaint against a doctor alleging he removed his kidney without permission during a surgery for kidney stone removal. The family claims when they asked him about the organ removal, he couldn't give a satisfactory reply. The doctor said he discussed all possibilities with the family before the surgery.
summary: डॉक्टर ने बिना सहमति के मरीज की किडनी निकालने का आरोप लगाया

text: The US government has reunited 522 children separated from adults as part of the country's immigration policy. However, the US Homeland Security Department said children detained for other reasons would continue to be separated. This comes after President Donald Trump signed an executive order to end the policy of separating immigrant children from their families on the US-Mexico border.
summary: आव्रजन नीति के तहत अलग हुए 522 बच्चों को अमेरिका ने फिर से जोड़ा

text: White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders was "kicked" out of a restaurant in Virginia on Friday because she works for President Donald Trump. Sanders confirmed the incident on Twitter and wrote, "I was told...to leave...and I politely left." Earlier this week, US Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen was heckled by protestors while she was dining at a restaurant.
summary: WH Press Secy ने ट्रम्प के लिए काम करने के लिए खाने से बाहर कर दिया

text: Warning Iran against pursuing its nuclear programme, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has said, "The wrath of the entire world will fall upon them." "We would end up down a path that I don't think is in the best interests of Iran," he added. However, Pompeo clarified he was not talking about a military option.
summary: ईरान ने पूरी दुनिया में रोष का सामना किया अगर वह nukes का पीछा करेगा: US

text: Actress Dia Mirza, who will be portraying Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata Dutt in Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju', said, "It's so nice being Ranbir's wife." She added that given a chance, she wouldn't choose any other role in the film. Talking about her reaction when she saw Ranbir's look as Sanjay in the biopic, she said, "Has Sanjay gotten inside Ranbir's body?"
summary: 'संजू' में रणबीर की पत्नी: दीया मिर्जा

text: The first look of Sanya Malhotra from her upcoming film 'Pataakha' has been unveiled. Sanya made her Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'. The Vishal Bhardwaj directorial, which was earlier titled 'Chhuriyaan', will be releasing on September 28. Also starring Sunil Grover in the lead role, 'Pataakha' will reportedly mark the Bollywood debut of TV actress Radhika Madan.
summary: 'पटाखा' से सान्या मल्होत्रा का फर्स्ट लुक हुआ अनावरण

text: Slamming the government over the UN report alleging human rights violation in Kashmir, Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera said, "We are very agitated...how did the UN report on human rights see the light of the day?" Calling the report the "biggest question mark on our foreign policy", Khera said that Congress had criticised the report in stronger words than the government.
summary: सरकार ने कश्मीर पर संयुक्त राष्ट्र की रिपोर्ट को किस तरह दिन के उजाले में देखा: कांग

text: Referring to his political opponents, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday said the state will be torn apart if "monkey gangs" come to power in the assembly elections next year. These people promise a lot of things which cannot be fulfilled, he added. The state will develop only if one party is elected in successive elections, he asserted.
summary: बंदर के गिरोह के सत्ता में आने पर आंध्र को तोड़ा जाएगा: सीएम

text: Ahead of the festival of Bakrid, or Eid al-Adha, the Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) is launching a campaign against the slaughter of animals for sacrifice. "People are not aware, they link it to religion, but this is not a religion thing. In no religion can you kill animals," the board's Chairman SP Gupta said.
summary: बकरीद से पहले पशु बलि का विरोध करने वाली सरकारी संस्था

text: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said, "The main task is to defeat the BJP by rallying all secular and democratic forces. But this has to be done without having a political alliance with the Congress." Claiming the NDA had failed on all fronts, he added, "All are upset with the present regime. It has to go, sooner the better."
summary: कांग्रेस को छोड़कर सेक्युलर ताकतों को बीजेपी के खिलाफ एकजुट होना होगा: केरल सीएम

text: Haryana has made use of LED bulbs and tubelights mandatory in all government offices by August 15. All halogen, sodium bulbs, and tubelights will be replaced with energy-efficient LED bulbs and tubelights, as per CM Manohar Lal Khattar's directions. The use of incandescent lamps and purchase of sodium vapour lamps by government sector is already banned, officials said.
summary: हरियाणा सरकारी कार्यालयों में एलईडी लाइट अनिवार्य करता है

text: A 36-year-old man who was attacked in East Midnapore, West Bengal a week ago on suspicions of being a child lifter succumbed to his injuries on Saturday. The police said, "We have already arrested four people and are searching for other suspects." Meanwhile, a youngster was stripped and assaulted in Malda district on suspicions of being a child lifter.
summary: बंगाल में बाल चोर होने की अफवाह के कारण मनुष्य की मौत हो गई

text: TDP MLA Nimmala Rama Naidu slept in a crematorium on Friday night in Andhra Pradesh's Palakol to drive away fear among the construction workers engaged in its modernisation. The workers were scared after noticing a partially burnt corpse and had refused to work, the MLA said. "On Saturday, about 50 workers returned to work to resume the construction," he added.
summary: विधायक निर्माण श्रमिकों को आश्वस्त करने के लिए श्मशान में सोते हैं

text: Over 100 Naxals, who surrendered before the Odisha Police, have appeared for Indira Gandhi National Open University's (IGNOU) Bachelor Preparatory Programme exam. After clearing the test, candidates can seek admission to various Bachelors degrees offered by the university. District authorities are providing free education to Naxals to ensure that they get a chance to enter the mainstream society.
summary: ओडिशा में इग्नू परीक्षण के लिए 100 नक्सली उपस्थित

text: BJP President Amit Shah has asked Congress to apologise for the statements of its senior leaders Ghulam Nabi Azad and Saifuddin Soz and take action against them. This came after Azad said the Indian Army was killing more civilians than terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, while Soz supported a statement by former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf about Kashmiris preferring independence.
summary: कांग्रेस को माफी मांगनी चाहिए, आजाद, सोज: अमित शाह के खिलाफ कार्रवाई करनी चाहिए

text: Reacting to a video of UK Prime Minister Theresa May's curtsey to Prince William, a Twitter user wrote, "Could someone please take Theresa May to a ballet class and show her how to curtsey." While other users tweeted, "Looks like she's about to sit on the floor," and "Theresa May how's your back?"
summary: ट्विटर यूजर्स ने ब्रिटेन के पीएम मे की प्रिंस विलियम की चुटकी ली

text: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy didn't attend the firm's Annual General Meeting (AGM) for second straight year. Murthy and other co-founders including Nandan Nilekani and S Gopalakrishnan had skipped the AGM for the first time in June 2017. They remained absent amidst serious differences over governance issues with some of the board's previous members and first non-founder CEO Vishal Sikka.
summary: नारायण मूर्ति ने दूसरे सीधे वर्ष के लिए इन्फोसिस एजीएम को याद किया

text: Argentina captain Lionel Messi lasted just around 43 seconds on the field on his international debut, before getting a red card. Messi, who turns 31 today, debuted for Argentina on August 17, 2005, in a friendly against Hungary by coming on as a substitute in the second half. The forward elbowed a player in the neck and was sent off.
summary: मेस्सी अंतरराष्ट्रीय पदार्पण पर मैदान पर 50 से कम सेकंड तक रहे

text: 'Game of Thrones' actors Kit Harington, who portrayed Jon Snow, and his girlfriend Rose Leslie, who used to play the character Ygritte in the show, got married today. Their reception is being held at Wardhill Castle in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, which belongs to Rose's family. Guests at the wedding included their co-stars Peter Dinklage, Maisie Williams, Sophie Turner and Emilia Clarke.
summary: जॉन स्नो अभिनेता किट ने अपने गेम ऑफ थ्रोन्स के सह-कलाकार रोज से शादी की

text: Singer Sona Mohapatra, in tweets against those slamming her for her rendition of an Odia bhajan, wrote, "I'll go full naked with higher 'hills' and show you Chandi's true colours if you don't shut up." She tweeted in response to a user who had accused her of tarnishing Odia culture by wearing half-naked clothing and heels while performing the bhajan.
summary: चुप रहो या मैं नग्न जाऊंगा: सोना ओडियन भजन पंक्ति पर ट्रोल करने के लिए

text: Shah Rukh Khan handed actor Irrfan Khan the keys to his house in London before the actor left for UK for the treatment of neuroendocrine tumour, as per reports. Shah Rukh wanted Irrfan to feel at home in London while battling his health crisis, reports added. He reportedly visited Irrfan's Mumbai residence and they spent nearly two hours together.
summary: शाहरुख ने अपने लंदन के घर में बीमार इरफान को चाबी दी: रिपोर्ट

text: Speaking about BJP pulling out of its alliance with PDP in Jammu and Kashmir, BJP President Amit Shah said that the Modi government made several efforts but partiality towards Jammu and Ladakh continued. He added, "There was no point of BJP staying in power if the goal of equal development in Jammu and Kashmir wasn't achieved."nn
summary: जम्मू, लद्दाख: शाह की ओर पक्षपात के कारण भाजपा-पीडीपी का विभाजन हुआ

text: Asserting that Jammu and Kashmir is an integral part of India, BJP President Amit Shah on Saturday said that his party will never allow Kashmir to get disintegrated from the country. Speaking at a rally to mark the martyrdom anniversary of Jana Sangh founder Syama Prasad Mookerjee, he added, "If J&K is today part of India, it's because of Mookerjee."
summary: कश्मीर को भारत से अलग नहीं होने देंगे: शाह

text: The wife of an Indian Army Major was found dead with her throat slit and body run over by a car, presumed to belong to the murderer, on a street close to Delhi's cantonment area on Saturday. She had left for a physiotherapy session and was last seen taking a lift in another car from outside the hospital, police said.

text: Aadhaar's governing body UIDAI on Friday said that use of biometric data for criminal investigation is not allowed under the Aadhaar Act. This comes after the National Crime Records Bureau said police should be provided with limited access to Aadhaar data, as it would aide in catching first-time offenders, besides identification of unidentified bodies.
summary: आधार डेटा का उपयोग आपराधिक जांच के लिए नहीं किया जा सकता है: UIDAI

text: A police constable in Chattisgarh wrote to the Superintendent of Police (SP) seeking permission to beat his wife. He claimed that it is necessary to beat her to stop her from participating in a protest by police officers' family members. He further wrote he is scared of harassing her as she is from the upper caste and has political affiliations.
summary: पत्नी को पीटना चाहता है छत्तीसगढ़ सिपाही, एसपी से मांगी अनुमति

text: Kareena Kapoor, while talking about not being on social media, said, "Despite not being active or even present on social media, I am still all over it." "I don't need to put out anything more about my life. On the other hand, some people are active on social media, yet no one is interested in them," she added.
summary: सोशल मीडिया पर नहीं होने के बावजूद, मैं यह सब कर रहा हूं: करीना

text: American singer Nick Jonas, in an Instagram story, shared a video of his rumoured girlfriend Priyanka Chopra during his visit to India. The video has been captioned 'Her' followed by a heart-eye emoji and shows Priyanka walking towards the camera. Nick, who arrived in India with Priyanka on Thursday, also met her mother Madhu Chopra.
summary: निक ने भारत यात्रा से प्रेमिका प्रियंका की क्लिप साझा की

text: Tamil filmmaker P Bharathiraja has been booked by the Chennai Police for hurting religious sentiments, after he allegedly called Lord Ganesha an "imported God" while addressing a public gathering in January. Hindu Makkal Munnani, a religious and cultural organisation, had filed a complaint against the filmmaker. The Madras High Court had earlier granted him anticipatory bail in a similar case.
summary: तमिल निर्देशक ने भगवान गणेश को 'आयातित भगवान' कहने के लिए बुक किया

text: Filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani has revealed Sanjay Dutt used to take his girlfriends to a graveyard, saying he brought them there 'to meet his mother' Nargis Dutt, who passed away in 1981. "After this...the girl would feel emotionally attached to Sanju. The reality was that the grave was not his mother's," added Hirani. Earlier, it was revealed Dutt had 308 girlfriends.
summary: दत्त अपनी माँ की 'नकली' कब्र पर गर्लफ्रेंड को ले गए, हिरानी का खुलासा किया

text: India defeated Pakistan 36-20 in their first match of the inaugural six-nation Kabaddi Masters at the Al-Wasl Sports Complex in Dubai on Friday. Pakistan was all-out twice during the match, with Indian captain Ajay Thakur scoring the most raid points. India is scheduled to play Kenya next on Saturday.
summary: कबड्डी मास्टर्स दुबई में भारत ने पाकिस्तान को 36-20 से हराया

text: Data scandal-hit Facebook has accidentally leaked sensitive business information, including new users and page views to app testers outside the company due to an "e-mail error". The company confirmed 3% of apps using Facebook Analytics had their weekly reports sent to app testers, instead of admins. Facebook has apologised, clarifying "no personal information about people on Facebook was shared."
summary: फेसबुक गलती से संवेदनशील डेटा को तीसरे पक्ष को लीक कर देता है

text: IIT Roorkee is developing drones for the Indian Railways that will help automate rail track monitoring, which is currently a labour-intensive process. "This is in line with the government's desire to use technology including artificial intelligence to enhance safety and efficiency in train operations," said a Railways official, adding Jabalpur, Bhopal and Kota divisions already use the technology.
summary: IIT रुड़की रेल पटरियों की निगरानी के लिए ड्रोन बना रहा है

text: Gujarat Police have arrested a Class X student who allegedly stabbed his junior to death in their school washroom on Friday in Vadodara. The police said they recovered a bag that belonged to the accused near the school and found three knives and red chilli solution in it. Four students reported seeing the accused stab the victim, they added.
summary: दसवीं कक्षा के छात्र ने गुज़ स्कूल में जूनियर की हत्या का आरोप लगाया

text: A boy who went missing from Delhi at the age of three reunited with his family on Wednesday after six years. The boy was traced in Punjab, where he was living with a foster family. The boy's father and police had visited him after receiving a tip-off and identified him because of a scar on his forehead and facial features.
summary: परिवार के साथ 6 साल से लापता दिल्ली का लड़का

text: Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit walked off from a Swachh Bharat programme after realising that garbage was intentionally thrown at the location where he was supposed to clean. As he walked away, Purohit reportedly told the workers, "You have created it." A video showing a sanitation worker strewing garbage at the cleaning area before Purohit's arrival has also surfaced online.
summary: आपने कचरा बनाया: टीएन गुव ने स्वच्छ भारत कार्यक्रम को छोड़ दिया

text: The Maharashtra government has banned the sale, use and manufacture of plastic bags, as well as disposable products made of plastic and thermocol. The items excluded from the ban are plastic used in the packaging of medicines, drugs, and milk as well as bags used for horticulture and agriculture purposes. The ban, announced in March, comes into effect from today.
summary: महा में प्लास्टिक प्रतिबंध से किन वस्तुओं को कवर किया जाता है?

text: A man in Maharashtra's Washim allegedly pushed his mother in front of another man's tractor in order to stop him from cultivating a disputed land. The son had reportedly lost the case of the disputed land where the other man was cultivating. Police have started criminal proceeding against the son for his act.
summary: बेटा अपनी मां को रोकने के लिए आदमी के ट्रैक्टर के सामने धकेल देता है

text: The ban on a variety of plastic items announced by the Maharashtra government in March comes into effect from today. The fine for the first-time and second-time offence will be Ã¢ÂÂ¹5,000 and Ã¢ÂÂ¹10,000 respectively, while a third violation would attract Ã¢ÂÂ¹25,000-fine and three-month jail. A campaign will be carried out for eight days to spread awareness about the banned items.
summary: महा प्लास्टिक प्रतिबंध लागू हुआ, ban ,00025,000 तक का जुर्माना

text: Fourteen Indians on death row for murder in UAE have been released and have returned home after an NGO paid blood money as compensation to the victims' relatives. While five were convicted for the murder of a man from Uttar Pradesh, ten were convicted for killing a Pakistani national. One left in UAE will return after his paperwork gets completed.
summary: यूएई में मृत्यु दर पर 14 भारतीय रक्त के भुगतान के बाद वापस लौट आए

text: A police constable in Uttar Pradesh reportedly sought a month's leave and stated "expand family" as the reason. An officer granted him a 45-day leave instead of 30, which was later reduced to 10 days after top officials intervened. The officials also asked the constable to submit a new application after his letter was widely circulated online.
summary: पुलिसकर्मी 'परिवार का विस्तार' करने के लिए छुट्टी मांगता है, 10 दिन की छुट्टी मिलती है

text: A temple and a mosque have been sharing the same premises in West Bengal's Jhargram for the last 25 years. Muslims read Quran while Hindus worship Lord Shiva at a residence, where a Brahmin man is the caretaker. "There's no...religious conflict here and people from both the communities sing bhajans as well as recite verses from Quran," the caretaker said.
summary: WB में मंदिर और मस्जिद 25 वर्षों से एक ही परिसर को साझा कर रहे हैं

text: Netflix has fired Chief Communications Officer Jonathan Friedland for using "N-word on at least two occasions at work", CEO Reed Hastings said in an internal memo. This showed "unacceptably low racial awareness...and isn't in line with our values as a company," he added. Friedland tweeted, "I feel awful about the distress this lapse caused to people at company I love."
summary: नेटफ्लिक्स काम पर एन-शब्द के उपयोग पर शीर्ष प्रवक्ता को आग लगाता है

text: Anil Kapoor took to Twitter to share a note on completing 35 years in Bollywood. He wrote, "I don't really remember the life I had before I entered the movies because I truly started living on the silver screen...Blessed to be living my dream!" "There's no greater feeling than to be known...and appreciated for the work you do," Anil added.
summary: मेरे सपने को जीने के लिए धन्य: अनिल ने बीवुड में 35 वर्ष पूरे किए

text: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said calling Congress President Rahul Gandhi sympathetic to Maoists and jehadists was "laughable" and "absurd". This comes after incumbent Finance Minister Arun Jaitley alleged that Rahul had sympathy for the human rights groups taken over by the ultra-Left. Rahul has no problem joining those raising subversive slogans at JNU and Hyderabad, Jaitley had said.
summary: राहुल माओवादी को फोन करना, जेहादीवादी सहानुभूति हँसने योग्य: Ex-FM

text: Bengaluru-based bike rental platform Wicked Ride has secured Ã¢ÂÂ¹62 crore in a fresh funding round led by venture capital firms Sequoia Capital and Accel Partners. Wicked Ride is premium arm of Metro Bikes, which offers keyless bikes with OTP access at metro stations across several cities. Metro Bikes was founded in 2014 by Vivekananda Hallekere, Anil G, and Varun Agni.
summary: सिकोइया बेंगलुरु बाइक रेंटल स्टार्टअप में Ã Â‚Â¹ ia62cr फंडिंग का नेतृत्व करता है

text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed the electric car-making startup built a "giant tent" in two weeks as they needed another assembly line to meet the 5,000 cars/week Model 3 production goal. "Not sure we actually need a building. This tent is pretty sweet," said Musk. The first-of-its-kind sprung structure is reportedly 150 feet long and 53 feet high.
summary: टेस्ला ने उत्पादन लक्ष्यों को पूरा करने के लिए कार असेंबली 'टेंट' का निर्माण किया

text: Ahmedabad-based agritech startup My Crop Technologies and Delhi-based data intelligence startup SocialCops have been selected among the world's 61 most promising Technology Pioneers in 2018 by the World Economic Forum. Founded in 2013, SocialCops has driven village development schemes, while My Crop, founded in 2016, helps farmers. Previous winners of the title include Google, Twitter, and Airbnb.
summary: WEF के सबसे होनहार टेक पायनियर्स में दो भारतीय स्टार्टअप

text: BJP leader Lal Singh Chaudhary, who had supported Kathua rape and murder accused, on Friday asked the journalists in J&K to 'mend their ways' to keep the "brotherhood" intact in the Valley. In an apparent reference to journalist Shujaat Bukhari's assassination, Lal added, "Are they (Kashmiri journalists) waiting for a similar incident that has happened with Basharat?"
summary: कठुआ के आरोपी का समर्थन करने वाले बीजेपी के लोग पत्रिकाओं को रास्ते से हटाने के लिए कहते हैं

text: Power Minister RK Singh has asked major air-conditioner manufacturers to maintain default temperature setting at 24 degree Celsius with an aim to promote energy efficiency. "Every 1-degree increase in the air-conditioner temperature setting results in saving of 6% of electricity consumed," Singh said. He further said that some countries like Japan have regulated the temperature at 28 degree.
summary: सरकार एसी निर्माताओं से 24 ° to ° C पर डिफ़ॉल्ट तापमान बनाए रखने के लिए कहती है

text: American singer Nick Jonas, who arrived in India with his rumoured girlfriend Priyanka Chopra, met her mother Madhu Chopra on Friday. Nick and Priyanka, along with her mother, were spotted going out for dinner at a Mumbai restaurant. Reports said Priyanka has invited Nick to a housewarming party of her new bungalow where she will introduce him to her friends.
summary: निक जोनास भारत में अफवाह प्रेमिका प्रियंका की माँ से मिलते हैं

text: The family of veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar has slammed Karan Johar and questioned as to why he needed to use her "bhajan-like song" for an orgasm scene in the film 'Lust Stories'. The song used is the title track of Karan's directorial Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. Lata's kin added that Karan could have used any other song for the scene.
summary: जोहर ने लता के भजन जैसे गाने को ओर्गास्म सीन के लिए क्यों इस्तेमाल किया, यह परिजन पूछते हैं

text: Alia Bhatt, on being asked if marriage affects the career of an actress, said, "Anushka (Sharma) and Sonam (Kapoor) are proving married actresses can remain stars and they're doing it fearlessly." "A good actor shouldn't be out of work because of their relationship status," she added. Alia further said she'd never fear getting married thinking her career might end.
summary: अनुष्का, सोनम साबित करें कि शादीशुदा अभिनेत्रियां रह सकती हैं स्टार: आलिया

text: Supreme Court judge Jasti Chelameswar, who retired today, said he has no regrets about holding a press conference along with three other SC judges to voice concerns over Chief Justice of India Dipak Misra and the judiciary's administration in January. He added it "created awareness" about the court's proceedings. Chelameswar further said he was fighting the system during his tenure.
summary: कोई पछतावा नहीं: CJI के बारे में अपनी प्रेस कॉन्फ्रेंस में SC SC जज

text: Samajwadi Party leader Shivpal Yadav has said his nephew Akhilesh would have been re-elected as Uttar Pradesh CM after the 2017 Assembly elections if he had listened to his elders. Adding that Akhilesh played as a kid in his lap, Shivpal said he took care of him and got him married but the new generation does not listen to anyone.
summary: बड़ों की बात सुनेंगे तो अखिलेश होंगे सीएम: चाचा शिवपाल

text: The daughter of a tea seller in Madhya Pradesh has been selected into Indian Air Force's flying branch after she cleared the interview on her sixth attempt. Aanchal Gangwal is among 22 selected from 6 lakh candidates who gave the entrance. Her father said, "Everyone in the area knows about my Namdev tea stall...I feel very happy when people...congratulate me."
summary: एमपी चाय विक्रेता की बेटी का चयन भारतीय वायुसेना की उड़ान शाखा में हो जाता है

text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev on Friday announced that he will get a wax statue at Madame Tussauds museum in London. He revealed that he got the proposal two months ago and has accepted it after much persuasion. "Yogis' scientific, secular, and universal knowledge should be promoted. With this in mind, I have accepted the proposal," Ramdev said.
summary: रामदेव का कहना है कि लंदन के मैडम तुसाद में मोम की प्रतिमा मिलेगी

text: Retired SC judge Jasti Chelameswar has said that the closed door meeting of those who run the country with Supreme Court judges must be questioned. In 2017, Chelameswar had written to former Chief Justice JS Khehar about the alleged proximity of sitting SC judge NV Ramana and Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu.
summary: राजनेताओं, जजों की डोर मीटिंग पर सवाल: रिटायर्ड जज

text: Pakistan-based terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), responsible for the 26/11 Mumbai attack, has launched an online magazine 'Wyeth', wherein they have stated 2018 will be "tough for Indian Army and other occupational forces in Kashmir". "LeT is the common man's struggle. It represents true aspirations of J&K people," the terror outfit's spokesperson asserted in the Kashmir-specific magazine.
summary: भारतीय सेना के लिए कठिन होने के लिए LeT ने पत्रिका शुरू की, 2018 कहा

text: India and the US will host the first '2+2' talks in July in Washington. US State Secretary Mike Pompeo and Defence Secretary James Mattis will hold the talks with their respective Indian counterparts External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj and Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The talks will focus on enhancing strategic, security and defence cooperation between the two nations.
summary: भारत, यूएस जुलाई में उद्घाटन '2 + 2' वार्ता आयोजित करने के लिए

text: A 15-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh was allegedly gangraped by 10 youths, who also made a video of the incident, police said on Friday. The girl was attending an engagement ceremony when an accused convinced her to accompany him to a neighbouring village, where the other nine joined him and raped her. Only two accused have been arrested yet.
summary: 15 साल की लड़की से 10 युवकों ने किया गैंगरेप, घटना का वीडियो बनाया

text: BJP General Secretary of Chikmagalur in Karnataka, Mohammed Anwar, was allegedly stabbed to death by unknown bike-borne assailants on Friday. Anwar was reportedly attacked thrice when he was returning from a function, following which he collapsed on the spot and succumbed to his injuries. Police have registered a case and have launched an investigation in the case.
summary: कर्नाटक में बाइक सवार पुरुषों द्वारा भाजपा नेता की चाकू मारकर हत्या

text: Whistleblower organisation WikiLeaks has published a database containing LinkedIn data of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) employees. WikiLeaks said its action came in retaliation for separation of migrant families by the ICE. The data of 9,000 former and current ICE employees, including deportation officers, IT workers and human resource interns among others was published.
summary: विकीलीक्स अमेरिकी आव्रजन कर्मचारियों के डेटाबेस को प्रकाशित करता है

text: Varun Dhawan, who was seen introducing everyone at the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) 2018 Press Conference in Bangkok, introduced Kartik Aaryan and jokingly said, "We have...Ã¢ÂÂ¹100 crore hero." "One of the biggest stars of the Indian film fraternity...very popular on social networking sites and paparazzi's favourite," he added. IIFA 2018 will be held on June 24.
summary: कार्तिक आर्यन '¢ hero hero100 करोड़ के हीरो' हैं, आईफा में वरुण का मजाक उड़ाते हैं

text: Filmmaker Karan Johar, while talking at the press conference of the International Indian Film Academy (IIFA) Awards 2018 in Bangkok, said that if one can't reuse the talent, then one should refuse it. He said this while commenting on the environmental initiative 'Beat Plastic Pollution', the tagline of which is 'If you can't reuse it, refuse it'.
summary: यदि आप प्रतिभा का पुन: उपयोग नहीं कर सकते हैं, तो इसे मना कर दें: करण जौहर

text: Former Union Health Minister and MP Anbumani Ramadoss, has slammed Tamil actor Vijay for promoting smoking in the poster of his upcoming film 'Sarkar'. "You'll look more stylish without that cigarette," wrote Ramadoss in one of his tweets. "Shame on...Vijay for promoting smoking in this first look of his next movie," read another tweet by the MP.
summary: सांसद ने फिल्म के पोस्टर में धूम्रपान को बढ़ावा देने के लिए तमिल अभिनेता की खिंचाई की

text: Switzerland defeated Serbia 2-1 on Friday to become the first team to come from behind to win a group match at the 2018 FIFA World Cup. The match witnessed midfielder Granit Xhaka become the third Swiss player to score in multiple World Cups. Further, midfielder Xherdan Shaqiri became the second Swiss player to score at both Euro and World Cup.
summary: 2018 फीफा WC में वापसी करने वाली स्विट्जरलैंड की पहली टीम

text: Nigeria on Friday defeated FIFA World Cup debutants Iceland 2-0 in a Group D fixture to stay alive in the tournament. Forward Ahmed Musa scored both the goals in the match and became the highest goalscorer for Nigeria in World Cup history. Nigeria will advance to the next round if they beat Argentina in their last group match.
summary: नाइजीरिया ने 2018 फीफा डब्ल्यूसी में जिंदा रहने के लिए आइसलैंड को हरा दिया

text: Kosovan-Albanian origin Switzerland players Granit Xhaka and Xherdan Shaqiri made  gestures apparently symbolising Albanian flag's eagle in the 2-1 win against Serbia on Friday. The celebrations sparked debate on social media, with some questioning the need to mix politics with football. Shaqiri also played in boots marked with flag of Kosovo, not recognised as a state by Serbia or Russia.
summary: स्विस खिलाड़ियों का 'राजनीतिक उत्सव' 2-1 की जीत के बाद फिसल गया

text: After cricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar slammed the use of two new balls over record scores in the ongoing England-Australia ODI series, Indian captain Virat Kohli said, "I agree it's brutal for the bowlers". "I have played ODI cricket when... reverse swing used to be a massive factor in the latter half of the innings," added Kohli, echoing Tendulkar's views.
summary: सचिन के बाद, कोहली बोले दो नई गेंदें 'गेंदबाजों के लिए क्रूर'

text: Nathania John K, an 11-year-old Indian girl, led the Brazilian and Costa Rican teams on to the field at the FIFA World Cup on Friday. With this, Nathania became the first Indian girl to be an Official Match Ball Carrier (OMBC) at the World Cup. Earlier, 10-year-old Rishi Tej had led Belgium and Panama on to the field in WC.
summary: 11-वर्षीय भारतीय लड़की ब्राजील को विश्व कप में मैदान पर ले जाती है

text: Tracking chips will be installed in vehicles which embark on the 60-day Amarnath Yatra later this month, Jammu and Kashmir Inspector General of Police SD Singh Jamwal has said. Stating that such technology is being used for the first time, Jamwal said counters have been set up in Lakhanpur for installing the devices to ensure no vehicle loses its way.
summary: अमरनाथ जाने वाले वाहनों में ट्रैकिंग चिप्स लगाए जाएंगे

text: The Hyderabad High Court has asked the Andhra Pradesh Director General of Police to file an affidavit regarding the police's practice of parading accused people before the media. Police have no authority to allow media to publish the accused's photos, the court added. This comes after a petitioner sought action against police for parading his theft-accused mother before the media.
summary: मीडिया के सामने आरोपी को पकड़ने के लिए HC ने आंध्र पुलिस से किया सवाल

text: A 57-year-old Indian-origin Singaporean woman has been accused of being involved in the biggest case of bribery in the US Navy. As a lead contract specialist for the Navy, Sharon Rachael Gursharan Kaur allegedly received nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹65 lakh in bribes in return for providing confidential information. More than 10 US Navy officials have pleaded guilty to corruption in the scandal.
summary: सबसे बड़ी अमेरिकी नौसेना रिश्वत मामले में आरोपी भारतीय मूल की महिला

text: Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) has agreed on a "nominal" increase in oil production of around 1 million barrels a day or 1% of global supply, Saudi Energy Minister Khalid Al-Falih has said. Saudi Arabia argued it was time to raise production, following calls from major consumer countries to help reduce crude price and avoid a supply shortage.
summary: ओपेक 1 mn बैरल के तेल उत्पादन में वृद्धि से सहमत है: सऊदी मंत्री

text: Credit rating agency Moody's has affirmed Pakistan's B3 rating but downgraded the outlook from stable to negative, ahead of the general elections in the country. The agency cited factors including "heightened external vulnerability risk" and low foreign exchange reserves for changing the outlook. Moody's said the decision to affirm B3 rating reflected the country's "potential for a robust growth".
summary: मूडीज ने चुनाव से पहले पाक की रेटिंग को नकारात्मक कर दिया

text: Alisha Malik, the teenage girl whose video of hugging around 100 men on Eid outside a mall in UP's Moradabad went viral, said on Friday that she had no wrong intention. "I hadn't done it for publicity. My family is getting messages about how I've ruined their reputation," she added. The girl's unique 'Eid Milan' went for over an hour.

text: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Wednesday issued notices to the Centre, the Haryana government, and the Rajasthan government over the deforestation in the Aravalli hills. text: Indian Naval Chief Admiral Sunil Lanba among other Navy personnel on Thursday performed Yoga to commemorate International Yoga Day. While some Navy personnel performed exercises on the deck of the decommissioned vessel "INS Viraat" in Mumbai, some conducted Yoga activities inside submarines. A total of 15,000 Navy personnel participated in the event along with their families.

text: The Odisha government has issued a show cause notice to a school for allegedly flouting its order to extend summer vacations due to the heat wave. The notice said, "young children have been compelled to travel in severe hot and humid condition and attend the classes." It asked the principal not to open the school before June 26. n

text: Three elephants were rescued from a 17-foot-deep well within six hours in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday. The rescue operations were carried out after residents heard the trumpeting of the elephants and informed the forest personnel. The rescue team dug up the land around the well and built a slope, enabling the elephants to climb out.

text: Days after BJP ended its alliance with PDP in the Jammu and Kashmir government, former Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said, "The PDP and BJP have been watching Bollywood movies for political strategy. This is how they have crafted their divorce." Abdullah added, "Brilliant fixed match, scripted to perfection except the audience aren't fools and neither are the rest of us."
summary: भाजपा, पीडीपी ने तलाक के लिए बॉलीवुड फिल्मों से लिया: उमर

text: The Income Tax department has reportedly launched a probe into the acquisition of ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar's family residence in Mumbai. Her husband Deepak Kochhar had purchased the flat in a "complex transaction" involving firms linked to Videocon Group, reports said. Chanda Kochhar is currently on leave until an internal probe into allegations of impropriety against her is completed.

"They were hugging and crying and clutching my foot refusing to let me go," G Bhagawan said. "More than a teacher, I'm a friend, a brother to them", he added.

text: A man named Dedrick D Williams was arrested on Wednesday in connection to the death of 20-year-old rapper Jahseh Onfroy, also known as XXXTentacion. text: At the FIFA World Cup, Germany's Mario Gomez uses only the far-left urinal before a match, as a superstition. England's Dele Alli is using the same shin guards he has worn since he was 11.

text: AAP MLA Amarjit Singh Sandoa was injured after he was allegedly attacked by sand mafia "goons" in Punjab's Ropar when he and his security personnel were visiting an illegal sand mining site on Thursday. text: Weeks after the city faced a severe water crisis, the Shimla Municipal Corporation on Wednesday proposed an annual hike of 10% in water charges in accordance with a government notification of 2015. text: Karnataka Food and Civil Supplies Minister BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan has sought a Toyota Fortuner for official use instead of the Innova he has been allotted, since the latter is "low level". text: A government hospital in Maharashtra handed over a dead body to the family of a 50-year-old patient, claiming their relative had passed away. text: Chinese investments in the US in the first five months of 2018 totalled $1.8 billion, representing a 92% drop from investments in the same period last year. text: Pakistan has not taken any "sustained" or "decisive" action to get Taliban to the negotiating table with the Afghan government, US Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asia, Alice Wells has said. text: US President Donald Trump mocked a protestor at his rally in Minnesota, saying, "So we have a single protestor, he is going home to his mom," and added, "Say hello to mommy." Trump further claimed that 'the fake news' will claim the next day that there were massive protests at the rally.

text: The Vatican has used the abbreviation 'LGBT', which is used to denote the terms lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender, in its official document reportedly for the first time. text: Argentine legend Diego Maradona scored 'Goal of the Century' four minutes after netting the 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986 FIFA World Cup quarter-final. text: Uber drivers have earned over $600 million in tips in one year in the US and Canada. In the first six months, drivers earned $200 million and in the last six months, they earned $400 million in tips.

text: Talking about Tesla's former employee who hacked the company's system, CEO Elon Musk said, "The actions of a few bad apples will not stop Tesla from reaching its goals." text: Koko, a 46-year-old gorilla who mastered sign language has died in its sleep at a California preserve on Tuesday, the Gorilla Foundation announced. text: Mossack Fonseca, the offshore law firm at the centre of the Panama Papers leak, had no records of the real owners of 75% of its clients, according to an internal investigation. text: Australia held Denmark to a 1-1 draw in a Group C fixture at the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Thursday, claiming their first point in the tournament. text: A group of Switzerland fans visiting Russia for the 2018 FIFA World Cup mistakenly booked a hotel in the wrong city, which was 1,281 km away from the venue where Switzerland played Brazil. text: Iranian midfielder Saeid Ezatolahi's 62nd-minute goal against Spain was disallowed by video assistant referee (VAR) after being deemed offside, becoming the first goal to be denied by VAR in World Cup history. text: Former Team India chief selector Sandeep Patil has slammed BCCI's new fitness criteria, saying, "I find it very absurd that a player is dropped for failing the Yo-Yo test after being picked in the squad." text: Twitter has suspended the accounts of users who tweeted a link to a story containing the phone number of US President Donald Trump's advisor Stephen Miller. text: Danish software company Corti has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that can detect heart attacks during emergency calls with 93% accuracy rate. The AI analyses the caller's words, voice tone, and background noise while describing an incident. According to a study, the system gave results in an average of 48 seconds, over 30 seconds faster than humans.

text: A 33-year-old Delhi woman died after falling into a 500-foot-deep valley while taking a selfie at Matheran, a popular hill station near Mumbai, said the police today.
