text: Slamming the "fake news media" for showing only "bad photos", US President Donald Trump took to Twitter to share pictures of his interaction with world leaders at the G7 summit. Trump said he shared "a great relationship" with Angela Merkel, refuting reports of differences with the German Chancellor. Trump earlier claimed the conversation captured in the picture was "very friendly".

text: India has proposed to introduce $240-million retaliatory tariffs on a list of 30 items imported from the US. India had asked the US to exempt it from its tariffs on steel and aluminium, but US rejected the request. India has notified the World Trade Organisation about the list, including apples, almonds and motorcycles, on which it intends to impose tariffs.

text: Harvard University has been sued for discriminating against Asian-American applicants by rating them low on personality traits. The Students for Fair Admissions claimed that out of over 1.6 lakh applications filed between 2000 and 2015, Asian-Americans scored high in test scores but low on personality traits. The traits they were assessed on included likeability and kindness among others.

text: US President Donald Trump called North Korean leader Kim Jong-un a "strong head" and said he wants his people "to sit up at attention" when he speaks just like the North Koreans do for their leader. Trump further hailed his efforts towards improving the US' ties with North Korea and claimed that he has a good relationship with Kim Jong-un.
summary: मैं चाहता हूं कि जब मैं बोलूं तो मेरे लोग ध्यान में रहें: ट्रम्प

text: Over 4 lakh Indians with "advanced degrees" may have to wait for 151 years to obtain legal permanent residence status in the US, also called green card, according to a US-based think-tank. There were 2,16,684 primary Indian applicants with 'advanced degrees' and 2,16,684 spouses and children. Indians with "extraordinary ability" will have to wait "only" six years, the report added.
summary: 4 लाख से अधिक भारतीयों को यूएस ग्रीन कार्ड के लिए 151 साल तक इंतजार करना पड़ सकता है

text: Nirav Modi exported poor quality jewellery to Hong Kong and Dubai, Firestar Group COO Anup Panchal told the Enforcement Directorate. He revealed that jewellery exported to Dubai and Hong Kong never returned as defective or sub-standard. "Stones were dismounted from the jewellery and the gold part was melted. The stones were again exported to Dubai and India," he added.

text: Sanjay Kapoor, while talking about his daughter Shanaya's Bollywood debut, said that she is working towards it. "I really don't know when that will happen. Sanjay said he advised Shanaya not to take praises or criticism seriously.

text: Opening up about her break-up with actor Sushant Singh Rajput, television actress Ankita Lokhande said, "I won't say the break-up affected my profession. Love and work are two separate things." text: Shah Rukh Khan and Amitabh Bachchan will star together in an upcoming film titled 'Bada', as per reports. Talking about his latest directorial 'Race 3', Remo said, "I...explored the power of storytelling where I had to keep the suspense alive till the end."

text: Australian cricketer David Warner, who is currently serving a 12-month ban from representing Australia and was barred from IPL 2018 over the ball-tampering scandal, has been signed by Caribbean Premier League side St Lucia Stars. text: Amid AAP's protest in Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's house, doctors found Health Minister Satyendra Jain has gained 1.3 kg weight after being on a hunger strike for five days, as per reports. text: Odisha's Muktikanta Biswal walked 1,350 km from Rourkela to meet PM Narendra Modi and remind him of his 2015 promises of improving medical and infrastructure facilities in his village. text: In a purported audio clip which surfaced on Friday, Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Sanjay Gupta can be heard saying that as many as 90% Muslims indulge in theft of electricity. text: Jaypee Associates has failed to deposit Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,000 crore in the Supreme Court's registry by June 15. The company will now reportedly submit an appropriate plan before the SC to protect homebuyers' interest in case of liquidation proceedings against Jaypee Infratech.

text: Senior IPS officer Sudhesh Kumar has been removed from his post of Battalion ADGP in Kerala, 48 hours after his daughter was booked for allegedly assaulting his police driver. The daughter had allegedly manhandled the driver following an altercation when he was late to pick her up from morning walk. A case was also filed against the driver based on a counter complaint.

text: Russian cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova, who became the first woman to go into space on June 16, 1963, had to re-enact her landing sequence in order to be filmed. Doctors concealed Tereshkova's bruise the day following her actual landing and the then 26-year-old was put back in her capsule, while actors ran towards the capsule to open it and receive her.

text: Taking a dig at Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, filmmaker Shirish Kunder tagged LG Electronics and tweeted, "@LGIndia...Do you have a service center in Delhi? The LG there is not working." Instead, the company tweeted, "We regret the inconvenience caused." Currently, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is holding a sit-in protest at L-G's office which led Baijal to work from home.

text: Lyricist Shreshta, who wrote lyrics for Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy', alleged that the wife of a producer asked her to submit to her husband's sexual demands. She added, "I've learned over the years that it's not just men but also women who unabashedly perpetuate such things." Shreshta said she "left the industry for a few months" due to such propositions.

text: A woman and her partner filed a police complaint accusing singer Jubin Nautiyal of physical assault and molestation during his party at a hotel in Dehradun. The man alleged Jubin "tried to take advantage" of his partner and on being confronted, assaulted him. However, Jubin has filed a counter-complaint alleging that the two had gatecrashed his party and attacked him.
summary: महिला ने गायक जुबिन पर छेड़छाड़, साथी पर हमला करने का आरोप लगाया

text: Samsung Electronics was told to pay $400 million after a federal jury in Texas said it infringed a patent owned by a South Korean university. The dispute centres on technology called FinFet that boosts chip performance and reduces power consumption. Samsung, the world's largest chipmaker, said it worked with the university to develop the technology and denied patent infringement.

text: Apple has hired senior self-driving car engineer Jaime Waydo from Alphabet's Waymo unit that made the Google driverless car. Before joining Waymo, she worked with NASA for 13 years and helped send a rover to Mars. Although Apple is yet to announce any products related to self-driving cars, CEO Tim Cook once called it "the mother of all AI projects".
summary: Apple ने पूर्व NASA, Waymo इंजीनियर को काम पर रखा है जो मंगल पर रोवर डालते हैं

text: The Border Security Force (BSF) and the Pakistan Rangers did not exchange sweets at the Attari-Wagah border on Saturday on the occasion of Eid ul-Fitr due to ongoing ceasefire violations by Pakistan in Jammu and Kashmir. The border forces of the two nations customarily share sweets on Eid, Diwali and days of national importance like Independence Day and Republic Day.
summary: बीएसएफ, पाक ने संघर्ष विराम उल्लंघन के बीच ईद की मिठाइयों का आदान-प्रदान नहीं किया

text: Flying Officer Meghana Shanbough MR from Karnataka has become the first woman Indian Air Force fighter pilot from south India. Before her, only five other female fighter pilots have joined the ranks. "In June 2016, I was truly inspired to read the stories of IAF's first women fighter pilots...I decided that I had to go for it," Meghana said.
summary: मेघना दक्षिण भारत की पहली महिला IAF फाइटर पायलट बनीं

text: Indian Army soldier Bikas Gurung was martyred in a ceasefire violation by Pakistan army in Jammu and Kashmir's Nowshera sector along the Line of Control on Eid today. Meanwhile, another ceasefire violation was reported from the state's Arnia sector. Both ceasefire violations come two days after four Border Security Force troopers were killed and five were injured in ceasefire violation.
summary: ईद पर पाक द्वारा संघर्ष विराम उल्लंघन में सेना का जवान शहीद

text: Right-wing body Hindu Sena celebrated US President Donald Trump's 72nd birthday on June 14. Calling the US President their hero, the National President of the organisation, Vishnu Gupta said that Trump is "a saviour of humanity". Gupta claimed that the outfit had also campaigned in Trump's support during the 2016 presidential elections.
summary: हिंदू सेना ने मनाया ट्रम्प का 72 वां जन्मदिन

text: Sri Rama Sene has started a fundraising campaign for the family of Parashuram Waghmore, an accused in Gauri Lankesh's murder. "Can you not share a portion of your earnings, a morsel of your food with patriots?" it posted on Facebook. The organisation's chief Pramod Muthalik said the campaign was for the poor family and not in sympathy for the accused.
summary: गौरी हत्या के आरोपी के परिवार के लिए श्री राम सेने फंड जुटाता है

text: Indian Railways has decided to issue credit card-like plastic health cards carrying a unique all-India number to its employees and pensioners. At present, the medical cards issued by the zonal railways are in the form of booklets which resemble ration cards. Each dependent of the employee and the pensioner will also get a separate medical identity card.

text: Parashuram Waghmore, the sixth suspect arrested in the Gauri Lankesh murder case, has reportedly confessed to shooting the journalist. "I was told in May 2017 I had to kill someone to save my religion," he told the Special Investigation Team. Waghmore further said he didn't know who Lankesh was and added that he should not have killed her.
summary: गौरी लंकेश के हत्यारे का कहना है कि उन्होंने ऐसा धर्म को बचाने के लिए किया: रिपोर्ट

text: Nearly 2,000 children at the US-Mexico border have been separated from their parents or legal guardians over a period of six weeks, US officials said. This came after a new government policy called for separating families entering the US illegally by placing children in protective custody. The move is a part of the government's "zero-tolerance" policy towards illegal migration.
summary: अमेरिका सीमा पर परिवारों से 2,000 प्रवासी बच्चों को अलग करता है

text: Three WWE wrestlers played tug of war against a 2.5-year-old lion cub in confinement at the San Antonio Zoo in USA. The wrestlers tried to pull the rope towards their side but failed to move it with the cub pulling it from inside the confinement using her jaws. The three wrestlers are part of WWE NXT and SmackDown LIVE shows.
summary: 3 WWE के पहलवान युद्ध के दौरान शेर के शावक से हार जाते हैं

text: Kolkata-based Shree Ganesh Jewellery House promoter Nilesh Parekh has been arrested for fraud in diversion of 1,705 kg of primary gold, the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence has said. The firm imported 35,746kg of duty-free gold between 2005-2015, but exported only 34,041kg of gold jewellery. The company was also accused of non-realisation of remittance on export of jewellery worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹7,500 crore.

text: Former AirAsia India CEO Mittu Chandilya on Friday announced his resignation from Adani Group. His resignation comes at a time when the CBI is probing AirAsia and its employees of bribing government officials to obtain international flying licence for AirAsia India. "Tough to leave stellar people, however, I need to spend enough time with folks at home," Mittu Chandilya tweeted.

text: Vaani Kapoor will skip performing at IIFA 2018 due to a hamstring injury, as per reports. "Vaani had an extremely outlandish performance planned for IIFA...However, she has suffered a freak hamstring injury and she has been advised to take it easy for at least 2 weeks," reports stated. The 2018 IIFA Awards will be held on June 24.
summary: वाणी चोट के कारण IIFA में प्रदर्शन छोड़ना: रिपोर्ट

text: Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a picture with her mother Madhu Chopra on the occasion of the latter's birthday and wrote, "Happy Birthday beautiful lady...my strength my weakness all rolled into one." She added, "I wish you the best year ever.. with everything you wished for." "Can't wait to celebrate with you," Priyanka further wrote.
summary: मेरी ताकत, मेरी कमजोरी 1 में लुढ़क गई: माँ के दिन प्रियंका

text: Argentine legend Diego Maradona scored the opening goal against England in the 1986 FIFA World Cup quarter-final using his hand in the 51st minute. It came to be known as the 'Hand of God' goal after Maradona said following the match that it was scored "a little with the head of Maradona and a little with the hand of God".
summary: 1986 के विश्व कप में 'हैंड ऑफ गॉड' लक्ष्य माराडोना ने देखा

text: Midfielder Paul Pogba scored in the 81st minute to help France defeat 36th-ranked Australia 2-1 in their first match of the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Saturday. Forward Kylian Mbappe, aged 19 years and 178 days, became the youngest ever footballer to represent France in a World Cup match. The first two goals in the match were scored through penalties.

text: After qualifying for FIFA World Cup for the first time, the Iceland football team performed its traditional Viking thunder clap celebration with the fans. Iceland, which has a population of over 3,34,000 with over 20,000 registered football players, is the smallest nation to play in the World Cup. The celebration was made popular by Iceland during their Euro 2016 campaign.

text: A study encompassing 62 species worldwide found that to avoid human presence, mammals spent relatively less time being active during daytime. Researchers found a 1.36 times increase in mammals' night activity, even among those already classed as nocturnal. The author said the findings echoed the past, as it was only after dinosaurs' extinction that mammals started venturing out in daylight.
summary: मनुष्यों से बचने के लिए स्तनधारी अधिक निशाचर बनते हैं: अध्ययन

text: The $950-million Large Hadron Collider at CERN, Geneva, is getting an upgrade that will let researchers collect up to 10 times more data by 2026. The 27-km-long particle accelerator, which produces one billion proton-proton collisions per second, will be fitted with 130 new magnets. LHC discovered the Higgs boson in 2012 that led to the 2013 Nobel Prize in Physics.

text: Bars and shops in Mumbai have been prohibited from selling liquor from June 23-25 due to Maharashtra Legislative Council elections on June 25. text: A German collector in Myanmar has discovered a tick in amber (resin) which was likely trapped in spider web and immobilised by the spider wrapping its silk around it. text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday said that only Maharana Pratap was a great ruler, not Mughal emperor Akbar. Maharana Pratap said we can't accept a 'vidharmi' and a foreigner as our ruler," Yogi added.

text: FBI agent Peter Strzok, who investigated the alleged Russian interference in 2016 US presidential elections, texted his lover that the agency would stop then-candidate Donald Trump from becoming President. text: A 73-year-old Australian artist has buried himself alive in a steel container under a busy road for three days as part of a dark arts festival act. text: The VHP and Bajrang Dal have been classified as militant religious outfits under the section 'Political pressure groups and leaders' by the US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). text: Greece has agreed to recognise Macedonia under the name 'Republic of North Macedonia', ending a 27-year deadlock between the two nations. Greece objected that the 'Republic of Macedonia' implies a claim to the whole geographic region of Macedonia, of which more than half is part of Greek territory. Greece vetoed Macedonia's bid to join NATO and EU over the dispute.

text: Astronauts from the International Space Station gifted Pope Francis a spacesuit customised with a cape. The suit, presented to the Pope by Italian astronaut Paolo Nespoli, bore the Pope's birthname, Jorge Bergoglio, and his native country Argentina's flag. The white cape displayed the Vatican's flag, the official NASA wings logo and the name "Pope Francis" embroidered on it.

text: US fashion brand Guess on Tuesday said that Co-founder Paul Marciano has resigned as Executive Chairman after allegations of improper conduct, including kissing and groping. A special committee found that Marciano "exercised poor judgement in his communications with models and photographers". Guess and Marciano also reached settlements with five individuals amounting to $500,000.

text: The Enforcement Directorate has alleged that Nirav Modi shifted all dummy directors of his six Hong Kong-based shell companies to Cairo after CBI registered a case. These directors earned salaries of Ã¢ÂÂ¹8,000 to Ã¢ÂÂ¹30,000 per month, according to ED.

text: Deepika Padukone has tweeted that she is safe, after a Level III fire broke out on the 33rd floor of the building where she resides. "Thank You everyone. text: Model Neeru Randhawa, whose boyfriend Armaan Kohli was arrested for allegedly assaulting her, has said she'll take the case back if he apologises and "says to the law he won't harass her again". text: New Zealand legend Sir Richard Hadlee, the first-ever bowler to take 400 Test wickets, has been diagnosed with bowel cancer. text: Researchers from the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, Germany, have developed a humanoid robot called "HuggieBot" that gives hugs to humans. text: Facebook has denied building an eye-tracking software, according to the company's response to questions from the data scandal testimony. text: After Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar claimed people arrested for inciting the Bhima-Koregaon violence were innocent, the Shiv Sena accused him of destabilising social harmony and playing "dangerous" politics. text: The Taliban militant group has assured Afghans of a bright future once the US "invaders" leave the country. text: Talking about the death threats received by his son Salman Khan from gangster Sampat Nehra, Salim Khan said this isn't the first time he has received such threats. text: Technology giant Apple has changed its App Store rules to limit how developers and apps use information about iPhone owners' friends and contacts, according to Bloomberg. text: Assam Police on Tuesday arrested the prime accused in connection with the lynching of two men by a mob over rumours in Karbi Anglong over a week ago. text: Construction workers working for a private firm constructed part of a road over a dead dog's body in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. text: The Information and Broadcasting Ministry officials on Tuesday said the Press Council of India will decide whether media can use the term 'Dalit' or not. text: The Kerala government has withdrawn the travel advisory issued after the outbreak of Nipah virus in the state. text: The Madhya Pradesh government has started transferring money online to students, who scored 75% and above in Class 12 exams organised by the state board this year, to purchase laptops. Around 88,000 students in the state are eligible to receive Ã¢ÂÂ¹25,000 each, under the scheme. The money has been transferred to over 22,000 eligible students till now.
summary: MP सरकार कक्षा 12 में 75% स्कोर करने वाले छात्रों को धन हस्तांतरित करता है

text: George HW Bush turned 94 on Tuesday, officially becoming the longest living President in US history. The 41st President of the US celebrated his birthday at his home, eight days after being released from the hospital where he was treated for low blood pressure and fatigue. "My heart is full on the first day of my 95th year," Bush said.
summary: जॉर्ज एच डब्ल्यू बुश 94 साल के लिए अमेरिका के सबसे लंबे समय तक रहने वाले प्रीज़ बन गए

text: Hailing the summit between leader Kim Jong-un and Donald Trump as the "meeting of the century", the North Korean state media has said that the US President agreed to lift sanctions imposed on the country. It further said that Trump and Kim invited each other to visit the US and North Korea, respectively, and both accepted the invitation.
summary: ट्रम्प उत्तर कोरिया पर प्रतिबंध हटाने के लिए सहमत हुए: राज्य मीडिया

text: The Bulgarian government overturned the death sentence awarded to a pregnant cow that had crossed European Union borders without adequate paperwork. Penka the cow wandered away from her herd in Bulgaria and crossed into neighbouring Serbia last month. Bulgaria repealed the death penalty after receiving backlash from animal rights campaigners.
summary: सीमा पार कर गई गर्भवती गाय के लिए मौत की सजा खत्म हो गई

text: Huma Qureshi, who starred opposite Rajinikanth in 'Kaala', has said she was scared while shooting for a scene in which she had to yell at him. "That was the hardest [scene]...It was my sixth day at...shoot...I was trying to get my groove of things," she added. Huma further called the scene "powerful" and said she's glad it turned out well.
summary: दृश्य के दौरान डरा हुआ था जहां मुझे रजनी सर पर चिल्लाना था: हुमा

text: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar has said her biggest challenge was when she had her first panic attack at 27. "It's not something you can ignore. You can't sit around and get sucked into a rabbit hole," she added. Zoya further said, "I chose to get help immediately. It took a while to work things out but I'm fine now."
summary: मेरी सबसे बड़ी चुनौती तब थी जब मेरे पास मेरा पहला आतंक था: ज़ोया

text: Janhvi Kapoor and Kartik Aaryan will star opposite each other in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's next film, as per reports. Janhvi is set to make her Bollywood debut with Karan Johar's co-production 'Dhadak', which is an adaptation of Marathi film 'Sairat'. Kartik made his debut with 2011 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and was recently seen in 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'.
summary: जान्हवी, कार्तिक आर्यन को भंसाली की अगली फिल्म में अभिनय करने के लिए: रिपोर्ट

text: The official poster of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Gold', a film on India's first Olympic medal as a free nation, was shared by the film's producer Farhan Akhtar on social media. The film will also mark the Bollywood debut of television actress Mouni Roy. Directed by Reema Kagti, 'Gold' is scheduled to release on August 15.
summary: अक्षय कुमार अभिनीत फिल्म 'गोल्ड' का आधिकारिक पोस्टर जारी

text: WWE wrestler John Cena has replaced Hollywood actor Sylvester Stallone in Jackie Chan starrer 'Project X', as per reports. The action-thriller film, previously titled 'Ex-Baghdad', will be directed by 'Need for Speed' director Scott Waugh. 'Project X' will focus on a Chinese-operated oil refinery that is attacked by terrorists in the Middle East.
summary: जॉन सीना ने प्रोजेक्ट एक्स: रिपोर्ट्स में सिल्वेस्टर स्टेलोन की जगह ली

text: Nike has halted the supply of boots to Iranian footballers ahead of the FIFA World Cup in Russia due to the sanctions imposed by the US following its withdrawal from the nuclear deal. Iranian football team coach Carlos Queiroz slammed the move saying, "We are only managers and footballers, and should not get involved in such matters."
summary: अमेरिकी प्रतिबंधों के बाद विश्व कप से पहले नाइकी ने ईरान को छोड़ दिया

text: Indian men's cricket team captain Virat Kohli received the Polly Umrigar Award (Best International Cricketer) by the BCCI for his performances in the 2016-17 and 2017-18 seasons. In the women's category, Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana received the Best International Cricketer Award (Women) for the 2016-17 and 2017-2018 seasons respectively.
summary: कोहली को बीसीसीआई का सर्वश्रेष्ठ अंतर्राष्ट्रीय क्रिकेटर पुरस्कार मिला

text: Addressing the media in Mumbai, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "Mahagathbandhan (Grand Alliance) is a sentiment in people and not just politics." "Whole nation is united against RSS and BJP," he added. The Congress President further slammed the central government for "burdening" the common man by not bringing fuel under GST.
summary: लोगों में भव्य गठबंधन की भावना, केवल राजनीति नहीं: राहुल

text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has let go of approximately 9% of its workforce in an effort to reduce costs and become profitable, the billionaire said in an email to employees. "These cuts were almost entirely made from our salaried population and no production associates were included," he said. Earlier, Musk told employees that Tesla has been undertaking a thorough reorganisation.
summary: एलोन मस्क की टेस्ला ने लाभदायक बनने के लिए 9% कार्यबल में कटौती की

text: Police have detained members of Vishwa Hindu Dal on Tuesday for trying to perform 'shuddhi-karan' (cleansing) of a Lucknow temple's ghats following an Iftar party organised on Sunday. "Our Sanatan Dharm says that our places of worship become impure with such non-Hindu activities and have to be purified," a member said. They later protested at the police station.
summary: हिंदू समूह के सदस्यों ने इफ्तार के बाद घाटों को साफ करने की कोशिश की

text: The Railway Board has set a target of shedding 11,040 redundant posts in different railway zones in 2018-2019. The posts have been identified to be included in the "pool of surrendered posts", which have either been vacant for long or rendered redundant due to technological advancement. Last year, the number of such surrendered posts was around 10,000.
summary: वित्त वर्ष 19 में रेलवे ने 11,000 निरर्थक पदों में कटौती की

text: Around 17 people were killed and 35 injured on Wednesday after the private bus they were travelling in rammed into a divider and overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. The injured were rushed to a nearby hospital for immediate medical relief. Officials rushed to the spot after learning about the incident and cranes have reportedly been deployed to clear the road.
summary: यूपी में बस के डिवाइडर से टकराने के बाद 17 की मौत, 35 घायल

text: Praising North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has said, "There is great meaning in Chairman Kim's clearly confirming to US President Donald Trump the complete denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula." He further said that resolving the issue of Japanese citizens abducted by North Korea would require the strong support of the US.
summary: उत्तर कोरिया के नाभिकीयकरण में महान अर्थ: जापान पीएम

text: The US on Tuesday reopened its de facto embassy in Taiwan, unveiling the structure after it underwent a $256-million renovation. This comes amid China's objections to the US' ties with Taiwan, which it considers as part of its territory. The US had cut diplomatic ties with Taiwan in 1979 to uphold the 'One China' policy.
summary: अमेरिका ने चीन के साथ तनाव के बीच वास्तव में ताइवान दूतावास को फिर से खोल दिया

text: Discover an inspiring stay at a Hyatt hotel as you explore the historic temples, beautiful beaches, and breath-taking architecture located across India. With world-class dining experiences, impeccable service and unique spa treatments, your stay will be nothing short of memorable.
summary: हयात के साथ मनाएं और 30% तक बचाएं *

text: As many as four BSF personnel were martyred and three were injured in a ceasefire violation by Pakistan in J&K's Samba on Wednesday. Among the deceased were one Assistant Commandant, one Sub-Inspector and two jawans. Pakistani Rangers and BSF had recently agreed to ensure ceasefire along the International Border but Pakistan violated it by opening fire at the BSF party.
summary: पाकिस्तान की ओर से संघर्ष विराम उल्लंघन में बीएसएफ के 4 जवान शहीद

text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday tweeted, "Ekalavya cut off his right thumb because his Guru demanded it. In the BJP, they cut down their own Gurus." Addressing Congress workers in Mumbai, Rahul said that senior BJP leader LK Advani is PM Narendra Modi's "guru and mentor", adding that PM Modi does not treat Advani respectfully during official events.
summary: गुरु के लिए एकलव्य ने अंगूठा काटा, भाजपा ने गुरुओं को काटा: राहुल ने पीएम मोदी पर

text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi went to meet former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee at AIIMS, rebel Congress leader Shehzad Poonawalla said Rahul put politics over the ailing former PM. Shehzad tweeted, "Till 7:30pm or so AIIMS didn't want anybody to visit Vajpayee ji due to tests...Rahul Gandhi knew this but went anyway as political points needed to be scored!"
summary: राहुल ने बीमार पूर्व पीएम वाजपेयी पर राजनीति की: कांग्रेसी विद्रोही

text: The seat and vote share of independent candidates are declining with every election, an analysis of the EC data has revealed. Presently, 11 state assemblies have the lowest-ever seat-share of the independent candidates, while 22 state assemblies have the lowest vote-share of the independent candidates ever recorded. The current Lok Sabha has the second-lowest number of independent candidates.
summary: हर चुनाव में निर्दलीय उम्मीदवारों की सीटें घट रही हैं: अध्ययन

text: The Railways Ministry has selected an artwork created by a 35-year-old peon for the cover of a booklet listing the ministry's achievements in the past four years. The artwork, which depicts Mahatma Gandhi stepping down from a train, was the third entry sent by Shyam Sundar. "The Railway Minister shook my hand and said the painting was beautiful," Shyam said.
summary: चपरासी की कला को रेलवे की उपलब्धि पुस्तक के कवर के रूप में चुना गया

text: Over 47% Muslims in India fear that they will be falsely accused in terrorism cases, a survey carried out by NGO Common Cause has revealed. Out of the 15,563 respondents across 22 states, 26% Muslims believe that police discriminate on the basis of religion. The survey also found that 44% of Indians feared being beaten up by the police.
summary: 47% भारतीय मुसलमान झूठे आतंकवाद के आरोपों से डरते हैं: अध्ययन

text: At least 10 people died and several others were injured on Tuesday due to lightning strikes in several districts of West Bengal. While four people died in Bankura district, three died in Hooghly district, the police said. A woman and her daughter were killed by lightning when they were working in a field in a village.
summary: पश्चिम बंगाल में बिजली गिरने के कारण 10 लोगों की मौत

text: There is nothing wrong in naming a hotel after a caste and the owner's right to do so is guaranteed under the Constitution, a Madras High Court bench held on Tuesday. Quashing criminal proceedings against members of fringe outfit Periyar Dravida Kazhagam, the court said that it was not as if untouchability was being practised at the hotel.
summary: मद्रास एचसी नियम के अनुसार, जाति के नाम पर होटल में कुछ भी गलत नहीं है

text: Warning North Korea against trusting the US, Iran on Tuesday said that US President Donald Trump could cancel the deal before returning home. The US has undermined agreements and has unilaterally withdrawn from them, Iran said referring to US withdrawal from the 2015 nuclear deal. The US and North Korea had signed an agreement to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula.
summary: ट्रंप घर जाने से पहले एन कोरिया का सौदा रद्द कर सकते थे: ईरान

text: Following the summit between US and North Korea, former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's brother Shehbaz Sharif has said India and Pakistan could take steps similar to those taken by the US and North Korea. "There is no reason why Pakistan and India cannot do the same," he added. Shehbaz further said the countries should begin with the issue of Kashmir.
summary: भारत, पाकिस्तान को अमेरिका, एन कोरिया का अनुकरण करना चाहिए: शहबाज शरीफ

text: Newly appointed Real Madrid manager Julen Lopetegui earlier rated Barcelona's Lionel Messi better than Cristiano Ronaldo, saying, "He's the best player ever, I agree." His comment came in reference to Spain and Argentina's chances at 2018 FIFA World Cup. The 51-year-old coach, who previously played for both Real Madrid and Barcelona, will manage the Spanish team at the world tournament.
summary: रियल मैड्रिड के नए कोच ने कभी मेस्सी को सर्वश्रेष्ठ खिलाड़ी कहा

text: Daisy Shah has said that her dialogue "Our business is our business, none of your business" from 'Race 3' has seeped into her house as her sister uses the dialogue while having a normal conversation. "It's really fun when people give their own version to my dialogue," she added. Daisy's dialogue had gone viral after the release of the trailer.
summary: 'हमारा व्यवसाय हमारा व्यवसाय है' संवाद मेरे घर में फैला है: डेज़ी

text: Brazilian forward Neymar and teammates pelted eggs and flour at Philippe Coutinho, who celebrated his 26th birthday on Tuesday. Brazilian World Cup squad members mobbed Coutinho, who was sitting down on the training ground, and later threw water on him as well. Left-back Marcelo was also seen smashing an egg on the world's most expensive player Neymar.
summary: वीडियो में नेमार को उनके जन्मदिन पर टीम के साथी पर अंडे फेंकते हुए दिखाया गया है

text: As many as six players of Cristiano Ronaldo's ex-club Sporting CP have terminated their contracts a month after a group of fans attacked the team for failing to qualify for next season's Champions League. They claimed 'just cause' in dissociating themselves from the club. Around 50 fans had attacked the team, injuring a player and destroying the club's changing room.
summary: प्रशंसकों द्वारा टीम पर हमला करने के बाद 6 खिलाड़ी रोनाल्डो के पूर्व-क्लब को छोड़ देते हैं

text: Addressing Congress workers in Maharashtra, party chief Rahul Gandhi said that he visited former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, who has been admitted to AIIMS, as he was a "soldier of the Congress". He added that PM Narendra Modi does not respect his 'guru' LK Advani, adding that Congress has given more respect to Advani than PM Modi.
summary: बीमार पूर्व पीएम वाजपेयी का दौरा किया, क्योंकि मैं कांग्रेस का सिपाही हूं: राहुल

text: After two policemen were killed and six personnel were injured in attacks by militants in Jammu and Kashmir, Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha Vice President Aijaz Hussain said that Masjids and Madrasas are not teaching real Islam. "If killing innocent people is jihad, better change maulvis of masjids and teachers in madrasas. We need introspection," he wrote in a Facebook post.
summary: मस्जिद, मदरसा जम्मू-कश्मीर में असली इस्लाम नहीं सिखा रहे: भाजपा नेता

text: After Congress president Rahul Gandhi accused PM Narendra Modi of insulting his "guru" LK Advani, BJP spokesperson Anil Baluni said, "The Congress president is practising the lowest form of politics." Stating that the country saw how Congress treated former President Pranab Mukherjee, Baluni added, "The country is watching how the president of the oldest political party is behaving."
summary: राजनीति का सबसे निचला स्वरूप: राहुल ने कहा कि भाजपा पीएम आडवाणी का अपमान करती है

text: The Central Railway has built a waterproof engine that will work even in 12 inches of water, as opposed to the current engine that cannot work in over four inches of water. While the current engine can't function if water enters its motor traction at four inches, the new engine has sealed motors, preventing water from entering the traction.
summary: रेलवे इंजन बनाता है जो 12 इंच पानी में काम कर सकता है

text: As many as 60 families were left homeless after a fire broke out in Chennai's Ennore on Monday. Police suspect that the fire was started in the kitchen of one of the thatched huts. The fire was controlled within two hours after four fire tenders were rushed to the site. No casualties were reported in the incident.
summary: चेन्नई में आग लगने से 60 परिवार बेघर

text: The Centre is in talks over linking driving licences with Aadhaar numbers, Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said on Tuesday, adding that this will help in identifying a drunk driver in case he/she escapes. "I am in conversation with Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to link Aadhaar card with (driving) licence...A person can change name not his/her fingerprints," he said.
summary: आधार के साथ ड्राइविंग लाइसेंस को जोड़ने वाले केंद्र मुल्ला

text: The All Assamese Students Association held a prayer meeting in New Delhi for the two youth who were lynched in Assam's Karbi Anglong last week. The two were lynched after locals thought they were child traffickers due to a message that had been circulating over WhatsApp. "We...insist for immediate punishment of the perpetrators," a member of the association said.
summary: असमिया छात्रों के शरीर में युवा लोगों के लिए प्रार्थना सभा होती है

text: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the murder of journalist Gauri Lankesh on Tuesday arrested a 26-year-old suspect. A total of six suspects have been arrested over the murder, which occurred outside Lankesh's Bengaluru residence in September 2017. Earlier, an accused in the case claimed that he was asked to arrange bullets by another accused as Lankesh was "anti-Hindu".
summary: पत्रिकाओं गौरी की हत्या के मामले में पुलिस 6 वें संदिग्ध को गिरफ्तार करती है

text: The Haryana government has raised the upper age limit of entry into government service from 40 to 42 years, an official spokesperson said on Tuesday. The spokesperson said a circular to this effect was addressed to all administrative secretaries, heads of departments, chief administrators and managing directors of all boards, among others.
summary: हरियाणा सरकार द्वारा 42 साल में सेवा में प्रवेश के लिए आयु सीमा बढ़ा दी गई है

text: A 60-year-old writer and publisher was dragged out of a shop and shot dead by unidentified assailants in Bangladesh's Munshiganj district on Monday. Shahzahan Bachchu had received death threats from extremist groups for promoting secularism in the Muslim-majority nation. Several writers and activists have been murdered in Bangladesh in last three years in attacks by suspected Islamist militants.
summary: सेकुलर लेखक की दुकान से खींचकर हत्या, बांग्लादेश में गोली मारकर हत्या

text: Yes Bank shareholders on Tuesday approved the reappointment of Rana Kapoor as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) for another three-year term starting September 1. His new tenure now has to be approved by the Reserve Bank of India. Notably, Rana Kapoor has been at the helm of the private sector lender since 2004.
summary: राणा कपूर को यस बैंक के सीईओ के रूप में एक और 3 साल के लिए फिर से नियुक्त किया गया

text: No RBI nominee should be on the boards of public sector banks to avoid "any conflict of interest", Governor Urjit Patel said while briefing a parliamentary panel on Tuesday. He also said the primary responsibility to contain bank frauds rests with the boards. Patel further told that the RBI has "inadequate" control over state-run banks and asked for more powers.
summary: बैंक बोर्डों में कोई भी आरबीआई नॉमिनी नहीं होना चाहिए: गवर्नर उर्जित पटेल

text: Current Spain manager Julen Lopetegui, who has represented both Barcelona and Real Madrid as a player, will join Real Madrid as head coach on a three-year deal after the World Cup. The 51-year-old former goalkeeper managed Spain at Under-19, Under-20 and Under-21 levels before moving to Porto and Spain. The Spanish senior team hasn't lost a single match under Lopetegui.
summary: पूर्व बार्सिलोना खिलाड़ी कौन रियल मैड्रिड के नए मालिक का नाम है?

text: In its follow up answers for the questions asked during data scandal testimony, Facebook has said, it "automatically logs IP addresses where a user has logged into their Facebook account." The social media major further said it collects posts, photos, or other content a user has liked. Information regarding dates, times, and titles of advertisements clicked is also collected.
summary: FB का कहना है कि यह IP पते को लॉग करता है जहां उपयोगकर्ता खाते में लॉग इन करते हैं

text: Samsung has filed a motion with a US court challenging a verdict which asked the company to pay Apple $539 million for copying patented iPhone designs. The company asked the court to either dismiss the judgment or retry the case in which the damages were decided. In the case, first filed in 2011, Samsung previously paid $399 million to Apple.
summary: Apple पेटेंट मामले में सैमसंग ने 539 मिलियन डॉलर के फैसले को चुनौती दी है

text: In an apparent reference to PM Narendra Modi, Congress President Rahul Gandhi today said, "Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi ran away with Ã¢ÂÂ¹35,000 crore... and even Lalit Modi decamped... But he (PM Modi) says nothing... He will also run away." He added, "There is fear in his voice... But I am not scared as I am a soldier of truth."
summary: वह भी भाग जाएगा: राहुल गांधी ने पीएम मोदी पर कटाक्ष किया

text: Assam's lone Muslim BJP MLA Aminul Haque Laskar has allegedly received a letter threatening him with dire consequences unless he resigns from the party in 15 days. Two bullets were taped to the letter written in red ink. The 52-year-old said, "It accused me of siding with the BJP despite being a Muslim" and "not opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill-2016".
summary: असम का अकेला मुस्लिम BJPA ¢ l ‰ Ã Ã MLAÃ Â Â Â ‰ को गोलियों से धमकी भरा पत्र

text: As many as 40 people have been arrested for spreading social media rumours on child-lifting gangs that had led to a mob lynching two people in Assam's Karbi Anglong. Further, the police released over 70 people after counselling and making them delete their "objectionable" posts. Around 25 were arrested for the lynching while many others are on the run.
summary: 40 अफवाहें फैलाने के आरोप में गिरफ्तार

text: Around 1,000 people were evacuated from Mizoram's Lunglei and Aizawl districts on Tuesday after monsoon rains triggered a flood in the state. All schools in the state will remain closed on Wednesday as over 180 houses were submerged during the flood. Landslides triggered by the flood blocked several roads and left the affected areas inaccessible.
summary: मिजोरम में भारी बारिश के कारण बाढ़ के रूप में 1000 खाली हो गए

text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has tweeted a fake rejection letter from the University of Bern to Albert Einstein. The letter rejected Einstein's application for a doctorate, claiming that his space-time theory was "more artistic than actual physics". Tharoor later said, "It might still help people by recalling Einstein's early rejection for a doctorate, even if this letter itself is fake".
summary: थरूर ने आइंस्टीन को खारिज करने वाले विश्वविद्यालय पर फर्जी पत्र साझा किया

text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday suggested stopping the US-South Korea joint military exercises and announced the end of "provocative and inappropriate" war games on the Korean Peninsula. "The war games are expensive, we pay for majority of them," Trump added. The US and South Korea have been conducting the exercises in an apparent show of strength against North Korea.

text: Coca-Cola was invented in 1886 by an American pharmacist John S Pemberton, who took a sample of his drink to Jacobs' Pharmacy that placed it on sale as a soda fountain drink. text: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi has revealed it lost $1.1 billion in the first three months, as it prepares for the biggest Initial Public Offering (IPO) since 2014. The company also said its revenue for the quarter came in at $5.37 billion. Xiaomi is expected to raise $10 billion at a valuation of $60-70 billion, according to reports.
summary: आईपीओ से पहले तिमाही में Xiaomi ने $ 1 बिलियन का नुकसान किया

text: Accusing BJP and Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal of using the CBI and Anti-Corruption Branch against AAP, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today said, "The Prime Minister is like a father figure to the nation. He should protect the people, not create troubles." Kejriwal added that the agencies' main intention is to "defame" AAP and stop its work.
summary: पीएम मोदी को लोगों की रक्षा करनी चाहिए, परेशानी नहीं: केजरीवाल

text: An apartment belonging to Audi CEO Rupert Stadler was raided by German prosecutors on Monday after he was named a suspect in Volkswagen's emissions-cheating probe. He is being investigated for fraud and falsifying public documents relating to sales of diesel cars in Europe. This comes almost three years after Volkswagen admitted to falsifying US diesel emissions tests.
summary: ऑडी के सीईओ रूपर्ट स्टैडलर के घर पर जर्मन डीजल जांच में छापा पड़ा

text: Japanese e-commerce startup Mercari's Initial Public Offering (IPO) priced at $1.2 billion will make its 40-year-old Founder Shintaro Yamada a billionaire with about $1.04 billion fortune. Further, the indicated IPO price will give Mercari a market value of $3.6 billion. Founded in 2013, Mercari became Japan's first startup to become a unicorn at $1 billion or more valuation.
summary: जापानी स्टार्टअप मर्करी का आईपीओ संस्थापक को अरबपति बनाने के लिए

text: SoftBank Vision Fund has led a $250-million funding in Cohesity at around $1-billion valuation, the US-based data storage startup announced today. The Series D round also saw participation from Cisco Investments, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital and Sequoia Capital. Founded in 2013, Cohesity offers secondary storage for backup, file services, and analytic datasets.
summary: सॉफ्टबैंक विजन फंड यूएस डेटा स्टार्टअप में $ 250 मिलियन फंड का नेतृत्व करता है

text: An FIR has been filed against five people, including three ex-Aligarh Muslim University students, for allegedly hurting religious sentiments after a photograph on Facebook showed them drinking at a Delhi bar during the month of Ramadan. They received death threats, and posts circulating on AMU groups called for them to be lynched. The three ex-AMU students have gone into hiding.
summary: रमजान के दौरान बार में देखे गए पूर्व एएमयू छात्रों के खिलाफ एफआईआर दर्ज की गई

text: The parking of beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya's luxury airplane Airbus A319, which was seized by service tax department, is costing the Mumbai Airport nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹15,000 per hour. The airport officials say the plane is not fit to fly and its scrap weighs almost 10 tonnes. The plane has been parked for free since a government agency has seized it.
summary: माल्या के जब्त विमान की पार्किंग की लागत मुंबई एयरपोर्ट a ¢ hour15,000 / घंटा है

text: Sub-inspector Bijender Singh Deshwal took a bullet to save a younger 25-year-old colleague who had become a father three months ago during a gunfight between Delhi Police and gangsters on Sunday, Deshwal's son revealed. Following this, the policemen rushed to the hospital, where they were tended to by a medical team that included the daughter of one of the officers.
summary: कॉप सहयोगी के लिए बुलेट लेता है जो हाल ही में पिता बना है

text: Speaking after leaving the G7 summit in Canada, US President Donald Trump accused India of charging 100% tariff on some imports. "I mean, we have India, where some of the tariffs are 100%. A hundred percent. And we charge nothing. We can't do that," Trump said. He threatened to cut trade ties with countries which are "robbing" America.
summary: ट्रम्प ने भारत पर आयात पर 100% टैरिफ लगाने का आरोप लगाया

text: The Chinese founder of world's largest electric vehicle battery maker CATL, Zeng Yuqun, has become a billionaire with a net worth of $3.4 billion, according to Bloomberg. The company achieved a valuation of $12.3 billion on the first day of trading on Monday after its shares soared 44%. The 50-year-old engineer, who started CATL seven years ago, owns 26% stake.

text: Shah Rukh Khan shared a picture of his wife Gauri Khan and their daughter Suhana Khan on social media with the caption, "Life doesn't come with a manual, it comes with a mother." Shah Rukh wrote the line, which he came across while reading, seemed appropriate for the picture. The picture shows Gauri and Suhana at a party in London.
summary: जीवन एक मैनुअल के साथ नहीं आता है, यह एक माँ के साथ आता है: SRK

text: Actress Manisha Koirala feels that the man-woman love is not destined to happen for her. "I'd rather accept this sad truth of my life rather than fall into the wrong relationship again," added Manisha. She further said that she will not allow any man to bring her down while adding, "Can't afford to make wrong moves...God has given me...second chance."

text: Actor Shahid Kapoor has shared a picture from the sets of 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu'. The film stars Shraddha Kapoor opposite Shahid while Yami Gautam will reportedly be seen playing a lawyer in the Shree Narayan Singh directorial. Shahid earlier said, "The story is based in Uttarakhand so I will be using a certain accent and dialect for the film."
summary: शाहिद कपूर ने बत्ती गुल मीटर चालु के सेट से तस्वीर साझा की

text: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo's bicycle kick in the Champions League quarterfinal against Juventus features in the official reveal trailer of the EA Sports FIFA 19 video game. The game, which will release on September 28th, will also feature PSG's Neymar Jr on its cover this year. The game will officially feature UEFA Champions League for the first time.
summary: रोनाल्डो की साइकिल किक फीफा 19 के ट्रेलर में दिखाई गई है

text: After Scotland became the first-ever Associate nation to defeat a top-ranked ODI side, Sachin Tendulkar called for more opportunities for "teams with massive potential" to play against "more experienced" teams. "Cricket has all the ingredients to become a global game," he added. Scotland scored 371/5 against England, becoming the first Associate nation to post an ODI total of 350-plus.

text: Pacer Mohammad Shami has been dropped from the Indian squad for the Afghanistan Test after failing to clear the Yo-Yo fitness Test at National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru. Delhi pacer Navdeep Saini, who took 34 wickets in eight matches in Ranji Trophy last season, has been named as Shami's replacement. The Test against Afghanistan will start on June 14.
summary: यो-यो टेस्ट में फेल होने के बाद शमी भारतीय टेस्ट टीम से बाहर हो गए

text: County Championship match between Lancashire and Essex was halted for around 35 minutes after an air ambulance landed on the outfield to attend to an ill spectator. A male supporter had collapsed in the pavilion and was taken to hospital in one of three ambulances that had arrived at the scene. The play restarted after the air ambulance took off.
summary: प्रशंसक की मदद के लिए मैच एयर एंबुलेंस की जमीन के रूप में रुका हुआ था

text: Portugal football team goalkeeper Rui Patricio's wife Vera Ribeiro, who is a sex therapist, has said that players should practice masturbation before the matches to improve their performance at the upcoming World Cup. She said that players who masturbate will be more relaxed and less stressed than those who abstain. The World Cup is scheduled to start on June 14.
summary: WC जीतने के लिए, मैचों से पहले हस्तमैथुन करें: पुर्तगाल कीपर की पत्नी

text: England on Sunday became the first team in cricket's history to be a number one ranked side losing an ODI to an associate nation after their six-run loss against Scotland. Scotland's 371 was the highest ODI total ever by an associate nation, while Jonny Bairstow became the only England batsman to hit a third consecutive ODI ton.
summary: इंग्लैंड प्रथम विश्व नं। एक सहयोगी राष्ट्र से हारने वाली 1 टीम

text: A BJP worker and his four family members were found murdered at their residence in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Sunday. The incident came to light when Kamlakar Pohankar failed to respond to several calls, following which locals barged into his home. Police suspect that the murders could have been committed due to personal enmity.
summary: भाजपा कार्यकर्ता, 4 परिवार के सदस्यों की नागपुर में हत्या

text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has claimed that lack of clarity in the policy objective suggests that the government is "very confused" regarding what to do with Air India. "It is neither privatisation nor a joint venture arrangement...you cannot succeed in selling 70% or any stake in Air India," he added. Notably, the government received zero bids for the loss-making airline.
summary: पी चिदंबरम का दावा है कि एयर इंडिया को लेकर केंद्र असमंजस में है

text: A man allegedly threw acid on his wife and daughters and drank it to kill himself in Delhi on Saturday. The police reached the spot, where the man was declared dead while the mother and daughters were rushed to the hospital where they are undergoing treatment. During investigations, the police found the couple had fought before the man bought acid.
summary: दिल्ली में पत्नी, बेटियों पर तेजाब फेंकने के बाद आत्म हत्या

text: A video of hundreds of chicks running around after hatching from eggs thrown at a dump site in Georgia's Marneuli has gone viral. The eggs were reportedly thrown away by a local poultry farm. Local officials said the warm temperature at the site and its rocky landscape had created conditions favourable for the eggs to hatch.

text: After the Delhi Assembly accepted a resolution on full statehood to Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said the AAP will campaign for BJP if Delhi gets statehood before the 2019 general elections. "We'll make sure that each and every vote from Delhi goes in your favour," he said. Otherwise, "Delhi residents will put up boards saying 'BJP leave Delhi'", he added.
summary: हम 2019 के चुनाव से पहले दिल्ली में बनी भाजपा का समर्थन करेंगे: केजरीवाल

text: Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan has claimed in a book that the Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician is homosexual and had relationships with Pakistani actor Hamza Ali Abbasi and member of his political party, Murad Saeed. Reham, whose marriage with Imran lasted 10 months, had earlier accused him of having an illicit affair with a female employee of his political party.
summary: इमरान खान समलैंगिक, पुरुषों के साथ संबंध रखते थे: पूर्व पत्नी

text: The trailer of Diljit Dosanjh and Taapsee Pannu starrer 'Soorma' has been released. 'Soorma' is based on the life of former Indian hockey team captain Sandeep Singh, whose role will be portrayed by Diljit. Directed by Shaad Ali, the film also stars Angad Bedi and is scheduled to release on July 13.
summary: दिलजीत दोसांझ का ट्रेलर, तापसी स्टारर a सोरमा ’रिलीज़ हुआ

text: Rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday moved the Delhi High Court against CM Arvind Kejriwal for his low attendance in the Delhi Assembly. Mishra's petition alleged the CM was present only seven times in 2017 although the Assembly had 27 sessions. He also claimed CM Kejriwal wasn't present in the Assembly in the last 40 months during Question Hour.

text: In its mouthpiece Saamana, Shiv Sena on Monday said that the recent assassination threats to PM Narendra Modi and Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is "nothing less than a thrilling plot of a horror story". Condemning the politicisation of the matter, it added, "It is okay if lakhs are killed, but the saviour of lakhs has to live."

text: Google's parent company Alphabet's venture arm CapitalG has led a $21.5 million funding round in Gurugram-based startup Aye Finance. The Series C funding round also saw participation from existing investors SAIF Partners and LGT Group. Founded in 2014, the startup provides business loans to small and micro enterprises across the country.
summary: CapitalG भारत के Aye Finance में $ 21.5 मिलियन फंड का नेतृत्व करता है

text: Amazon has admitted to violating labour laws at the China factory which manufactures Echo speakers and Kindle e-readers. A March audit revealed that over 40% of staff were low-cost agency workers who didn't get holiday or sick pay. It was also revealed that workers were not paid properly for overtime and had to ask for permission to use the washroom.

text: The woman IAS officer who has accused Haryana Additional Chief Secretary Sunil Gulati of sexual harassment has now said that she fears for her life. She added that such incidents happened to her before and no action was taken against the officers she complained about. Meanwhile, Gulati has denied the allegations and said he is ready to face a probe.
summary: मेरे जीवन के लिए डर: अधिकारी पद वरिष्ठ के उत्पीड़न का आरोप लगाते हुए

text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi while speaking at an event in Delhi on Monday said that Coca-Cola company was started by a man who used to sell 'shikanji' in America. The man's talent was recognised and he was given money to start the Coca-Cola company, Gandhi added. He further claimed that McDonald's was started by a man who ran a 'dhaba'.

text: The Delhi High Court upheld a man's life sentence for murdering his wife after his 5-year-old stepdaughter testified against him. The child said the man would often beat her mother and that she saw him injure her with a sharp object, as well as shove a gas pipe in her mouth. Her testimony was substantiated by the forensic report.

text: A video of Kim Jong-un's bodyguards running alongside his limousine shortly after the North Korean leader arrived in Singapore has surfaced online. The bodyguards were earlier spotted during Kim's summit with South Korean President Moon Jae-in. Singapore is the farthest the North Korean leader has traveled from his home country since assuming power in 2011.
summary: वीडियो: सिंगापुर में किम जोंग-उन के अंगरक्षक जॉगिंग करते हैं

text: According to FIFA, the 2014 edition of the FIFA World Cup was watched by 3.2 billion people (approximately 44% of world's population) on their in-home televisions for at least a minute or more. Meanwhile, the total audience for the final between Argentina and Germany, including in-home and out-of-home figures for viewers watching for at least one minute, hit 1.013 billion.
summary: विश्व की लगभग 44% जनसंख्या ने फीफा विश्व कप 2014 देखा

text: D-Mart parent Avenue Supermarts on Monday joined the Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 trillion ($14.8 billion) market capitalisation club after the company's stock price hit a new record high. This comes after promoter Radhakishan Damani sold 1% stake last week to ensure that the firm meets minimum public shareholding norms.

text: Actor Arjun Kapoor, in a social-media post addressed to his half-sister Janhvi Kapoor, wrote, "Sorry I'm not there in Mumbai but I'm by your side, don't worry." He wrote this ahead of the release of the trailer of Janhvi's debut movie 'Dhadak'. "I just wanted you to know this profession is amazing if you work hard, be honest," added Arjun.

text: Janhvi Kapoor revealed that once while watching the Marathi film 'Sairat' with her late mother Sridevi, she told her how she wished to debut in such a film. She added, "Me and mom had this big discussion (about) how even she wanted a role like this for me." Janhvi will debut in 'Dhadak', which is an adaptation of 'Sairat'.

text: Rafael Nadal, who won his record eleventh French Open title, might lose his world number one ranking to Roger Federer if the Swiss reaches the third round of the upcoming grass court tournament, Stuttgart Open. Federer, who will reach the tournament's final if he registers three wins there, lost in the opening round to Tommy Haas last year.

text: After leading Indian football team to Intercontinental Cup victory with a brace in the final, captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to thank fans for backing the team. "What a feeling! Thank you, India! This win is for the fans who filled the stands, cheered from home...and believed in us," he wrote. Chhetri scored 8 goals in the tournament
summary: यह जीत उन प्रशंसकों के लिए है जिन्होंने स्टैंड्स भरे: सुनील छेत्री

text: Rajasthan Royals' wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has been left out of India A squad to tour England after failing the mandatory Yo-Yo test, according to reports. The 23-year-old was the only player who fell below the required 16.1 mark, reports added. Samson was the second-highest run-scorer for Rajasthan Royals in the IPL 2018, hitting 441 runs in 15 matches.

text: South Korea-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinrail on Sunday announced that its platform has been hacked resulting in the loss of a reported amount of $40 million. According to its website, the exchange has already suspended services and managed to freeze two-thirds of stolen tokens. Coinrail also said 70% of its reserves have been moved to a cold wallet without internet access.
summary: कोरियाई क्रिप्टो एक्सचेंज Coinrail हैक, $ 40 मिलियन से अधिक खो देता है

text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX is reportedly planning to build a new facility in Florida, US to launch 64 rockets per year. Reports suggest most of the launches will be using Falcon 9 rockets which Musk believes can be launched up to 100 times before retirement. SpaceX has also asked NASA for a 67-acre patch of land for this purpose, reports added.

text: When asked if he wished to wipe out the Opposition from the country, BJP chief Amit Shah replied, "Democracy is not possible without the Opposition...But it is the responsibility of Rahul Gandhi to keep the Congress alive, not mine." Discussing his party slogan of 'Congress-mukt Bharat', he added, "Congress-mukt Bharat means getting rid of the 'Congress culture'."

text: After the Centre listed openings for joint secretary-level posts for private sector employees, Congress said the government wanted to recruit people from RSS and "industrial houses". The Congress also called it an attempt to sabotage the current system of recruiting experienced civil servants to the posts. It questioned why these posts were opened to "Indian nationals" and not "Indian citizens".
summary: आरएसएस को शामिल करने के लिए संयुक्त सचिव स्तर के पदों के लिए सरकार का उद्घाटन: गीत

text: The Delhi Police has filed a case against self-styled godman Daati Maharaj for allegedly raping a female follower two years ago inside a temple run by him in Chhattarpur. The victim reportedly said she did not file a complaint earlier as she was intimidated by him. She added that there are several other women whom he has physically assaulted.
summary: स्वयंभू धर्मगुरु दाती महाराज ने अनुयायियों के साथ बलात्कार करने का मामला दर्ज किया

text: Three tourists from Maharashtra, including a police constable and his brother, drowned off Goa's Calangute beach on Monday morning. Two others who had been pulled into the sea because of the strong undercurrents were able to swim back to the shore. The victims were declared brought dead at a health centre after being pulled out by locals.
summary: महा सिपाही सहित तीन पर्यटक, गोवा के समुद्र तट पर डूब गए

text: Dr Kafeel Khan, accused in the death of over 60 children in Gorakhpur, said his brother was shot at by bike-borne assailants 500 metres away from Gorakhnath temple where Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was staying. Adding that his brother was operated on successfully, he posted a video on social media, saying, "Allah rahem kare. M not going to bend."
summary: भाई ने 500 एमटी की गोली मारी, जहां से यूपी सीएम रहे: गोरखपुर डॉक

text: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad allegedly beat up his wife with an iron rod after she refused to cook mutton for him. The accused, who was drunk at the time, his father and brother then threw her off the third floor to make it look like an accident, reports said. She succumbed to her injuries before reaching the hospital.
summary: नशे में आदमी उसके लिए मटन पकाने से मना करने पर पत्नी को मार देता है

text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel has said US President Donald Trump's decision to not endorse the G7 statement is "a bit depressing". "Sometimes it seems Trump thinks that only one side wins and everyone else loses," she added. Calling the US a less reliable partner, Merkel said the EU needs to stand together to increase its influence on the world stage.
summary: ट्रम्प ने जी 7 के बयान को 'निराशाजनक' कहा: मार्केल

text: Fraud-accused jeweller Nirav Modi has fled to the UK, where he is seeking political asylum, according to reports. Nirav Modi, who is being investigated in the over Ã¢ÂÂ¹13,000-crore PNB scam, is in London trying to claim asylum alleging "political persecution". text: The trailer of 'Dhadak', the debut film of late actress Sridevi and producer Boney Kapoor's daughter Janhvi Kapoor, was released on Monday. text: JEE Advanced topper from 2009 is working with Google in San Francisco, while the 2010 topper is pursuing a PhD at Switzerland's Institute of Neuroinformatics. The 2011 topper is now an IAS officer after securing an AIR 24 in his first attempt in the UPSC exams. The 2012 and 2013 toppers are employed with Tower Research Capital and Microsoft respectively.

text: Karan Johar has revealed he defecated in open as he got a "bad loose motions attack" while shooting for the song 'Suraj Hua Maddham' in Egypt for 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. text: The Formula One chequered flag, which signifies the end of the race, if waved prematurely results in the final positions being determined by the rankings at the end of the previous lap. text: A power bank kept inside the bag of a man who was travelling in a bus in China suddenly exploded on May 30, the video of which has gone viral. The man, who was talking to another man when the power bank exploded, threw the bag out of the bus. None of the passengers or the man were injured.

text: The RBI has reportedly asked payment services firms to provide fortnightly updates on action taken by them to store transaction data in the country. RBI on April 6 mandated all payment companies to store user data only in India and ensure compliance within 6 months. It said "only certain" operators currently store the data either partly or completely in India.

text: During surprise inspections between August 2017 to April 2018, the Excise Department found nine prominent venues at popular Delhi spots such as Hauz Khas and Connaught Place serving expired beer. text: India will get its first national police museum in Lutyens Delhi, a senior official said on Sunday. text: Scotland, who are placed 13th in ODI rankings, defeated top-ranked England by six runs in the one-off ODI on Sunday. text: Traders' body Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has threatened to launch a nationwide agitation if the government clears $16-billion Flipkart-Walmart deal. text: Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey on Sunday denied media reports of planning a ban on khaini, or chewing tobacco. text: The brother of Dr Kafeel Khan, accused in the death of over 60 children at a Gorakhpur hospital, was allegedly shot at by bike-borne assailants on Sunday. text: Police have arrested former BJP minister Lal Singh's brother Rajinder Singh for abusing Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti during a rally aimed at demanding a CBI probe into the Kathua rape and murder case. text: A 17-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh was shot dead on Friday, four days after she submitted a police complaint alleging sexual harassment by four people. text: A Czech woman drowned after being trapped inside Prague's underground drainage system while participating in a global GPS-based treasure hunt, police officials said. text: A newborn baby in Brazil's Canarana was buried for seven hours after her family apparently thought she was dead. The newborn, who was rescued by police, suffered two fractures to her skull and had her umbilical cord attached.

text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri scored both the goals in India's 2-0 Intercontinental Cup final win against Kenya on Sunday to equal Argentina captain Lionel Messi's tally of 64 international goals. text: BJP chief Amit Shah today said the SC/ST Act and reservation system in jobs will be enforced till the BJP-led government is in power. He added, "In the coming days, Congress will spread different types of lies to mislead people. Sometimes they will say the SC/ST Act is being abolished, on other occasions they will say reservation is being scrapped."n
summary: SC / ST एक्ट, सत्ता में बीजेपी तक बने रहने के लिए आरक्षण: अमित शाह

text: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's elder son Tej Pratap Yadav has dismissed reports of a rift with his younger brother Tejashwi Yadav over a struggle for power in the party. He added, "I want that Tejashwi becomes the PM one day." Referring to the Mahabharata, Tej also said he wished to make his brother sit on the throne like Arjun.
summary: तेजस्वी के साथ कोई अनबन नहीं, आशा है कि वह भावी पीएम बनेंगे: तेजप्रताप

text: A 16-year-old girl named Kasibhatta Samhitha, who has become the youngest engineer in Telangana, said she cleared Class 10 with 8.8 GPA when she was 10 years old. Samhitha added, "I opted for electrical and electronics engineering which I cleared with 8.85 GPA." She further said that she aims to join the power sector after finishing masters in engineering.
summary: 10 वीं कक्षा में उत्तीर्ण होने पर मैं 10 वर्ष की थी: तेगना सबसे छोटी लड़की इंजीनियर थी

text: The all-India topper of JEE Advanced 2018 exam, Haryana's Pranav Goyal on Sunday said that he wants to get into the startup business after studying computer science engineering from IIT Bombay. Goyal topped the exam by scoring 337 marks out of 360. "I knew IÃ¢ÂÂd be among the top 10, but rank 1 came as a surprise," he added.
summary: IIT: JEE टॉपर से पढ़ाई के बाद स्टार्टअप बिज़ में आना चाहते हैं

text: At least 13 people have been killed across Kerala amid heavy rainfall this monsoon, with most deaths caused due to drowning. The Meteorological Department has warned of strong winds with a speed of 40-50 kmph in the state in the next 24 hours. Further, fishermen have been advised to not venture into the sea.
summary: केरल में भारी बारिश के कारण 13 लोगों की मौत

text: A 28-year-old Haryana woman IAS officer in a Facebook post has accused a senior officer of sexually harassing her, saying, "He asked me to get up and come closer to his chair." She claimed she was being harassed for "adverse comments on official files." She added her superiors threatened to file complaint against her to spoil her Annual Confidential Report.
summary: उन्होंने मुझे अपनी कुर्सी के करीब आने को कहा: IAS ने उत्पीड़न का आरोप लगाया

text: The Madras HC on Friday dismissed an FIR against 46 BSNL employees, which stated they posted an emoji of 'crying with laughter' in response to a serious WhatsApp message. Filed by a BSNL divisional engineer from Tamil Nadu, the FIR said that the WhatsApp message pertained to customer complaints. The complainant said she felt "offended" and "humiliated" by the response.
summary: गंभीर चैट में इमोजी पोस्ट करने के लिए 46 लोगों के खिलाफ एफआईआर खारिज कर दी गई

text: The Andhra Pradesh Police has booked a 45-year-old woman for allegedly raping a 15-year-old boy in Vijayawada. Police said the woman, whose husband passed away seven years ago, seemingly sexually abused the victim for over a month. The incident came to light when the victim's mother spotted the accused in their house after she tried to rape the boy again.
summary: 45 साल की विधवा ने आंध्र में 15 साल के लड़के के साथ बलात्कार करने का मामला दर्ज कराया

text: An all-woman team of Indian Army officers, led by Colonel Omender K Pawar, have scaled Mount Bhagirathi II and set a world record for performing yoga at an altitude of 19,022 feet. The team of nine officers broke the previous record held by the Indian Army for performing yoga at about an altitude of 18,800 feet on the Siachen Glacier.
summary: महिला सेना के अधिकारियों ने 19,022 फीट पर योग किया, रिकॉर्ड बनाया

text: New York-based organisation China Labor Watch has released a report claiming the workers at Amazon's China factory are required to work over 100 hours of monthly overtime, violating Chinese labour laws. The workers are also required to arrive at work 10 minutes before their shift begins, without compensation. Further, the staff dormitories lack adequate fire-safety precautions, the report added.
summary: अमेजन चाइना फैक्ट्री में कर्मचारियों की अधिकता, अंडरपेड: रिपोर्ट

text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's upcoming films 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' and 'Stree' will release on the same day as both the films are scheduled to release on August 31, as per reports. She will star alongside Shahid Kapoor in 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' while her co-star in 'Stree' is Rajkummar Rao. Yami Gautam will also feature in 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu'.
summary: श्रद्धा की 'बत्ती गुल ...' में उनकी 'स्ट्री' के साथ क्लैश: रिपोर्ट

text: Actor Salman Khan has said that there is no 'Wanted' or 'No Entry' sequel happening. He further named 'Bharat', 'Dabangg 3' and 'Sher Khan' as some of his upcoming films. Salman added, "Then there is a dance film with Remo (D'souza) and one (Sanjay Leela) Bhansali film when he comes and narrates it. We recently discussed it."
summary: सलमान की कोई 'वांटेड' या 'नो एंट्री' का सीक्वल नहीं है

text: Actor Rajkummar Rao, while talking about how some actors have a 'starry' attitude, said, "What is this starry thing? Why do you have to do it? Just be yourself, man." He added that a 'starry' attitude happens when people take themselves too seriously. "I take my work very seriously but I don't take myself seriously," the actor further said.
summary: यह तारों वाली बात क्या है? बस अपने आप हो: राजकुमार राव

text: 'The Mask of Zorro' actor Antonio Banderas said Salma Hayek didn't disclose she was sexually harassed by Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein as she "was trying to protect her friends and herself". Salma told Antonio that Harvey was "very powerful and could make or break careers" and she thought if her friends confronted Harvey, they "would pay a very high price".
summary: सलमा ने हमारी रक्षा के लिए हार्वे की बात नहीं की: 'ज़ोरो' के अभिनेता

text: As per reports, Deepika Padukone has rejected the offer to star in 'xXx 4' as she is avoiding taking projects around November owing to her marriage to Ranveer Singh during that time. Reports added that the actress would not be seen in 'xXx 4' unless there is a change in their wedding date.
summary: दीपिका ने अपनी शादी की वजह से xXx 4 की पेशकश को खारिज कर दिया: रिपोर्ट

text: Actors Sanjay Dutt and Sidharth Malhotra will star in Prakash Jha's next directorial, as per reports. Reports added that Sanjay has liked the script and will start working on the film by the end of this year. Prakash also reportedly met Sidharth after which the actor agreed to be part of the film.
summary: संजय और सिद्धार्थ प्रकाश झा की फिल्म में अभिनय करने के लिए: रिपोर्ट

text: Bangladesh men's cricket team opener Tamim Iqbal took to Instagram to share a video of the team celebrating the women's team's Asia Cup final victory against India. In the video, Iqbal can be seen jumping in joy in a dressing room, along with Mashrafe Mortaza, Mustafizur Rahman and others, after watching the women's team clinch victory on the last ball.
summary: B'desh पुरुषों की टीम ने महिलाओं की आखिरी गेंद पर एशिया कप जीत का जश्न मनाया

text: A 21-year-old aspiring cricketer died after being struck by lightning during practice at the Calcutta Cricket Academy in Kolkata on Sunday. Debabrata Pal, who was an all-rounder, had joined the academy last month. Club Secretary Abdul Masood revealed that they performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) on Pal after he collapsed but he did not respond to it.
summary: कोलकाता में 21 साल के आकांक्षी क्रिकेटर को बिजली मारती है

text: Addressing AAP workers, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said the party will launch a city-wide phased campaign to demand complete statehood for the national capital. Dubbing it the 'L-G, Delhi Chodo' campaign, Kejriwal accused L-G Anil Baijal of creating hurdles for the party's development projects. Party leaders will hold 300 public meetings to ensure that the campaign reaches every house.
summary: L-G, Delhi Chodo: AAP का दिल्ली के लिए पूर्ण राज्य का अभियान

text: Congress MLA Randeep Surjewala has said that while the party has a time-tested policy of working with ideologically compatible parties, it will not abandon its state leaders' interests during the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. He added, "The Indian National Congress will never sacrifice the... aspirations of its workers. An ideal balance will be struck on a state to state basis."

text: Elon Musk-led tunnelling startup The Boring Company has distributed the first batch of its 20,000 commercial flamethrowers called 'Not a Flamethrower' to customers at the company's headquarters. Priced at $500 each, the remaining 19,000 flamethrowers will be shipped out in the coming weeks. Earlier in January, Musk sold $3.5 million worth of flamethrowers in less than 24 hours.

text: Responding to complaints against the $16-billion Flipkart-Walmart deal, the Minister of Commerce and Industry Suresh Prabhu has said, "We are not making any value judgement on it." Adding that violations are looked into by agencies mandated for them, he said it was the job of Enforcement Directorate (ED) and the RBI to look into the complaints against the deal.
summary: फ्लिपकार्ट-वॉलमार्ट सौदे पर मूल्य निर्णय नहीं करेंगे: प्रभु

text: Day curfew in Meghalaya's capital Shillong was relaxed for 11 hours on Sunday to allow people to attend church service, the police said. Shillong had witnessed communal violence during the past week following an altercation between a Punjabi woman and a Khasi bus conductor.

text: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has said around 1,000 auto-rickshaw drivers will welcome Congress President Rahul Gandhi in their vehicles during his trip to Mumbai. He added that the drivers' decision depicts the common man's love for Rahul. Nirupam further said, "Rahul ji ensures that the common man's opinions, grievances and inputs not only reach him but also are responded to."
summary: मुंबई में राहुल गांधी का स्वागत करेंगे 1000 ऑटो: कांग्रेस

text: Slamming Congress President Rahul Gandhi for seeking an account of work done by the BJP-led Central government, BJP chief Amit Shah today said, "Rahul baba, why are you asking for our account of four years? We do not need to give you any account." He asked, "Your family governed the country for...55 years. Why has there not been any development?"
summary: अमित शाह ने राहुल गांधी की खिंचाई की, उन्हें 'राहुल बाबा' कहा

text: The quarter-final match between Austria and Switzerland in 1954, which produced 12 goals, is the highest scoring match in FIFA World Cup history. Austria defeated the hosts 7-5, with nine of 12 goals coming within the first 40 minutes. The match came to be known as 'Heat battle of Lausanne' due to the high temperature (40ÃÂ°C)  it was played under.

text: A new song titled 'Kar Har Maidaan Fateh' from Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Sanju' has been released. It has been composed by Vikram Montrose, with vocals by Sukhwinder Singh and Shreya Ghoshal. Shekhar Astitwa has penned the song's lyrics. Written and directed by Rajkumar Hirani, the film also stars Sonam Kapoor, Paresh Rawal, Manisha Koirala, Vicky Kaushal and Dia Mirza.

text: US-based bicycle-sharing company LimeBike has equipped its dockless electric scooters with built-in alarms that issue verbal warnings when touched without unlocking via its app or paying. The scooters shout 'Unlock me to ride me or I'll call the police!' as a warning to users. However, a LimeBike spokesperson said that the feature did not ever actually call the police.

text: Haryana's 17-year-old Pranav Goyal on Sunday topped the JEE Advanced 2018 exam by scoring 337 marks out of 360. An alumnus of Bhavan Vidyalaya in Panchkula, Goyal scored 97.2% in CBSE Class 12 exams and had secured All India Rank 4 in JEE Mains. He scored 350 marks out of 360 in JEE Mains.

text: A two-month-old baby in Kerala escaped without any injuries on Saturday when the makeshift cradle he was sleeping in, along with the roof of the house, was blown away due to strong winds. The cradle carrying him wedged itself onto a coconut tree adjacent to the house. Following this, the baby was rescued by villagers who heard his mother's cries.

text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha Mukherjee on Sunday asserted that her father will not enter active politics again. Mukherjee had addressed a gathering at the RSS headquarters earlier this week.

text: Karnataka Board's Class 10 topper Mohammad Kaif Mulla who scored 625 marks out of 625 after rechecking, on Sunday said, "624 marks were insufficient for me because I expected more". Earlier a joint topper, Mulla scored full marks in Science after rechecking and became the topper with 100%. He is the topper among 13 lakh students of the state board.
