text: A video showing Queen Elizabeth II's great-granddaughter Savannah Phillips covering her cousin Prince George's mouth with her hand to shut him up has gone viral online. The doubts about trust in banks can be attributed to rising bad loans due to defaults by the "very rich and very powerful," he added. Referring to the PNB scam, Reddy said it's the taxpayers who pay for the losses.

text: The currency with the public has reached a record high of over Ã¢ÂÂ¹18.5 trillion, more than double from a low of Ã¢ÂÂ¹7.8 trillion post demonetisation, RBI data showed. text: Actress Kajol has said that her husband Ajay Devgn is better than her when it comes to pampering their children Nysa and Yug. "I pamper my kids but there are always limits to it," she added. She further said, "I am very conscious of the rules and their daily routine of sleep and food timing."
summary: अजय मुझसे बेहतर है निसा और युग: काजोल को लाड़ प्यार

text: Salman Khan has said that some people from the film industry will never be welcomed in his home. "There are one or two families from whom I have not got that respect and love. That's where it ends," he added. He further said he doesn't have enemies in the industry but it's just that he doesn't like a few people.

text: SunRisers Hyderabad head coach Tom Moody has said that Afghanistan's 19-year-old leg-spinner Rashid Khan will create "enough headaches" for the Indian batsmen in the upcoming Bengaluru Test. "I am yet to see someone successfully read him...his deception is still a big weapon," he added. Notably, Rashid has taken 35 wickets in just four first-class matches he has played.

text: The Brazilian government will relax the work timings so that the citizens can watch Brazil's FIFA World Cup matches. People will be allowed to report to work by 2 pm on the days when Brazil play in the morning (according to Brazil time). Further, they can leave from work by 1 pm when Brazil have matches in the afternoon.

text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan termed 56-year-old commentator Harsha Bhogle as 'SIR' after having earlier referred to him as 'bro' in one of his tweets. Bhogle on Saturday tweeted that he had no problem in being called 'bro' by the 19-year-old despite the age difference. Reacting to his tweet, Rashid wrote, "Thank you (Harsha Bhogle) SIR.

text: Apple is reportedly replacing the physical buttons in Apple Watch with solid-state side buttons which are touch-sensitive. The new buttons will not physically click but instead, reacts to a user's touch through a haptic feedback similar to iPhone 7 home button. The new buttons are expected to be announced later this year or in the 2019 Apple Watch, reports added.

text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that the BJP is suffering because of PM Narendra Modi's ego, adding that the party is "running from pillar to post to keep the NDA flock together." Stating that he respected PM Modi despite being senior to him in politics, Naidu said PM Modi wanted to keep all alliance partners under his control.
summary: पीएम मोदी के अहंकार की वजह से बीजेपी पीड़ित: आंध्र सीएम नायडू

text: Congress leader and former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit has slammed the Delhi government, stating that a conflict with the Centre or Lieutenant Governor cannot be an excuse to not work. "Public wants governance not complaints," she added. In his reply, incumbent CM Arvind Kejriwal challenged the former three-time CM to run the Delhi government under PM Narendra Modi-led Centre's regime.
summary: काम न करने के बहाने L-G से संघर्ष: दीक्षित से AAP सरकार

text: Slamming RSS for inviting ex-President Pranab Mukherjee to its event, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said the organisation could be preparing to put him forward as PM candidate in 2019 if BJP fails to get majority. Meanwhile, an editorial in Shiv Sena's newspaper 'Saamana' claimed that RSS never invited late Bal Thackeray because he believed in "expansive Hinduism".
summary: आरएसएस 2019 में पूर्व-राष्ट्रपति प्रणब को पीएम उम्मीदवार के रूप में नामित कर सकता है: शिवसेना सांसद

text: V Dhivakaran, the estranged brother of deposed AIADMK leader VK Sasikala, launched a political party named 'Anna Dravidar Kazhagam' in Tamil Nadu today. The party, named after Dravidian veteran CN Annadurai, has a party flag featuring a green star and red and black stripes. Notably, Dhivakaran fell out of favour with Sasikala following a spat with their nephew TTV Dhinakaran.
summary: शशिकला के वजीर भाई ने नई राजनीतिक पार्टी शुरू की

text: While talking about his first company being sold 19 years ago, billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday said, "I had to decide between buying a house in Palo Alto or a McLaren F1." Adding that there was no contest about it, Musk said that he bought the F1 and a small condo that was much cheaper than the car.
summary: पहली कंपनी की बिक्री के बाद बड़े घर पर रेस कार: मस्क:

text: The family of a woman from Hyderabad has asked External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj for a probe after the woman died under allegedly suspicious circumstances in Saudi Arabia's Dammam. The woman's sister has claimed that her husband would torture her mentally and physically and used to beat her up. She added that she suspected he had murdered her.
summary: सऊदी में हाइड महिला की मौत, परिवार ने स्वराज से मांगी जांच

text: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan on Saturday said that only Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath are incorruptible. Adding that he cannot say the same about other leaders in the party, Sharan said, "Our Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath do not indulge in any kind of corruption."
summary: केवल पीएम मोदी, सीएम योगी ही बीजेपी में अस्थिर हैं: पार्टी के नेता

text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has accused the CBI and Anti-Corruption Branch of randomly picking files from the Delhi Jal Board, of which he is the minister-in-charge, to "somehow frame" him "in something". Asking the agencies to explain the reason or "apologise to Delhiites for this witch-hunting exercise", Kejriwal further said he will release the list of files sought by them.
summary: दिल्ली के सीएम केजरीवाल ने सीबीआई, एसीबी पर आरोप लगाया कि वह उन्हें फ्रेम करने की कोशिश कर रहे हैं

text: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has said Congress' "doors are open" for an alliance in Madhya Pradesh and that seat sharing won't be a "speed breaker" for like-minded parties to come together. Scindia, whose remarks come amid reports of a Congress-BSP tie-up, added, "(CM) Shivraj Singh Chouhan should worry about his own party rather than being so concerned about the Congress."
summary: एमपी में गठबंधन के लिए 'दरवाजे खुले', कांग्रेस ने कहा सिंधिया

text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un arrived in Singapore on Sunday for his historic summit with US President Donald Trump on June 12. The trip to Singapore represents the farthest Kim has traveled from North Korea since taking power after his father's death in 2011. text: UN Secretary-General AntÃÂ³nio Guterres has said that India is a "very important inspiration" for the world, lauding its efforts in achieving the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals. Guterres was speaking on the first anniversary of the India-UN Development Partnership Fund which was set up to help implement the goals. India has announced an assistance of $100 million over ten years.

text: Rajesh Bharti, one of Delhi's 10 most wanted criminals, was killed in a shootout with police in south Delhi on Saturday morning, along with three members of his gang. At least 35 rounds of gunfire were exchanged, with six police officers also receiving bullet injuries. Bharti had at least 25 cases against him and carried a reward of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh.

text: The American Automobile Association has launched a contest to find the first couple to get married in one of its self-driving shuttles in Las Vegas. The contestants will have to write a 400-word essay describing how an autonomous vehicle would have changed their road trip experience with their partner. The winning couple will be married on June 30.

text: Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, who turned 33 today, revealed she wanted to get married only after meeting Anand Ahuja, who she married recently. "Before that, I didn't believe in the institution of marriage," she added. Talking about the fondest memory of her birthday, Sonam recalled a surprise that Anand had planned when they had been dating just for two months.

text: Salman Khan has jokingly said that the film 'Tiger Zinda Hai' will get a sequel titled 'Zoya Zinda Hai'. The character of Zoya was played by Katrina Kaif in 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. "The sequel to 'Tiger Zinda Hai' is absolutely happening. I have even heard the plot of it," added Salman.
summary: जोया जिंदा है टाइगर ज़िंदा है का सीक्वल, सलमान का मजाक उड़ाया

text: In his speech aimed at inspiring students who did not score well in Class 12 exams, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "He (Amitabh Bachchan) did not have any good formal education degrees." text: Saif Ali Khan has been served a legal notice from Interpol with regards to the wild boar hunting case in Bulgaria. text: A 295.6-kilogram fish patty, whose preparation was led by a Mumbai-based food and beverage company has been adjudged the world's largest by the Guinness World Records. The cutlet, which was prepared in Goa, is a popular seafood snack in the state. The patty, which had a height of 29 centimetres and diameter of 122 centimetres, was prepared in August 2017.

text: Virender Sehwag has revealed that ahead of the World Cup 2003, coach John Wright's vote for the team's opening pair resulted in 14 out of 15 chits calling for a Sachin Tendulkar-Sehwag opening pair. Sehwag jokingly said that he knows that the one chit that called for Sourav Ganguly to open was from the then captain Ganguly himself.
summary: 15 वोटों में से 14 सचिन चाहते थे, मैं WC 2003 में खोलूंगा: सहवाग

text: Addressing the students of MIT on Friday, Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg said that in one of her early jobs, she had a boss who "belittled" her publicly. text: After announcing that it is discontinuing its Messenger service after 20 years, Yahoo is recommending its users to use its group messaging app called Squirrel. text: A Duke University-led study has claimed to find "widespread uranium contamination in groundwater from aquifers in 16 Indian states". "Nearly a third of all water wells we tested in Rajasthan contained uranium levels that exceed WHO's safe drinking water standards," said researchers, who took samples from 324 wells in Rajasthan and Gujarat and analysed previous studies for 14 other states.

text: A doctor was arrested for allegedly trying to smuggle 35 mobile phones, 4 kg marijuana and alcohol into KolkataÃ¢ÂÂs Alipore Central Jail on Friday. text: A 29-year-old businessman and his 28-year-old girlfriend suffocated to death on Wednesday after they were trapped inside their parked car as its air-conditioning stopped working. text: A Delhi-based gay stylist has alleged that the Delhi Police assaulted him for hugging his friend, who was a transwoman, on the street. The man was released after he signed an undertaking promising to not complain against police.

text: The family members of 31-year-old IIT-Delhi graduate Anshum Gupta, who committed suicide after jumping off the institute's building on Friday, said they had no idea he went there to commit suicide. A relative said Gupta quit his job around 5-6 months ago because he was unhappy with his professional growth. After graduation, Gupta worked for two years in the US.

text: Two men were lynched in Assam's Karbi Anglong on Friday after they were mistaken to be kidnappers by locals. The victims, who were reportedly travelling to see a waterfall, died on the spot after their SUV was attacked. A video of the incident shows one of the victims saying, "Don't kill me...please don't beat me. I am an Assamese."

text: The Taliban militant group in Afghanistan has for the first time announced a three-day ceasefire during the Eid holiday. text: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday awarded his country's first Friendship Medal to his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin and called him his best friend. Xi said that the medal is China's highest state honour for foreigners and is presented to those who made outstanding contributions to China's modernisation drive, promoted cooperation between China and the world, and safeguarded world peace.

text: Actress Jacqueline has said entertainment is a brutal business where things change every Friday. "At times we get demotivated at so many different levels because everything changes on Friday- fans, idea and loyalty," she added. Jacqueline further said, "There is no foolproof formula of success or failure here, but the result gives you the reality check every week."

text: Actress Preity Zinta, who recently added her husband Gene Goodenough's initial to her name, tweeted, "After marriage I decided to take the G from my husband's name. One G is Goodenough for me." summary: वन जी काफी अच्छा: पति के नाम में प्रारंभिक जोड़ने पर प्रीति

text: Mexican football team's coach Juan Carlos Osorio defended his side's players who were reportedly having a party with prostitutes after their friendly match against Scotland last Saturday. text: Former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar recalled that he used to talk to his former opening partner Sourav Ganguly in Bengali to relax him to play his natural game while batting together. Sachin said that while Rahul Dravid and Gautam Gambhir were "very serious" and did not talk much, he used to talk a lot to Virender Sehwag while batting alongside him.

text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said that he used to offer his opening partner Virender Sehwag bananas from across the dressing room to make him "shut his mouth". Sachin also revealed that when he asked Sehwag to stop singing songs while batting against South Africa in World Cup 2011, Sehwag replied that singing the songs kept his mind busy.

text: Using data from NASA's Kepler Space Telescope, Spain-based astronomers have announced the discovery of two new planetary systems, with one of them hosting three Earth-sized planets. The first discovery involved a red dwarf star 160 light-years from Earth while other red dwarf had two 'super-Earths' about twice the size of the Earth, having surface temperatures over 3,000 ÃÂºC, said researchers.

text: The crater in Rajasthan's Ramgarh village, long debated to have evolved from "tectonic activity" or "magmatism", was caused by "meteorite impact", a team including scientists from Geological Survey of India (GSI) has claimed. A 3-km-diameter meteorite is likely to have fallen at the location several crore years ago creating a trench of about 4 km diameter, said a team member.

text: A woman who was declared a widow after the death of her husband 20 years ago, recently moved an application that he was alive in the Revenue Public Court in Rajasthan's Nimbara village. The woman brought him to the court on Thursday, saying, "Give me the status to be happy..." The authorities then registered him to be alive in records.
summary: घोषित विधवा महिला ने 20yrs के लिए पति को 'मृत' कर दिया

text: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against former BCCI chief AC Muthiah and 23 others for allegedly causing a loss of Ã¢ÂÂ¹102.87 crore to Syndicate Bank. Muthiah, a former chairman of First Leasing company, cheated the bank by submitting forged financial statements to obtain "undue credit limits". The bank also alleged the company showed inflated income and assets since 1998.

text: Srinath Raghavan's book 'The Most Dangerous Place' has claimed ex-US President Bill Clinton warned ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif in 1999 against going to war with India. The US feared an India-Pakistan war would lead to an all-out confrontation with nations like Russia and China joining the war.

text: An Income Tax raid against a Noida engineer on Friday revealed he has 5 cars, 25 properties and two families. Noida Authority's Chaudhary Brijpal Singh has two wives with two sons and a daughter, one set of each in Noida and Faridabad. He kept same names for his children from both wives to ease the property buying and selling procedure.

text: The trailer of 'First Man', starring actor Ryan Gosling as astronaut Neil Armstrong, who became the first man to walk on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission, has been released. text: A four-day-old baby's leg was amputated after a nurse allegedly forgot a hair dryer on for 1.5 hours next to the child at a hospital in China. The newborn suffered serious burns and doctors had to amputate the leg to save his life. Two other babies, who were also in the room, sustained minor burns in the December 2017 incident.

text: American tennis player Sloane Stephens, who is set to face world number one Simona Halep in the final of the French Open 2018, was ranked 957 around 11 months ago. The 25-year-old, who won her maiden Grand Slam at the US Open 2017, has a 6-0 win-loss record in tournament finals. Meanwhile, Halep is a two-time runner-up at French Open.

text: Jack Ma-led Alibaba's affiliate Ant Financial's valuation now stands at $150 billion, more than investment bank Goldman Sachs' $88 billion, according to reports. The funding round made Ant Financial the world's largest fintech firm, according to Bloomberg.

text: After Facebook claimed it cut off developer access to user data in 2015, a report claiming the company struck data-sharing deals with select companies and shared details of users' friends has surfaced. Denying the reports, Facebook said after 2015, it gave a short extension to a few developers, adding it did not share any users' friends' private data.
summary: एफबी 2015 के बाद फर्मों के साथ उपयोगकर्ताओं के दोस्तों के डेटा को साझा करने से इनकार करता है

text: A startup named Shift has sued Apple for $200,000 over copying its logo for the company's Shortcut app. "It's mind-blowing that Apple, the firm with the biggest cash pile in history...had to copy our logo," Shift said. Apple introduced the app for Siri on iOS 12, which allows users to create their own commands for the digital assistant, this week.
summary: स्टार्टअप ने अपने 'शॉर्टकट' ऐप के लिए लोगो की नकल करने के लिए Apple पर मुकदमा दायर किया

text: A developer named Matt Moss has posted a video on Twitter which shows him controlling an iPhone with his eyes, using Apple's augmented reality framework called ARKit. It shows Moss looking at the button to click it and then blinking to press the button. Commenting on the technology, Moss said it can "improve the lives of people with disabilities."

text: A student in Bihar's Arwal has scored 38 out of 35 marks in Class 12 state board exam for theory in Maths and 37 out of 35 marks in objective questions. "Such things have been happening in the state board exams for long," he said. Another girl in Vaishali scored 18 marks in Biology, an exam she didn't appear for.
summary: कक्षा 12 के बोर्ड में बिहार के छात्र 35 में से 38 अंक प्राप्त करते हैं

text: The owner of a paan chain in Hyderabad has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman after drugging her using a paan. The woman claimed she became friends with the accused through Facebook four years ago after which they started an affair. He blackmailed her using their intimate pictures and videos when she suggested they get married, she added.
summary: पान चेन के मालिक ने ड्रग-लीव पान का इस्तेमाल कर महिला के साथ बलात्कार किया

text: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has said that forced and unnatural sex amount to cruelty and can be grounds for divorce on "the basis of evidence". The court observed this while granting divorce to a woman from Bathinda who alleged her husband forced her for unnatural sex after consuming liquor and beat her when she refused.
summary: मजबूर, अप्राकृतिक यौन संबंध तलाक के लिए आधार हैं: उच्च न्यायालय

text: A constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow has shot himself to death at his government quarters reportedly because he was unable to cope with his 20-hour shift. The constable often complained about his long working hours since he could not find the time to spend with his family, his friends said. No suicide note was recovered from the scene.

text: Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed will not be a candidate in Pakistan's upcoming general elections but his terror organisation Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) will contest for over 200 seats. JuD will contest the elections on the platform of Allaha-u-Akbar Tehreek because the group's own political front Milli Muslim League (MML) has not yet been registered with the Pakistan Election Commission.
summary: हाफिज सईद 200 सीटों के लिए पाक चुनाव, JuD नहीं लड़ेगा

text: Swara Bhasker has said that the best way to deal with stereotypes is by taking risks. "When I came to...film industry...I was told not to play any character of a sister or best friend of the protagonist," added Swara. "I thought if those are the rules to get the lead role, why not break them," she further said.
summary: रूढ़ियों से निपटने का सबसे अच्छा तरीका जोखिम लेना है: स्वरा

text: Janhvi Kapoor, in an Instagram story, shared a childhood picture of herself in which she can be seen dressed as a clown. The Joker is a fictional character who appears in Hollywood director Christopher Nolan's 2008 superhero film 'The Dark Knight'.
summary: जोकर के लिए मैं नोलन की पहली पसंद थी, जान्हवी कपूर का मजाक उड़ाया

text: Pixar Chief John Lasseter on Friday said he is stepping down, months after allegations of making staff feel uncomfortable with "unwanted hugs". He will stay in a consulting role until he steps down at the end of 2018. Lasseter apologised last year to "anyone who has ever been on the receiving end of...(any) gesture they felt crossed the line."
summary: 61 वर्षीय डिज्नी के कार्यकारी ने 'अनचाहे गले' पंक्ति पर चुटकी ली

text: The spokesperson of former footballer David Beckham and his wife, fashion designer Victoria Beckham, while denying reports that they are getting divorced, called the rumours "a crock of sh*t". "There's no statement due, no divorce, and a lot of Chinese whispers and fake social media news. This is all very bizarre and an embarrassing waste of time," the spokesperson added.
summary: यह श * टी का एक क्रॉक है: डेविड, विक्टोरिया तलाक की अफवाहों से इनकार करते हैं

text: After 19-year-old Afghan spinner Rashid Khan called 56-year-old commentator Harsha Bhogle "bro" on Twitter, the latter tweeted, "Hey @rashidkhan_19, no problem with the "bro" bit. Go for it! text: The Dutch city of Eindhoven is set to be the first in the world to have habitable houses made by a 3D printer. The project would help reduce carbon footprint as less cement would be needed for their construction.

text: Slamming former President Pranab Mukherjee's visit to the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "The Congress is finished." Pointing out that Mukherjee attended the RSS event despite having been in the Congress for 50 years, Owaisi questioned, "Do you still have hopes from this party?" He suggested regional parties as an alternative, stating they should be strengthened.
summary: कांग्रेस खत्म: पूर्व राष्ट्रपति प्रणब के आरएसएस के दौरे पर ओवैसी

text: Three crew members arrived at the International Space Station on Friday as their Soyuz module successfully docked to the Earth-orbiting laboratory. The trio completed the station's six-member crew as three astronauts returned to Earth last Sunday after 168 days in space. The Expedition 56 crew includes NASA's Serena AuÃÂ±ÃÂ³n-Chancellor, ESA's Alexander Gerst and Russian cosmonaut Sergey Prokopyev.

text: JNU student leader Umar Khalid has filed a police complaint alleging he received death threats from a man claiming to be gangster Ravi Pujari. Adding that he has asked for police protection, Khalid tweeted, "He said that I am on his HIT LIST!" Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani and Alt News Co-founder Pratik Sinha also alleged they received threats from Pujari.

text: US President Donald Trump has said that he would invite North Korean leader Kim Jong-un to the White House if next week's summit between the two leaders in Singapore is successful. He added, "I think he (Jong-un) would look at it very favourably." Trump had earlier said that the summit "is going to be much more than a photo-op".
summary: अगर शिखर सम्मेलन अच्छी तरह से चलता है तो जोंग-उन को व्हाइट हाउस बुलाया जाएगा: ट्रम्प

text: New York's Governor Andrew Cuomo has launched a suicide prevention programme in the wake of recent celebrity suicides of chef Anthony Bourdain and fashion designer Kate Spade. The Attempted Suicide Short Intervention Program "tailors treatments to the specific needs of individuals and...get people the support they need," Cuomo said on Friday.
summary: सेलेब की आत्महत्या के बाद न्यूयॉर्क ने आत्महत्या विरोधी कार्यक्रम शुरू किया

text: The US has unveiled the world's most powerful supercomputer called 'Summit', beating the previous record-holder China's Sunway TaihuLight. With a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second, it is over twice as fast as Sunway TaihuLight, which is capable of 93,000 trillion calculations per second. Summit has 4,608 servers, which reportedly take up the size of two tennis courts.
summary: अमेरिका ने दुनिया के सबसे शक्तिशाली सुपर कंप्यूटर का खुलासा किया, चीन को हराया

text: US President Donald Trump on Friday said he was considering granting a posthumous pardon to late boxing legend Muhammad Ali, who was convicted for refusing military service during the Vietnam War. Responding to the proposal, Ali's attorney said, "We appreciate President Trump's sentiment, but a pardon is unnecessary." Muhammad Ali's conviction was overturned by the US Supreme Court in 1971.
summary: ट्रम्प ने बिना किसी दृढ़ विश्वास के मोहम्मद अली को क्षमा कर दिया

text: Yahoo has announced it is discontinuing its Messenger service after 20 years, from July 17, after which users won't be able to login. However, users can download their chat history from the company's website till six months. "If you're looking for a Messenger replacement, Yahoo recommends the product Squirrel, which is currently in beta and invite only," the company said.
summary: लॉन्च के 20 साल बाद याहू मैसेंजर को बंद करना

text: Retired High Court judge CS Karnan on Friday launched the flag for his new political party 'Anti-Corruption Dynamic Party', which is the fourth to be launched in Tamil Nadu after late CM Jayalalithaa's demise. The first and only HC judge to have retired while absconding, Karnan earlier announced his party will only field women candidates in 2019 Lok Sabha elections.
summary: पूर्व-एचसी न्यायाधीश कर्णन ने नई राजनीतिक पार्टी के लिए झंडा लॉन्च किया

text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has allotted himself 11 ministries including Finance, Energy, and Infrastructure Development. Deputy CM and Congress leader G Parameshwara kept three portfolios including Home and Bengaluru City. With 77 elected MLAs, the Congress retained 22 ministries, while the JD(S), with 37 MLAs, got 12 ministries.
summary: K'taka CM कुमारस्वामी वित्त सहित 11 मंत्रालय रखते हैं

text: The world's largest iceberg has broken-up after drifting from Antarctica towards the equator, images from the space station have shown. After separating from Antarctica's largest ice shelf in 2000, pieces of the 11,000-sq-km iceberg have floated towards warmer waters in the tropics. NASA said it wouldn't be possible to track the melting iceberg further if the chunks get any smaller.
summary: 18 साल बाद भूमध्य रेखा के पास पिघलने के लिए दुनिया का सबसे बड़ा हिमखंड

text: China reportedly hacked the computers of a US Navy contractor and stole 614 gigabytes of highly sensitive data on undersea warfare, including plans for a supersonic anti-ship missile for use on submarines. The Chinese Embassy said it knows nothing about the reported hack, adding, China "staunchly upholds cyber security and combats all forms of cyber attacks in accordance with law".
summary: चीन ने संवेदनशील अमेरिकी नौसेना के युद्धक डेटा को हैक किया: रिपोर्ट

text: Praising a Mumbai traffic police officer who kept performing his duty in rain for 2.5 hours, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Heroic acts should not just be those grand ones...but everyday acts of duty & concern." He added, "We need to expand our definition of heroes." A video showed 47-year-old Nandkumar Ingle doing his duty without any waterproof gear in heavy downpour.
summary: वीरतापूर्ण कार्य: महिंद्रा पुलिस की प्रशंसा करता है जो 2 घंटे तक बारिश में खड़ा रहा

text: Human rights lawyer Amal Clooney, the wife of Hollywood actor-producer-director George Clooney, said, "I met George when I was 35 and starting to become quite resigned to the idea that I would be a spinster. Then we met." George and Amal got married in September 2014 and are parents to their twins Alexander and Ella, who were born last year.
summary: सोचा था कि मैं एक स्पिनर बनूंगा लेकिन जॉर्ज से 35 पर मिले: अमल क्लूनी

text: Swara Bhasker took to social media to share a picture with Sonam Kapoor on the occasion of her 33rd birthday today. "Knowing you has meant knowing that friendship and solidarity can exist even in this glittering world of glamour and showbiz," wrote Swara. She has worked with Sonam in 'Raanjhana', 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' and 'Veere Di Wedding'.
summary: शोबिज में हो सकती है दोस्ती: सोनम के जन्मदिन पर स्वरा

text: Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share the first still from his upcoming film 'Simmba', directed by Rohit Shetty. The actor, who will play a cop in the film, wrote in the caption, "ROHIT SHETTY ka HERO. CAPS LOCK mein." Produced by Karan Johar, and also starring Sara Ali Khan, 'Simmba' is scheduled to release on December 28.
summary: रोहित शेट्टी की फिल्म 'सिम्बा' से रणवीर ने पहले शेयर किया

text: Television network HBO has confirmed it will make a prequel to its series 'Game of Thrones'. HBO said in a statement that the prequel will take place "thousands of years before the events of 'Game of Thrones'". However, the show won't be aired until at least a year after the finale of 'Game of Thrones', which will air in 2019.
summary: एचबीओ 'गेम ऑफ थ्रोन्स' प्रीक्वल श्रृंखला की पुष्टि करता है

text: Talking about the fight sequence between Jacqueline Fernandez and Daisy Shah in 'Race 3', Salman Khan said, "It looks like two men fighting and it also has its humour and slight sensuousness." "The kicks they've given are lethal. They've really, really trained for it," he added. Also starring Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor, 'Race 3' will release on June 15.
summary: रेस 3 में जैकलीन, डेज़ी का फाइट सीन जानदार है: सलमान

text: The Indian women's cricket team qualified for the record seventh Women's Asia Cup final after thrashing Pakistan by seven wickets on Saturday. India managed to restrict Pakistan to a total of 72/7, with Ekta Bisht picking 3/14 in her four overs. Riding on Smriti Mandhana's 38 and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur's 34*, India won the match with 23 balls to spare.
summary: 7 वें महिला एशिया कप के फाइनल में पहुंचने के लिए भारत ने पाक को पछाड़ दिया

text: Golden State Warriors lifted their third NBA title in four years and their second title in a row after completing a 4-0 clean sweep over LeBron James-led Cleveland Cavaliers in the sides' Game 4 on Saturday. Warriors, for whom Steph Curry scored 37 points, handed the Cavaliers a 108-85 loss, with Cavaliers' LeBron James ending the match with 23 points.
summary: वॉरियर्स ने लेब्रोन की अगुवाई वाली टीम को 4 साल में तीसरा एनबीए खिताब जीतने के लिए उतारा

text: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh posted a video on Twitter of his arm-wrestling session with WWE wrestler 'The Great Khali'. "Panja with great Khali #DalipSinghCWE #bigfella #Awesomeguy #bigman," the 37-year-old spinner wrote as his post's caption. Khali had visited Harbhajan's house in Jalandhar around two years back when Harbhajan had gifted him a signed bat.
summary: 'द ग्रेट खली' के साथ हरभजन सिंह की कुश्ती

text: Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp has now started labeling forwarded messages in Android beta. Forwarded messages carry a tag above the message saying 'Forwarded', which helps inform the receiver of the message that the sender has forwarded it. Notably, WhatsApp does not give the users an option to disable the label.
summary: WhatsApp अब बीटा में संदेशों को अग्रेषित करता है

text: Uber has applied for a patent for an AI system that can predict if a user is drunk while booking a cab. According to the application, the system would track users' typing speed (including typos) on the app, walking speed, booking location, among others. A 'drunk' passenger might only be matched with trained drivers, and prevented from joining a carpool.
summary: उबेर का उद्देश्य नशे की सवारियों की पहचान करने के लिए एक एआई प्रणाली को पेटेंट करना है

text: A letter sent by the Railway Board to zonal General Managers has revealed that 15 incidents of fire involving locomotives, coaching stock and freight stock have been reported in the past five months. The letter cites laxity in the maintenance of rolling stock, lack of supervision, and insufficient security as the reasons behind the accidents.
summary: पांच महीने में रेलवे में आग लगने के 15 मामले सामने आए

text: A massive fire broke out on Saturday morning in Kothari mansion, a ground-plus-five-storey building that had been declared 'dangerous' by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. Located in a densely populated area in south Mumbai, the building had been vacant for five years. Two firefighters were injured after a portion of the building collapsed while they tried to douse the fire.
summary: मुंबई इमारत घोषित 'खतरनाक' बड़े पैमाने पर आग पकड़ता है

text: A seven-year-old girl in Kolkata died while trying to imitate a suicide scene from a TV serial. She was alone at her house with her two-month-old brother during the incident. Her mother, who had gone to a post office, discovered her hanging from the roof on returning home and rushed her to a hospital where she was declared brought dead.
summary: टीवी शो से सुसाइड सीन की नकल करते हुए कोलकाता की लड़की की मौत

text: BJP MLA Champalal Devda has been caught on the CCTV slapping a policeman and threatening to kill him inside a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas district. The MLA also hurled abuses at the officer for questioning his nephew on entering a restricted area of the police station where two rape-accused were lodged. An FIR has been registered against him.
summary: बीजेपी विधायक ने पुलिस स्टेशन पर दिया सिपाही को थप्पड़, जान से मारने की धमकी

text: Trivandrum archbishop Soosa Pakiam has urged all Christian schools to include Constitution literacy as part of their moral science curriculum. Stating that children should "love the Constitution", he added, "It is highly dangerous that hatred and fear are invoked among various groups as a shortcut to power." The Constitution defines and decides the basic character of a nation, he said.

text: BJP veteran leader LK Advani said former President Pranab Mukherjee's decision to visit RSS headquarters and give a speech on nationalism was a significant event in India's contemporary history. He added that RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and Mukherjee have demonstrated how dialogue can transcend ideological differences. Advani further said that the two leaders show that India accepts "pluralism of faiths".
summary: पूर्व-प्रेज़ आरएसएस का इतिहास का एक महत्वपूर्ण कार्यक्रम है: आडवाणी

text: The Supreme Court on Friday directed the Centre to set up a committee to study the management of culturally and architecturally important temples across the country. The committee has to specially focus on facilities provided to pilgrims and the utilisation of funds. The order came in response to a plea on malpractices in the management of Odisha's Shri Jagannath temple.
summary: मंदिरों के प्रबंधन का अध्ययन करने के लिए समिति गठित करें: केंद्र को एससी

text: Trump-Kim themed dishes are being served in Singapore's food outlets ahead of the summit between the US and North Korean leaders next week. A Mexican restaurant is selling 'Rocket Man' and 'El Trumpo' tacos, while a bar is serving special summit drink called the 'Bromance'. Another restaurant is serving 'Trump-Kim Chi Nasi Lemak', a dish with American and Korean elements.
summary: ट्रम्प-किम थीम वाले व्यंजन सिंगापुर में यूएस-एन कोरिया शिखर सम्मेलन को चिह्नित करते हैं

text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharmaceutical added Ã¢ÂÂ¹9,523 crore to market capitalisation on Friday after the US health regulator USFDA didn't recommend any action against the company's Halol plant in Gujarat. The company's shares surged about 8%, taking its total market valuation to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.26 lakh crore. The drugmaker faced regulatory scrutiny over manufacturing standards violations at the plant.

text: Mohammad Kaif Mulla, who scored 624 marks out of 625 in the Karnataka board exams for Class 10, has now become the state topper after he sent his paper for re-evaluation and got 100%. Earlier a joint topper, Mulla had scored full marks in all subjects except Science. He was confident of his answers and sent it for re-evaluation.
summary: रीचेकिंग के बाद 624/625 स्कोर 625/625 के साथ कर्नाटक का लड़का

text: A video of celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain with Malayalam film actor Mammootty has surfaced online after the chef's death on Friday. Anthony, who passed away at the age of 61, is heard saying "strange and fantastic" while watching the shooting of Mammootty's film in India. The old video was part of a TV show that Anthony hosted.
summary: ममूटी के साथ स्वर्गीय सेलेब शेफ एंथोनी का वीडियो ऑनलाइन उभरता है

text: Billionaire Bill Gates has invited students graduating from a US college in 2018 to download free e-book of late Hans Rosling's 'Factfulness'. The book lays out Rosling's argument that the world is actually in a much better state than we think. Gates said this blueprint for how to think "factfully" is especially relevant for graduates, but "everyone should read it."

text: India Under-19 and India A coach Rahul Dravid will not be travelling to Sri Lanka with the U-19 team which features Arjun Tendulkar, who broke into the team for the first time. The 45-year-old will oversee India A team for their tour of England, which starts on June 17. WV Raman will coach U-19 team in the absence of Dravid.

text: After the Congress and the RJD claimed that the reports of alleged assassination plan of PM Narendra Modi are planted, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "What can be more outrageous, unsavoury, and wicked?" "Congress Party has destroyed all the norms of civility and polity. As long as we are among humans, let us be humane," he added.
summary: पीएम मोदी को धमकी के बारे में खबरों पर कांग्रेस की प्रतिक्रिया: भाजपा

text: India's first indigenous, long-range artillery gun 'Dhanush' has cleared its final test and is ready to be inducted into the Indian Army, a senior official said on Friday. Earlier this month, fifty rounds of shells each were fired from six Dhanush guns, which are reportedly called 'desi Bofors'. The gun also passed the tests in cold, humid, and hot conditions.
summary: इंडक्शन के लिए तैयार पहली भारतीय निर्मित तोपें: सेना

text: The businessman who alleged that Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's Principal Secretary SP Goyal demanded a Ã¢ÂÂ¹25-lakh bribe for facilitating the setting up of a petrol pump has retracted his allegations. This comes after he was detained by police for over eight hours on Friday. In a video, he claimed that he made the allegations after "losing his mental balance".
summary: नजरबंदी के बाद योगी की सिक्युरिटी के खिलाफ शिकायत दर्ज

text: A nine-year-old boy was accidentally shot by a Railway Police Force jawan after his rifle fired when he dropped it at Kolkata's Dum Dum Metro station, according to reports. The impact of the fall unlocked the rifle's safety catch and the bullet hit the boy's leg. The jawan has been detained and CCTV footage from the station is being investigated.
summary: कोलकाता मेट्रो में जवान की राइफल गिरने के बाद 9 साल पुरानी गोली

The jawan was treated from 2014 to 2017, the district administration said. However, the hospital claimed it sent bills amounting to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.6 lakh, not Ã¢ÂÂ¹16 crore.

text: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday called his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin his "best, most intimate friend" and awarded him China's first Friendship Medal. Xi hailed China-Russia bilateral relations, claiming the two countries overcame all "fluctuations" in global politics. The two countries further pledged to increase mutual support and coordination in international affairs.
summary: पुतिन मेरे सबसे अच्छे दोस्त हैं: चीनी राष्ट्रपति शी

text: In a leaked audio recording, UK Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson was heard saying that if US President Donald Trump led the Brexit negotiations then the UK would "actually get somewhere". "I have become convinced that there is method in his madness...He'd go in bloody hard," Johnson added. Johnson has been critical of UK PM Theresa May's handling of Brexit negotiations.
summary: अगर ट्रम्प ने ब्रेक्सिट का नेतृत्व किया तो हम कहीं जा सकते हैं: यूके फॉरेन सेकी

text: A couple from Canada lost custody of their daughter after they insisted that their stuffed lion, claimed to represent 'Lord Jesus', is their lawyer. The couple, who said that they were getting counsel straight from the Lord through this lion, was found to have a history of violent arguments and had "unstable working and living arrangements".
summary: दंपति का कहना है कि भरवां शेर उनका वकील है, बाल हिरासत में

text: Walmart has sued its former chief tax officer Lisa Wadlin for violating her employment agreement by joining rival Amazon. Walmart said Wadlin informed in January she was considering resigning but the company didn't learn she was joining Amazon until separation papers were signed in May. The company seeks to to stop Wadlin from taking the Amazon position until May 2020.
summary: वॉलमार्ट ने अमेज़न में शामिल होने के लिए अपने पूर्व मुख्य कर अधिकारी पर मुकदमा दायर किया

text: Actress Yami Gautam's younger sister Surilie J Singh was recently asked to leave a restaurant in Serbia, as she was not wearing pants. Yami shared a video in which Surilie is explaining why she was asked to leave the restaurant. Surilie is currently in Serbia with Yami, who is shooting for the upcoming film 'Uri'.
summary: यामी की बहन ने पैंट न पहनने के लिए रेस्तरां से बाहर निकलने को कहा

text: Hollywood actor Michael B Jordan has said that he only wants to play roles which are written for white males and not the roles which are specifically written for black people. "I don't want any pre-bias on the character," added Jordan. He played the character Erik Killmonger in the film 'Black Panther'.
summary: सफेद पुरुषों के लिए लिखित भूमिकाएँ चाहते हैं, काले पुरुषों की नहीं: माइकल

text: The release date of the upcoming Rishi Kapoor starrer 'Rajma Chawal' has been announced as August 31, 2018. "Experience the social journey of a father and son with Rajma Chawal," tweeted the film's director Leena Yadav. She added, "Funny, we live in the space age generation yet fail to communicate with people that matter the most?"
summary: ऋषि कपूर की 'राजमा चावल' की रिलीज की तारीख की घोषणा

text: Actor Anil Kapoor, who was recently a part of the season 3 of Salman Khan's reality game show 'Dus Ka Dum', apologised to his mother on the show for not remaining in touch with her always. "I apologised to my mom on national television because you can never show enough love to her," said Anil.
summary: सलमान के शो पर मां से माफी मांगते अनिल कपूर

text: Talking about Ranbir Kapoor portraying Sanjay Dutt in the upcoming biopic 'Sanju', Arshad Warsi said, "No matter what you do, you cannot be Sanju! You can't be the original." He added, "The way Sanju walks and talks; an actor can only imitate". Earlier, Salman Khan had said that Sanjay should have portrayed his older self in the film.
summary: कोई फर्क नहीं पड़ता कि आप क्या करते हैं, आप संजू नहीं हो सकते: रणबीर पर अरशद

text: Playing in her first ODI, Ireland Women's 17-year-old leg-spinner Cara Murray on Friday conceded 119 runs in 10 overs against New Zealand Women, the most by any bowler in an ODI (Men's/Women's). Further, four Ireland Women bowlers gave away 90-plus runs in the innings. Former Australian men's team fast bowler Mick Lewis had conceded the previous most runs (113).
summary: 17-वर्षीय खिलाड़ी ने 119 रन बनाए, जो एक वनडे में सबसे अधिक है

text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Friday defeated world number six Juan Martin del Potro to enter his 11th French Open final and 24th Grand Slam final. The 10-time French Open winner will face maiden Grand Slam finalist Dominic Thiem of Austria in the summit clash on Sunday. Notably, Nadal has lost just two of his 87 Roland Garros matches.
summary: 10 बार के चैंपियन नडाल ने अपने 11 वें फ्रेंच ओपन के फाइनल में प्रवेश किया

text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar recalled that to get 'shy' Virender Sehwag comfortable with him, he invited him for a dinner where Sehwag revealed that he thought eating chicken would make him fat. "Only thing I told him was if I looked fat! Ever since [then], he [Sehwag] has been eating chicken," Sachin said.
summary: सहवाग ने सोचा कि चिकन खाने से वह मोटे हो जाएंगे: सचिन

text: In the latest ICC T20I rankings for bowlers, each of the first nine positions are held by spinners, with six of first seven positions being occupied by leg-spinners. Further, Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah is the only pacer in top 10, occupying the 10th position. Third-placed Yuzvendra Chahal is the only other Indian in the top 10.
summary: T20I के सभी शीर्ष स्पिनर, बुमराह शीर्ष 10 में केवल पेसर हैं

text: After the police said some CPI (Maoists) members were planning a Rajiv Gandhi-like assassination of PM Narendra Modi, BJP MP Subramanian Swamy said, "Since Congress party is also involved...this shouldn't be taken lightly." "I'll be writing a letter to National Security Advisor about this...There's no doubt that PM Modi has been our star campaigner... and influenced our performance," he added
summary: पीएम को धमकी को हल्के में नहीं लिया जा सकता क्योंकि इसमें कांग्रेस शामिल थी: स्वामी

text: Swimming and water sports across beaches in Goa have been closed till the end of September as the state witnessed monsoon rains from Friday and the seas are expected to be rough. An advisory issued by a lifeguard service asked visitors to not walk into water above knee-level even on days with no rain as a precaution.
summary: गोवा के समुद्र तटों पर तैराकी, पानी के खेल मानसून के दौरान बंद हो गए

text: The Pune Police has released the images of suspects who killed a youth during the Bhima-Koregaon violence which took place in January this year. The suspects had allegedly been involved in attacking the youth with sticks and stones, the police said. The violence had been triggered during a gathering by Dalits for the 200th-anniversary celebrations of the Bhima-Koregaon battle.

text: Farmers' unions across the country will mark the end of their 10-day protests with a Bharat Bandh on Sunday, June 10. Farmers across many states are on strike, demanding minimum support price, farm loan waiver, and implementation of Swaminathan Commission recommendations. Organisations said despite the strike not being as successful as anticipated, the biggest achievement was that it was peaceful.
summary: 10 जून को भारत बंद के साथ किसानों का 10 दिवसीय आंदोलन समाप्त

text: A landfill site in Gujarat's Vadodara has been converted into a tree museum after the municipal corporation planted over 12,000 saplings of nearly 100 varieties in an area of 50,000 square metres. Gardening on the site, which is reportedly worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹250 crore, began in 2016 after locals complained of the bad smell emanating from the landfill.

text: Scientists at Ahmedabad's Physical Research Laboratory have discovered an exoplanet, propelling India into a select group of countries which have found planets outside the solar system. The 'super-Neptune' is about 27 times the mass of Earth and six times its radius. It is most likely 'uninhabitable' due to the proximity to its star, 600 light-years away from Earth, scientists found.

text: Pakistan has suspended the national identity card and passport of former President Pervez Musharraf, according to reports. Musharraf could face deportation from Dubai where he is residing currently, as his stay becomes illegal following the suspension of his passport. Musharraf is facing charges of treason for subverting the Constitution after he imposed an emergency in Pakistan in 2007.
summary: पासपोर्ट रद्द होने के बाद परवेज मुशर्रफ अब पाक नागरिक नहीं हैं

text: A footage released by an animal welfare group International Animal Rescue shows an orangutan fighting a bulldozer in Indonesia which was uprooting trees it considered its home. The incident reportedly took place in 2013 but the group released the footage on June 5, the World Environment Day. The group said deforestation has led to a decline in the orangutan population.

text: Television network ABC has apologised over an episode in Priyanka Chopra starrer 'Quantico' which showed 'Indian terrorists' framing Pakistan for trying to blow up Manhattan in New York. "The episode has stirred a lot of emotion, much of which is unfairly aimed at Priyanka Chopra, who didn't create the show, nor does she write or direct it," the statement read.

text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has deferred a government notification which directed sportspersons employed with the state to pay 33% of their income to the sports council. It added that athletes will have to pay their entire income if they are considered to be on-duty by the government. The notification was put on hold after several sportspersons slammed it.

text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, whose son Arjun broke into India's Under-19 team on Thursday, never played any age-group cricket for India. The 45-year-old, who made his Test debut at the age of 16, still holds the record for being India's youngest Test and ODI debutant. Aged 14, Sachin scored a record-breaking 664-run partnership with Vinod Kambli in school cricket.

text: Indian pacer Ishant Sharma scored more runs than India teammate Cheteshwar Pujara in the County Championship 2018. Representing Sussex, the 29-year-old fast bowler hit 102 runs in six innings at an average of 25.5, while the 30-year-old batsman, playing for Yorkshire, managed 100 runs in eight innings at 12.5. Pujara's highest score was 41 while Ishant's top score was 66.

text: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan became the quickest to reach 10,000 runs and pick 500 wickets in international cricket against Afghanistan on Thursday. The 31-year-old has now joined former all-rounders Jacques Kallis and Shahid Afridi as only the third cricketer to achieve the 10,000 runs and 500 wickets double. Shakib also became the first Bangladeshi cricketer with 500 international wickets.

text: A video showing locals harassing a hungry lioness by baiting it with a chicken several times in Gujarat's Gir forest has surfaced online. text: Pakistan has banned Social Studies textbooks in private schools in Punjab province for showing Kashmir as a part of India in maps. A criminal case was filed against the book's publishers and the administration of the private schools across the province. Pakistan further banned individuals from printing, publishing, selling or prescribing textbooks or supplementary material without prior approval.

text: A video has surfaced online wherein some men wearing PM Narendra Modi masks are seen showering money on a singer at a devotional programme in Gujarat. text: Maharashtra's medical education department has transferred Dr SD Nanandkar from the post of dean at Mumbai's JJ Hospital to Kolhapur for keeping his mobile switched off and remaining unavailable at most times. text: The Islamic State on Friday recaptured major parts of the Syrian town of Albu Kamal, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. ISIS carried out its biggest attack on the town since it lost control of it last year, using at least 10 suicide bombers in the attack. Albu Kamal lies near Syria's border with Iraq.

text: Karan Johar has said that he can't wait to share "cinema space" with Shah Rukh Khan again. He further said, "Shah Rukh has been one of my best experiences in cinema...and it's something...I can't wait to repeat."

text: Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan picked up 8 wickets in 11 overs in the recently concluded T20I series against Bangladesh. text: US-based researchers have synthesised the first artificial human prion to combat a fatal form of neurodegenerative disease which is still incurable. Prions are infectious brain proteins that have folded incorrectly. They can bind to neighbouring normal proteins and trigger a domino effect that causes microscopic holes, resulting in progressive deterioration, dementia, and death, noted researchers.

text: A Shiromani Akali Dal delegation led by party chief Sukhbir Singh Badal and Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal thanked PM Narendra Modi on Friday after the Centre decided to revoke GST on langar items. text: Varanasi's Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport will become India's first airport to have an automated smart facial recognition system at its entry, security and boarding points. text: A three-year-old boy in Mumbai's Chembur died after falling into an open drain while playing near his house with his friends on Wednesday. text: India's GDP growth is likely to cross 8% in the next two years, Commerce Minister Suresh Prabhu has said. text: One out of every 100 people in the world is a refugee, the Global Peace Index (GPI) has claimed. Terrorism and internal conflict were found to be the main reasons for migration. According to the UN, out of 65.6 million refugees in 2016, 55% were from Syria, Afghanistan and South Sudan.

text: A region called Vacationland on Hawaii's Big Island had disappeared as lava poured into an ocean bay, turning it into new land. text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has declared the state open-defecation free after achieving the goal of constructing 2.77 lakh individual toilets. text: Speaking about Patanjali's messaging app 'Kimbho', Managing Director Acharya Balkrishna recently said, "We pledge not to launch the app until a team of expert hackers...plug all the security and privacy loopholes". text: Instagram now allows users to share another user's story as their own story if they are mentioned in that story. However, only public accounts can have their stories shared.

text: A Jaguar fighter jet of the Indian Air Force crashed in Gujarat's Jamnagar on Friday morning during a routine training session. This is the second incident in the last 72 hours after another Jaguar jet crashed in Gujarat's Kutch on Tuesday, killing Air Commodore Sanjay Chauhan.

text: A video of a nine-year-old Kashmiri kickboxing champion hugging Home Minister Rajnath Singh and then taking a selfie with him has gone viral. text: Facebook is planning to train its employees in Sri Lanka's local languages like Sinhala to identify inappropriate content on the platform. text: After UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to Ramdev and Patanjali Ayurved MD Acharya Balkrishna, the company said its proposed mega food park will not be shifted out of the state. text: Shah Rukh Khan has responded to a troll who questioned his silence on several issues in India and asked if his views are confined only to makeup and fashion. "I'd reply to you but I don't know if you're appropriately and fashionably dressed for my reply," the actor wrote. The troll had asked the question during a session of #AskSRK.
summary: पता नहीं अगर तुम मेरे जवाब के लिए फैशनेबल कपड़े पहने हो: SRK को ट्रोल करना

text: Ex-Australian captain Ricky Ponting will be a part of the national team's coaching staff for their upcoming tour of England. The 43-year-old will join former teammate Justin Langer, who was appointed head coach after Darren Lehmann resigned following the ball-tampering scandal. Ponting has served as assistant coach for Australia's T20I side twice before and was DD's head coach this year.

text: Kings XI Punjab and Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul has said that he would "treat his woman like a princess and not do any hiding". This comes after reports of Rahul being in a relationship with actress Nidhhi Agerwal surfaced online. "I assure you there is nothing happening. If I am seeing somebody, I'll make sure everybody knows," Rahul added.

text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share a video of himself working out at the gym with Anushka Sharma. In the video captioned "Training together makes it even better", Anushka can be seen doing cardio. "Working out like a boss...She has been going on and on...She can do more cardio than me," Kohli says in the video.

text: A spectator watching a Major League Baseball match between San Diego Padres and Atlanta Braves caught a foul ball in a cup of beer. Gabby DiMarco received a round of applause from the crowd and went on to down the beer with the ball still in the cup. "This might be the greatest highlight ever," a user tweeted.

text: Talking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's suggestion of 'one nation, one election', Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The idea is very good and Samajwadi Party is prepared to contest simultaneous elections in 2019." He further said that the voter IDs must also be linked with the Aadhaar. His comments come after the UP government supported simultaneous polls.

text: Masayoshi Son-led SoftBank's $100-billion Vision Fund has made highest investments in Uber, ARM Holdings, and NVIDIA at $9.3 billion, $8.2 billion and $5 billion respectively. SoftBank also invested $4.4 billion in WeWork and $2.5 billion in Bengaluru-based Flipkart. Further, the Japanese conglomerate invested $1.9 billion in Paytm and $0.3 billion in hotel aggregator Oyo.

text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has booked Om Prakash Shukla, the Principal of the National Defence Academy (NDA), over allegations of irregularities in appointment of the teaching faculty of the academy. text: Thousands of people in Kashmir attended the funeral of two suspected militants on Wednesday after their bodies were dug out from near LoC. The bodies were handed over to the families after legal proceedings.

text: Armed police broke into US Army whistleblower Chelsea Manning's home as part of "wellness" check after she tweeted a photo which reportedly suggested she was considering suicide. The police said they went to Manning's home after receiving multiple calls from "concerned parties". Manning had posted an image that showed her standing on a building's edge with the caption, "I'm sorry."

text: Taxi drivers have a tiring lifestyle that requires them to stay awake and/or work long hours, which leads to some of them picking up the habit of chewing tobacco. text: Actress Shabana Azmi has apologised after mistaking workers of a Malaysian eatery for Indian Railways employees. text: Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli's wax statue was unveiled at India's first and only Madame Tussauds wax museum in Delhi on Wednesday. Kohli became the third Indian cricketer after Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev to have a statue at the museum. "Presenting #TussaudsDelhi's next big unveil! text: Members of Mexico's football team held a farewell party with around 30 prostitutes before leaving for Europe ahead of the World Cup, reports said. text: China-based Unihertz has developed a 3.7-inch-long smartphone called Atom which the company claims is the 'world's smallest' 4G smartphone. text: A 28-year-old Indian man was sentenced to nearly three years' imprisonment in Singapore on Wednesday for spiking his female flatmate's drink with a plan to rape her. Annadurai Prabakaran, who works as a private bus driver, had been working in Singapore for 7 years.

text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping is the only world leader with whom he celebrated his birthday. Calling Xi  a "reliable partner and good friend", Putin added that the Chinese President is "a very accessible and a very sincere person". The Russian President is scheduled to visit China on an official visit later this week.

text: The US will begin using facial recognition technology as part of a pilot programme at its border with Mexico to scan images of people travelling inside vehicles. The images captured will be matched with government documents, including passports and visas. This would help in verifying travellers before they get to the border checkpoint, according to reports.

text: Malaysia's AirAsia Group has said the company and its CEO Tony Fernandes have not received summons to appear before CBI over a corruption probe. The CBI has accused the airline and its employees of bribing government officials to obtain international flying licence for AirAsia India. Earlier, reports said that Fernandes had been asked to appear before CBI on June 6.

text: A video showing rats running inside bags filled with hamburger buns at a Burger King outlet in US' Wilmington has gone viral on social media. Authorities had temporarily shut down the location last week citing "imminent health hazard". The inspecting officers found rat droppings on the burger buns as well as on the floor near the storage and cooking areas.

Pro-Kannada outfits have threatened to stall the film's release after Rajinikanth said Karnataka should implement the Supreme Court order on Cauvery water sharing.

text: Afghanistan's 17-year-old spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman has revealed that Kings XI Punjab captain Ravichandran Ashwin would sometimes tell him that he bowls better than him. "That would make my day," he added. "I had been following Ashwin and Sunil Narine for a long time...Getting picked for a team led by Ashwin was like a dream come true," Mujeeb further said.

text: Addressing a rally in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, Congress President Rahul Gandhi today said, "Make in India is a failure. Everything is made in China, China, China." Referring to a meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he added, "Our PM is swinging on a swing with the Chinese leader in Gujarat."

text: The Large Hadron Collider, the world's most powerful particle accelerator has detected the Higgs boson again, which is often dubbed the "God particle". Higgs boson is known to interact only with massive particles, but was discovered in its decay to two massless photons, said researchers, adding "this is why the Higgs boson is seen as a portal to new physics".

text: The police have booked a man working in the Gulf for allegedly threatening to kill Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and attack his family in a video. summary: केरल के सीएम को मारने की धमकी, बाद में मांगी माफी

text: Hours after militants attacked an Indian Army camp in Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti said militants were "desperately" trying to sabotage the Ramadan ceasefire. text: The Delhi Medical Council has cancelled the licence of a lab in Defence Colony after it wrongly declared a man HIV-positive. "I was about to take up a new job at an MNC in Delhi. text: Pakistani drug smugglers are using drones to smuggle drugs across the border in India, reports quoting BSF officials said. As many as 37 drones were reportedly sighted by the BSF at the Punjab border last year. Scuba divers from across the border have also been reported to be delivering drugs using the gaps in the Sutlej and Ravi rivers.

text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Wednesday said makers of Rajinikanth-starrer 'Kaala' should avoid releasing it in the state "considering the situation." He said, "as a Kannadiga, in such situation where there is opposition, it is ideal if they will not release the movie." Pro-Kannada outfits have sought a ban on 'Kaala' opposing Rajinikanth's views on the Cauvery water dispute.

text: The Archaeological Survey of India has unearthed chariots, swords, and caskets dating back to 2200 BC-1800 BC in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. This is reportedly the first-ever physical evidence of chariots dating back to the Bronze Age. Based on the remains excavated, the ASI said that it seems like the region belonged to the warrior class in the past.

text: A 27-year-old IAF flight lieutenant named Himanshu Gupta died at a government hospital in Bhopal on Tuesday, the police said. The cause of death is under investigation as some poisonous content was found in his body, the police added. Gupta had reportedly complained of difficulty in breathing and stiffness in his chest before he passed away.
summary: भारतीय वायुसेना अधिकारी की मृत्यु हो जाती है, पुलिस का कहना है कि 'जहरीली सामग्री' शरीर में पाई जाती है

text: Switzerland may review Facebook, Twitter and other social media profiles of migrants before granting them asylum, according to reports. Information posted on the social media platforms could provide a better understanding of the applicants, including their family relationships, officials said. More than 18,000 migrants had sought asylum in Switzerland last year.

text: Kalpana Kumari, who recently topped the CBSE NEET 2018 exam, also topped Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) Class 12 exam on Wednesday. The 18-year-old scored 434 marks out of 500 in the science stream. Kumari, who prepared for NEET in Delhi, secured 99.99 percentile in NEET 2018 with 691 marks out of 720.

text: The announcement video of Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Stree' has been released. The horror comedy film is scheduled to release on August 31.

text: Former Windies captain Brian Lara became the first cricketer in history to score 500-plus runs in a first-class innings on June 6, 1994. Playing for Warwickshire against Durham, Lara slammed a record 308 runs in boundaries (62 fours, 10 sixes) in his world record innings of 501*(427). Lara spent almost eight hours on the crease during his knock.

text: Forbes list of the world's highest-paid athletes has featured no woman this year while tennis star Serena Williams was the lone female athlete in top 100 last year. Williams' prize money dropped from $8 million to $62,000 as she gave birth last September while Maria Sharapova, who was also featured earlier, faced a 15-month suspension for using a banned substance.

text: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath received miniature statues of himself and PM Narendra Modi on his 46th birthday, the party is planning to place replicas of the statues in BJP offices across the state. text: Addressing farmers in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "I will not tell you my 'mann ki baat' but I will listen to yours." text: World's richest man and Amazon's CEO Jeff Bezos penned an open letter to customers on the company's fifth anniversary in India. text: UK-based researchers have developed a new way to grow mineralised materials which they claim could regenerate dental enamel and bone. Enamel, located on the outer part of teeth, is the hardest tissue in the human body, however, it cannot regenerate like other tissues. The researchers grew enamel-like ordered mineralised structures from nano-crystals based on a specific protein.

text: A doctor in Kerala said he took the responsibility of handling the last rites of 12 patients who died of the Nipah virus. The 41-year-old doctor said the relatives of several patients chose to stay away due to fear of contracting the virus. He said, "I did not have to think twice...It was my duty."

text: A video of Virginia State Police chasing an armoured vehicle allegedly stolen by a US National Guard soldier has surfaced online. text: Offering his "heartfelt apologies" for saying a woman could not do his job, Qatar Airways CEO Akbar Al Baker said it was "just a joke". Baker's earlier comments came after he was elected as the chairman of airlines group International Air Transport Association.

text: US subscription management company Zuora gave a share of its stock to each of the guests who attended its annual conference on Tuesday. "We're doing something a little wonky. text: Salman Khan has said action in films should look genuine and believable and not make people laugh. "It's a lot of strain and hard work. text: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a picture from his childhood with his late father, actor Sunil Dutt on the occasion of his birth anniversary today. "He lives in me... text: Karnataka BJP leader CT Ravi has claimed that a conspiracy was being hatched on a global level to prevent PM Narendra Modi from being re-elected in the 2019 elections. text: Addressing a rally in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur on Wednesday, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "Prime Minister Narendra Modi calls Mehul Choksi Mehul bhai and Nirav Modi, Nirav bhai." text: Physicists at US' National Institute of Standards and Technology constantly monitored 12 high-precision atomic clocks spread around the world from 1999 to 2014. The clocks remained synchronised for over 14 years, proving the theory.

text: As many as 11 motorcycles which were parked in unauthorised parking spaces or outside malls were stolen in separate incidents in Gurugram on Saturday and Sunday. text: Police detained a man in Odisha for allegedly impersonating as an IAS officer and marrying a woman in the state's Damodarpur village. text: Luxury fashion designer Kate Spade who allegedly committed suicide on Tuesday, left a note for her daughter which reportedly read, "Bea - I have always loved you. This is not your fault. text: Tesla is producing 3,500 Model 3 cars a week on an average, CEO Elon Musk said during the company's annual shareholder meeting on Tuesday. text: Comparing his calls with US President Donald Trump to sausages, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "It's better not to explain what's inside." text: Defending his kiss on the lips of a married Filipino woman in South Korea, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has said he will resign if enough women are offended and sign a petition calling for him to step down. text: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that US President Donald Trump's decision to set up a meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was "brave and mature". A petitioner had earlier approached the court claiming his copyright-protected work related to story scenes and songs were used by the film's producer without permission.

text: Cricket Australia CEO James Sutherland has resigned from the post after 17 years, giving a 12-month notice period. text: One of the goal nets from Brazil's worst World Cup defeat, which occurred in the 2014 semifinal against Germany, will be cut up and sold for charity. text: Facebook's photo-sharing app Instagram may let users post videos that last up to an hour, as per reports. text: Long thought to be silent because of ice cover, East Antarctica is actually seismically active, a US-based study confirmed. "Lack of seismicity wasn't due to a lack of events but a lack of instruments close enough to record it," said the lead researcher, as only nine events were recorded until 2009, while 27 were registered in the same year alone.

text: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has ordered that only one approved dog can be kept in a flat and an independent house cannot have more than three. text: A CCTV footage of a restaurant in Mumbai has surfaced, wherein a man could be seen jumping off his seat and throwing his phone out of his shirt's front pocket after it exploded. text: Police have arrested five people, including prominent lawyer Surendra Gadling and a Delhi man Rana Jacob, in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon riots in Maharashtra in January. Police also searched the house of a Nagpur university's professor with alleged Maoist links. text: A Russian man, while digging a vegetable patch in his partner's garden in Siberia, found human bones that turned out to be those of his partner's ex-boyfriend. text: The co-leader of German political party Alternative for Germany, Alexander Gauland, had to walk to a police station from the shores of a lake wearing only his boxers after his clothes were stolen while he was swimming. text: The Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport near Varanasi is set to become the first Indian airport to have a national highway underneath its runway. text: The 1964 film 'Yaadein', which was directed and produced by Sanjay Dutt's late father Sunil Dutt, was the world's first feature film to star only one actor. text: In a first, a woman with advanced breast cancer that had spread around her body has been successfully treated, American doctors have announced. text: About 1.4 billion years ago, a day on Earth lasted 18 hours 41 minutes, partly because the Moon was closer, according to a US-based study. text: Several bundles of answer sheets of BSc (Botany) exam were gutted in a fire that broke out at Hyderabad's Osmania University's Valuation Centre on Tuesday. text: India extracts more groundwater than China and the US combined, and accounts for a quarter of the groundwater extracted globally, a study by WaterAid has revealed. text: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte accidentally spilled coffee in the Parliament and cleaned up the mess himself. text: The Delhi High Court has restrained HM Megabrands from using the trade name 'HM' or variations similar to Hennes & Mauritz (H&M). The theme of this year's edition, 'Beat Plastic Pollution', urges people around the world to explore sustainable alternatives and urgently reduce production and excessive use of single-use plastic. PM Narendra Modi will address an event marking the World Environment Day.
summary: भारत 2018 विश्व पर्यावरण दिवस की मेजबानी करता है

text: A man had halted the movement of tanks ordered to kill student protesters during the 1989 pro-democracy protests in China's Tiananmen Square on June 5. The 19-year-old, better known as the 'Tank Man', was identified by a British publication as Wang Weilin. He had halted the tanks by displaying his palm and climbed up the front of the lead tank.
summary: चीन के तियानमेन स्क्वायर विरोध का 'टैंक मैन' कौन था?

text: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's eldest son Akash is set to get formally engaged to diamond heiress Shloka Mehta on June 30. According to the official save the date invitation, the ceremony will take place in Mumbai. The couple, who studied together at Dhirubhai Ambani International School, will reportedly get married later this year.
summary: आकाश अंबानी औपचारिक रूप से 30 जून को श्लोका से सगाई करने वाले हैं

text: Following her apology to Sunny Leone on a reality show over comments made against her, Rakhi Sawant said, "I feel sorry for...the things I said against her." "Now she's a mother, I shouldn't say anything bad about her," Rakhi added. She further said, "Earlier I was totally against her because she was a porn star. But...she has been working hard."
summary: मुझे सनी लियोन: राखी के खिलाफ कही गई बातों पर खेद है

text: Arjun Kapoor has slammed a media house for publishing an article on his half-sister Janhvi Kapoor's outfit being trolled by social media users. "Ridiculous how trolls are given attention by the media...the lesser the stories the lesser the trolls win," he tweeted. Social media users, while trolling Janhvi's outfit, had written that she 'forgot' to wear jeans.
summary: बहन जान्हवी की ड्रेस पर आर्टिकल के लिए अर्जुन ने मीडिया हाउस की खिंचाई की

text: Supporting Swara Bhasker who was trolled for calling Pakistan a 'failing state', Sonam Kapoor said, "I think people just like to troll her because she has an opinion." Swara had made the remark on being asked about her film 'Veere Di Wedding' being banned in Pakistan. Following her statement, she was also slammed by Pakistani actress Urwa Hocane.
summary: लोग स्वरा को ट्रोल करना पसंद करते हैं क्योंकि उनकी एक राय है: सोनम

text: Reacting to Indian football team defeating Kenya in jam-packed Mumbai Football Arena, a user tweeted, "What a cheerful atmosphere...looks like soon football will be our religion." Other tweets read, "Such is the impact of Chhetri video that even God has shown his presence in the form of rain," and "Fans today be like...Divided by: Messi and Ronaldo...United by: Sunil Chhetri."

text: Indian footballers along with fans in the Mumbai Football Arena performed the Viking Clap celebration after a 3-0 win against Kenya on Monday. Tickets to the match were sold out after captain Sunil Chhetri urged people to show up to their matches. Notably, the Viking Clap celebration was made popular by the Iceland football team during their Euro 2016 campaign.
summary: भारतीय फुटबॉल खिलाड़ी, प्रशंसक 'वाइकिंग क्लैप' का जश्न मनाते हैं

text: Indian captain Sunil Chhetri, who posted a plea to Indian people to show up for matches, took to Twitter to thank the fans for the sold-out stands during India's 3-0 win over Kenya. In his plea, Chhetri had urged people to "please come and watch us in the stadiums... abuse us, criticise us... but please get involved".
summary: छेत्री भारत के मैच के लिए बिकने वाले प्रशंसकों के लिए धन्यवाद करते हैं

text: A TMC worker was shot dead on Monday night by three unidentified assailants in West Bengal's Howrah, days after the death of two BJP workers. The ruling TMC has blamed the BJP for the murder of Mohsin Khan, whose wife won the recently-concluded panchayat elections in May. The rural elections were also marred with violence between the political parties.
summary: 2 बीजेपी पुरुषों की मौत के बाद टीएमसी कार्यकर्ता की डब्ल्यू बंगाल में गोली मारकर हत्या

text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday met yoga guru Ramdev to seek support for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, as part of his 'Sampark for Samarthan' campaign. The BJP chief and other leaders will meet at least 50 eminent personalities who supported the party during the last elections and inform them about the work done in the last four years.
summary: 2019 चुनाव के लिए समर्थन मांगने के लिए रामदेव से मिले भाजपा अध्यक्ष प्रीज़ शाह

text: Researchers are developing a blood test called liquid biopsy, which can screen for 10 different cancer types before the symptoms appear in the patient. The test was most accurate for diagnosing pancreatic, ovarian and liver cancers, though number of detections was small. "This is potentially the holy grail of cancer research," said the study's author at world's largest oncology conference.
summary: लक्षण बनने से पहले 10 कैंसर का पता लगाने के लिए रक्त परीक्षण

text: A woman in West Bengal gave birth to a healthy baby hours after a lab report said she was carrying a dead foetus, according to her family. The woman had experienced labour pains and visited the laboratory, whose report had read "Intra-uterine fetal death at 32 weeks 5 days." The family has now lodged a police complaint against the laboratory.
