text: International passengers buying goods at airport duty-free shops will not be subjected to GST, according to officials. The duty-free shops will have to only collect a copy of the passport from the passenger and later seek GST refund from the government. The revenue department will issue a clarification stating that duty-free shops would not levy GST, the official added.
summary: Int'l यात्रियों को एयरपोर्ट ड्यूटी-फ्री दुकानों पर GST का भुगतान करने की आवश्यकता नहीं है

text: World number one Test bowler Kagiso Rabada bagged six trophies of the eight he was eligible for at the annual Cricket South Africa awards on Saturday, becoming the first cricketer to achieve the feat twice. The 23-year-old joined Jacques Kallis, Makhaya Ntini, Hashim Amla and AB de Villiers as two-time winner of the top SA Cricketer of the Year award.
summary: 23-वर्षीय रबाडा ने वार्षिक पुरस्कार समारोह में 6 ट्राफियां खरीदीं

text: Spain's world number one tennis player Rafael Nadal, who turned 32 today, has an asteroid named after him. The asteroid, discovered by an astronomical observatory on Nadal's home island of Majorca, was named after him when he beat Roger Federer in the Wimbledon 2008 final. Nadal's birthday coincides with French Open, a tournament he has won a record 10 times.
summary: टेनिस स्टार राफेल नडाल के नाम पर एक क्षुद्रग्रह है

text: Muhammad Ali's youngest daughter Laila Ali retired as an unbeaten boxer after having held the WBC, WIBA, IWBF, IBA super-middleweight titles alongside the IWBF light-heavyweight title. Laila, who had a 24-0 win-loss record with 21 knock-outs, once fought Joe Frazier's daughter Jackie Frazier-Lyde in the 'Ali/Frazier IV' match, a reference to the three historic boxing bouts between their fathers.
summary: मुहम्मद अली की सबसे छोटी बेटी नाबाद बॉक्सर के रूप में सेवानिवृत्त हुई

text: The Nigerian football team's over 30 lakh World Cup replica shirts were sold out within 15 minutes after being made available for pre-order online on Friday. Long queues were seen outside a store in London. The Nigerian football team is ranked 47th in the world and is in the same group as Argentina, Croatia, and Iceland for the upcoming edition.
summary: नाइजीरिया के WC किट 30 लाख प्री-ऑर्डर के बाद 15 मिनट में बिक गए

text: Indian batsman Shikhar Dhawan has revealed that his 'Jatt Gabru' celebration that he does after taking a catch in the field has been inspired from the sport of kabaddi. Dhawan said when he was in Australia, he took Shane Watson's catch and since he likes to watch kabaddi he adopted the celebration. "It's [kabaddi] a manly sport," Dhawan said.

text: Alibaba has introduced a self-driving robot called 'G Plus' that uses LiDAR technology to navigate at a speed of about 16 kmph. It also uses facial recognition to ensure the right recipient before opening the package locker. G Plus which is being developed along with Chinese company RoboSense is expected to begin commercial production by the end of this year.
summary: अलीबाबा डिलीवरी रोबोट पेश करता है जो 16 किमी प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से यात्रा कर सकता है

text: A passenger onboard a Dubai-Mumbai Air India flight prompted a scare after he dropped a burning cigarette stub in the bathroom's dustbin which caught fire. The cabin crew managed to douse the fire as soon as they detected the smoke coming from the bathroom. The passenger who had lit the cigarette was handed over to the police.

text: After several Congress leaders expressed dissatisfaction at his going to an RSS event, former President Pranab Mukherjee was quoted by a Bengali daily as saying, "Whatever I have to say, I will say in Nagpur." "I have received several letters, requests and phone calls, but I have not responded to anyone yet," he added.
summary: जो कुछ भी मैं कहना चाहता हूं, वह आरएसएस के कार्यक्रम में कहेंगे: एक्स-प्रीज प्रणब

text: After senior Congress leader SR Patil resigned from his post of North Karnataka Congress Working President, the BJP tweeted, "The downfall of the empire that was built after mocking people's mandate has begun." Patil tendered his resignation from the post to Congress President Rahul Gandhi taking moral responsibility for the party's performance in the recently-concluded Assembly elections.
summary: साम्राज्य का पतन शुरू होता है: केतका कांग नेता के इस्तीफे के रूप में भाजपा

text: Textiles Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said that the coming together of several parties against the BJP is a backhanded compliment to PM Narendra Modi as it shows they can't win on their own. text: German automotive giant Daimler is reportedly facing a $4.4-billion fine from the country's transport ministry over a diesel emissions scandal. Reports further claimed that a total of 750,000 Mercedes vehicles could be affected. The carmaker and the transport ministry has agreed to clear the technical issues related to diesel emissions, a spokesperson for the ministry said in an email.

text: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Deb on Sunday said that if the youth took up Union Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore's fitness challenge then the state would develop a 56-inch chest. Adding that he himself had accepted the challenge and done 20 push-ups, the CM said, "If all youths do push-ups, they will become healthy and Tripura will become healthy too."

text: Visakhapatnam Police has rescued 22 Indians stranded in UAE's Abu Dhabi after they reached out to the police on Twitter. text: Tata Sons has rejected impropriety allegations by a US news website over Tata Trusts' $50-million gift to Harvard Business School in 2010. text: South Korea has asked India to remove restrictions on gold and silver imports, which were imposed in August 2017 to check abuse of Free Trade Agreement. text: The country's largest fuel retailer Indian Oil Corporation has increased the prices of aviation turbine fuel for the 11th straight month, adding to the costs of airlines. The state-owned company raised prices by 7% over the previous month, the biggest hike in 17 months. Jet fuel will now cost Ã¢ÂÂ¹71,245 per kilolitre on an average across India.

text: The Indian women's cricket team dismissed their Malaysian counterparts for 27 runs in 13.4 overs to register a 142-run win in their opening match of the Asia Cup, a tournament they have won six times. text: A four-year-old girl in Haryana's Faridabad was allegedly raped and stabbed before her body was stuffed inside a huge container. The accused, who worked at the victim's father's shop, had left the shop with the victim, promising to drop her home. When the girl didn't reach home, locals went to the accused's house and found her body in the container.

text: Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu has asked French aircraft manufacturer Airbus to build planes in India under the 'Make in India' initiative. Prabhu visited the Airbus facility in France's Toulouse on Friday during his ongoing visit to the country.

Dubey, a promoter of Singapore-based HNR Trading, was questioned about the payment of Ã¢ÂÂ¹12.28 crore from AirAsia India on the basis of a "sham contract". CBI alleged the money was utilised for paying bribe to unknown government officials.

text: After Air India's sale bid closed without a single offer, the Finance Ministry is reportedly planning to include the carrier's prime real estate to make it more lucrative for the buyer. The properties were earlier excluded from the deal. According to the bid proposal, Air India's buyer was also required to take over a debt of Ã¢ÂÂ¹33,392 crore.

text: Losses by public sector banks in FY18 have almost entirely wiped out government's capital injections of $13 billion, ratings agency Fitch has said. It added that the situation is unlikely to improve in the current fiscal year. Fitch further said the poor results are due to revision in bad loan recognition norms, that should be beneficial over the long term.
summary: बैंक के घाटे ने सरकार के $ 13 bn पूंजी के नुकसान को मिटा दिया: फिच

text: An average employee in Mumbai works 3,315 hours a year, the most among 77 major cities of the world, according to a study by Swiss investment bank UBS. Mumbaikars work more than twice as much as major European cities like Rome (1,581 hours) or Paris (1,662 hours). Mumbai was followed by Hanoi, Mexico City, New Delhi and Bogota.

text: Actress Shilpa Shetty has said that she wants to do a funny film that is entertaining and if possible show it to her son Viaan Raj Kundra. She added, "I am not interested in doing drama." She further said that she does get film scripts but after a few pages she feels she has done such films before.

text: In an open letter on remix versions of songs, Lata Mangeshkar wrote that she feels hurt when the original tune is  distorted and new and cheap words are added. She further wrote, "Totally distorting the song is absolutely wrong." She added, "I request (recording) companies...to look at songs...as something that reflects our culture."
summary: मूल गीतों को रीमिक्स करने के लिए सस्ते शब्द जोड़ने से मुझे दर्द होता है: लता

text: Pakistani international batsman Fawad Alam broke a window pane after he was given 'timed out' while playing for the Clitheroe Cricket Club in England's Lancashire League. As per the law 40 of the Laws of Cricket, an incoming batsman must take the position to bat within three minutes of the dismissal of his or her teammate.
summary: पाक इंटल बैट्समैन ने दी 'आउट आउट'

text: Bangladesh players including captain Shakib Al Hasan sung and performed to a Bengali song named 'Oporadhi' in the dressing room. Bangladesh are in India to face Afghanistan in a series, whose matches are being hosted in Dehradun.

text: Researchers at MIT have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool called Norman which they claim is the world's first 'psychopathic' AI. They claim that Norman was trained on image captions from a subreddit dedicated to documenting death. As a result, where "normal" AI sees a couple of people standing in an image, Norman sees a man jumping from a window.

text: A section of sellers has accused Amazon of favouring a particular merchant Cloudtail India over others and plan to take up the issue with the Competition Commission of India (CCI). Interestingly, Cloudtail is a joint venture between Amazon and Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures.

text: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has written a letter to former President Pranab Mukherjee asking him to not attend an RSS event on June 7 in Nagpur. text: The Karnataka government recently issued a circular banning teachers at private and government schools from using mobiles and allowing the students to report if the ban is not adhered to. text: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) OP Rawat onÃ¢ÂÂSaturday said that the identities of those using the commission's mobile app to expose electoral malpractices will not be disclosed. "The mobile app empowers the common man to send complaints with evidences," Rawat added. The app, used on a pilot basis in the Karnataka polls, received 780 video complaints of electoral malpractices.

text: The All India Jat Aarakshan Sangharsh Samiti has threatened to disrupt Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's events and rallies if the government did not act to vacate the court stay on their reservation. text: The Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority has declared 7 buildings in Mumbai as 'extremely dangerous', while 93 buildings have been declared 'dangerous'. These seven buildings are believed to be more than 50 years old.

text: The Hindu Janajagruti Samiti on Saturday claimed that the man arrested recently for allegedly murdering journalist Gauri Lankesh has not been part of the organisation since 2008. The organisation added that he left for personal reasons and is not in touch with them. Lankesh was shot dead outside her home in Bengaluru in September last year.
summary: गौरी लंकेश की हत्या के आरोपियों ने 2008 में हमें छोड़ दिया: हिंदू निकाय

text: Congress Councillor Gurdeep Singh was shot dead by unidentified assailants at a wrestling arena in a stadium in Amritsar's Gol Bagh on Saturday. Singh was taking a shower after his practice when three masked assailants barged into the bathroom and shot him dead. Before fleeing the arena, the accused fired 17 shots in the air.

text: BJP leader Jagannath Singh Raghuvanshi on Saturday allegedly threatened a government employee for asking him to clear his Ã¢ÂÂ¹4-lakh electricity bill in Madhya Pradesh's Isagarh. text: The Indian Navy on Sunday deployed a ship to rescue 38 Indians stranded in and around Yemen's Socotra island after cyclone Mekunu hit the area. text: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire has warned that the US has a few days to take urgent measures if it wants to avoid a trade war with the European Union. text: Following his meeting with senior North Korean official Kim Yong-chol, US President Donald Trump said he had received a letter sent by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and that it was "very nice and very interesting". text: Following his decision to impose tariffs on metal imports from the EU, Canada, and Mexico, US President Donald Trump on Saturday said, "The US has been ripped off by other countries for years on trade." text: The policies being pursued by US President Donald Trump are likely to worsen the problem of child poverty in the country, the UN Special Rapporteur on extreme poverty and human rights has said. text: Officials in Thailand said that a whale has died in the southern part of the nation after swallowing more than 80 plastic bags weighing around 8 kgs. A veterinary team tried stabilising its illness but failed. The nation is one of the world's largest consumers of plastic bags, which results in deaths of hundreds of marine creatures each year.

text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri on Saturday posted a video on Twitter, urging the countrymen to watch their matches from the stadiums. text: Former Brazilian footballer Roberto Carlos scored a 35-metre banana free kick, called the 'goal which defied Physics', with no direct line to the goal against France on June 3, 1997. The rotations of the ball about its axis created a pressure difference on its sides, making it curve towards the goal. This phenomenon is known as the Magnus Effect.

text: Besides an orchid at National Orchid Garden in Singapore which was named 'Dendrobium Narendra Modi' on Saturday, PM Modi has two more flowers named after him. Last year, a fast-growing Israeli Crysanthumun was named 'MODI' during the PM Modi's visit to the nation. An orchid grown in Sikkim was named 'Cymbidium Namo' in 2016 by the state CM Pawan Chamling.

text: A couple from Kerala's Kochi abandoned their two-day-old baby outside a church, fearing being shamed by the society for having a fourth child, police said. CCTV footage shows the 32-year-old father kissing the baby's forehead before abandoning the child. The couple's friends and family mocked them after getting to know about the woman's pregnancy.

text: 'From Kargil To The Coup', written by Nasim Zehra, has claimed that former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif was unaware of the Army's operation to infiltrate key positions in the Kargil sector which began in January 1999. text: The Himachal Pradesh Department of Education on Saturday decided to close all government schools in Shimla from June 4 to June 8 due to the water crisis in the region. text: Swedish furniture giant IKEA will open its first store in India in Hyderabad this July, Ikea India's Maharashtra market manager Per Hornell has said. text: Rohit Sharma will become the first Indian cricketer to throw the ceremonial 'First Pitch' in a Major League Baseball match. text: The Criminal Investigation Department will investigate the death of two BJP workers who were found hanging in West Bengal's Balrampur, police said. text: After the Nipah virus outbreak in Kerala claimed at least 18 lives, the state government announced that schools and colleges in Kozhikode will remain shut till June 12. text: The American state of Vermont is paying people $10,000 (approximately Ã¢ÂÂ¹6.7 lakh) to relocate to the state and work remotely while residing in the state. text: After two BJP workers were found hanging in West Bengal's Balrampur district this week, BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain termed the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) party as the "Taliban Congress party". text: Stating that the terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir is at its "last stage", Union Minister Jitendra Singh said, "The decisive actions that the government has taken...600 terrorists have been killed during the period (tenure)." text: Stanford University scientists have developed an artificial sensory nerve system that could lend a sense of touch in prosthetic limbs and give future robots reflex capability. text: A plea has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking directions to the Centre to declare the disputed Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid site in Ayodhya as "national heritage". text: As many as 15 people were killed and nine were injured in the thunderstorm that had hit several parts of Uttar Pradesh on Friday. text: Around 1,000 constables will be deployed only for patrolling purposes at night in Gurugram, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has said. text: Sheena Bora-murder accused Indrani Mukerjea has been admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital after complaints of chest pain on Friday night. text: The India Meteorological Department has said that dust and thunderstorms are likely to occur in the Delhi-NCR region on Saturday afternoon and evening. text: Bangladesh has expressed its concerns over reports that China is planning to construct dams on the Brahmaputra river. Bangladesh's High Commissioner to India, Syed Muazzem Ali said that his country was "very concerned about the diversion of water...and is prepared to participate in a joint water basin management," both in the Ganges and the Brahmaputra.

text: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan has confessed to involvement in betting in IPL, as per Thane's anti-extortion cell. text: With first-day earnings of Ã¢ÂÂ¹10.70 crore, Sonam Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' beat Akshay Kumar's 'PadMan' to become the third highest opener of 2018 in India. text: Question-and-answer platform Quora was launched in Hindi on Thursday while the company's India head Gautam Shewakramani said other Indian languages would be available within a few months. text: Technology giant Microsoft is in talks to acquire web-hosting service GitHub for around $5 billion, according to reports. text: Using data from NASA's Kepler Space Telescope, astronomers have identified 121 exoplanets that potentially host moons capable of supporting life. text: The Kerala High Court on Friday allowed a 19-year-old Muslim girl and an 18-year-old Muslim boy to live together, stating it cannot shut eyes to the reality of live-in relationships. text: The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz party-led government became the second civilian government to complete a full term in Pakistan since its formation in 1947. A caretaker government headed by Nasirul Mulk assumed power to oversee the upcoming general elections in the country in July.

This causes electrons to breakdown and converts their kinetic energy to heat.

text: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano, which has been erupting for the past several weeks, is creating its own weather, the US Geological Survey has said. text: Sharks are equipped with an electro-sensing organ that allows them to detect the slightest disturbances from nearby prey amid background noises, according to a US-based study. text: Scientists have identified the oldest known lizard, a reptile that lived about 240 million years ago when Earth had a single continent geographically and dinosaurs had just emerged. The discovery pushed back the origins of lizards by 75 million years, said researchers.

text: In an attempt to avoid robbery of water due to scarcity, people in Rajasthan's Parasrampura village have started locking their water drums. The village residents get drinking water once a week that has led to an increase in the number of such robberies. "Looking at circumstances, it (water) has become more precious to us than gold," a local said.
summary: पानी की लूट को लेकर लोग राज गाँव में पानी के ड्रम बंद कर देते हैं

text: Villagers locked a school in Haryana's Palwal as protest after all 51 students who gave CBSE Class 10 exam failed. The principal was shifted temporarily after villagers agreed to unlock it only if he is changed. "We had already raised the issue of poor education system in our school with the state government, but nothing happened," the village head said.
summary: कक्षा 10 की परीक्षा में सभी छात्र फेल होने के बाद ग्रामीणों ने स्कूल पर ताला लगा दिया

text: The government has directed public sector undertakings to recognise diplomas and degrees acquired through open and distance learning from UGC-recognised universities for employment purposes. This comes after the HRD Ministry had written to the Department of Public Enterprises saying it has been receiving complaints about PSUs not recognising such degrees/diplomas for recruitment purposes.
summary: भर्ती के लिए ओपन, डिस्टेंस डिग्री स्वीकार करें: सरकारी उपक्रमों के लिए

text: Renowned travel and tourism company SOTC has launched a unique holiday package that will take travellers on train adventures to different locations across the world - 'The Great Rail Journeys'. From elegant Europe to scintillating China, travel across snowy landscapes, majestic mountains and lush green valleys at prices starting at Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,18,000. Limited seats available on a first come, first-served basis.
summary: SOTC द्वारा शुरू की गई थीम्ड छुट्टियां

text: An 18-year-old BJP worker was found hanging from a tree in West Bengal's Purulia on Wednesday. "This is for doing BJP politics from age 18. Been trying to kill you since the election but failed. Today you are dead," the killer wrote on Trilochan Mahato's shirt. A note with similar warning was found at his feet.
summary: बीजेपी कार्यकर्ता पेड़ पर हत्यारे के नोट के साथ शर्ट से लटका हुआ मिला

text: Former North Korean spy chief Kim Yong-chol on Wednesday arrived in New York, becoming the most senior North Korean official to visit the US since 2000. An adviser to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, Yong-chol met US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo amid uncertainty over the June 12 summit between the leaders of the two countries.
summary: 18 साल में अमेरिका का दौरा करने वाले किम योंग-चोएल 1 एन कोरियाई अधिकारी

text: At a meeting regarding farm loan waivers, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said, "Even though I don't have the blessings of the people, 'punyatma' (good soul) Rahul Gandhi placing trust in me has given me power." He told farmers, "Taking him into confidence, I will have to come to a decision... All your wishes will be fulfilled, but give us time."
summary: 'पुण्यात्मा' राहुल गांधी का भरोसा मुझे शक्ति देता है: कर्नाटक के सीएम

text: The BJP got Ã¢ÂÂ¹532.27 crore in donations exceeding Ã¢ÂÂ¹20,000 in 2016-17, an Association for Democratic Reforms report has revealed. This amount is over 12 times the donations received by the Congress in excess of Ã¢ÂÂ¹20,000, the report added. Further, the BJP reported a total income of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,034.27 crore in the year, which was 4.6 times the income of Congress.
summary: भाजपा को ¢20,000 से ऊपर के दान में ¢ don532 करोड़ मिले: ADR रिपोर्ट

text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee accepted RSS' invitation to attend their event, Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "Sir you have accepted invitation, please go there and tell them (RSS) what's wrong with their ideology." Earlier, some Congress leaders wrote to the former President, requesting him to "reconsider and avoid" visiting the RSS event.
summary: एक्स-प्रीज़ को आरएसएस को बताना चाहिए कि उनके साथ क्या गलत है: चिदंबरम

text: Asserting that saving farmers is his government's priority, Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy promised to waive farm loans within 15 days and insisted that there was "no going back" on it. "I'm getting it (the loan amount) calculated, whatever thousand crore rupees it is... Saving you is our government's responsibility," he told a gathering of farmers.
summary: K'taka CM कुमारस्वामी ने 15 दिनों में कृषि ऋण माफी का वादा किया

text: Pointing out that the price of petrol and diesel has changed by 1 paisa before, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "However, today (Wednesday) one of our employees made a mistake." "Since we moved to...mechanism of daily price change, prices have gone up and down by 1 paisa, 12 paise, 27 paise," he added.
summary: हमारे कर्मचारियों द्वारा पेट्रोल की कीमत में 1p की गिरावट: तेल मंत्री
